description:
Firstly, I need to say after coming here once I really am looking forward to stopping in again. And maybe a few more times after that. This place is tiny! The tiny-ness is definitely felt if you have to use the crazy tiny restroom which I'm sure the employees love. 
What this place lacks for in size is totally made up for in the quality of their food. Their specials all sounded so so good and I ended up picking the scramble with Brie, artichoke, veggies, and walnut toast, and my sister had their famous croissant French toast with strawberries.

You know that feeling you get when you are full and you can't imagine taking another bite? Well, I ignored that and finished my food because it would've turned into severe regret on the drive back home. 

There is so much on their menu but if I must recommend anything, you need to try their specials! They're special for a reason, deliciousness.
author: Adrianne L.

description:
Boy was I hungry and craving breakfast...again. 
I'd showed my friend how to Yelp and they successfully had found this location to partake in some grub. 
We were sat pretty quickly which was nice. Opted for outdoor seating despite the heat that was present. 
We both ordered the Croissant French Toast. 
*pause*
Mmhmm... CROISSANT. FRENCH. TOAST. 
Lately these brunch places I've been visiting have been serving some rather larger than life portions so, I decided to go with the "small" portion of French toast which was certainly a mistake. That damn French toast was so bitter and delicious and flaky and all the things that could go right. 
Aside from the portion size. It was so...skimpy. I felt like for $10.25 it should've been a smidge larger. But that's what my cheap self gets. Got a side of chicken apple sausage and skipped on the side of egg since they only served it scrambled *ew*
I'm a bit on the fence on whether or not I'd come back. 
But I will say, this place is worth the experience of that French toast
author: Taisha Y.

description:
Great Tasty Food, great spot,  super quick food delivery, been coming here for many years. 

Sorry though I won't  be back.  

Male server was unfriendly and seemed like he was not taking any prisoners. I understand the wait as this place is popular but a smile and some sort of conversation goes a long way.  Didn't offer a coffee refill until the cheque was on the table. I felt pushed along.
author: Darren S.

description:
Quick take: french toast


After looking at fellow Yelp pictures I knew for sure I wanted to try the cinnamon croissant French toast with strawberries. So good. It's an interesting take on french toast. A flattened croissant rolled around in egg batter and then cooked. I can still taste the flakey texture of a croissant here and there. Overall, it's more like a croissant pancake. A little bit of powdered sugar, butter, and a drizzle of syrup. Delicious!

For something savory we picked the bacon and tomato scrambled eggs. This dish balances out the sweetness of the french toast. Definitely a good idea to share a sweet and savory plate.

The wait wasn't long at all. This is a small corner cafe with a few tables inside and on the sidewalk. Service was fast and very friendly.
author: Nancy H.

description:
Nice brunch spot, and surprisingly crowded on a Tuesday for lunch! The patio was very popular (it was nearly empty inside). One of the best potatoes I've had in the city (a close second to Plow). 

THE WAIT: About 5 minutes for 3 adults + 3 babies on a Tuesday at 12pm for an outdoor table.

THE SERVICE: Very friendly and fast!

THE COST: $18.36 total for one brunch entree.

THE FOOD:
* Scrambled Eggs - Pesto, Mushroom, Sun-dried Tomato, Mozzarella ($15.25) - 4.5 stars
Lovely soft, pillowy eggs! Great combo of savory flavors. And the potatoes - WOW these were amazing! Nice thick crisp, yet soft on the inside. I have to learn how they cooked them!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Service was better than the food. Cute place but not memorable.

This place is much overpriced for the food that is served. The croissant French toast is good, but for $14 for three pieces (ok) but it's an extra $4.25 if you want a cup of strawberries on top- that's a little much. One small split chicken apple sausage was $4.25 as well. The avocado cheese scramble was good, but not something I will crave to come back for.

The service shines here. Attentive staff, speedy, accommodating and friendly. 

There are a few outdoor tables and the wait isn't too too bad for brunch on the city - we were seated in less than 35 min on a Saturday morning at 11 ish. Parking isn't too bad either.

I'm not sure about the bathroom here - it's literally in the kitchen and there's no room to turn around inside (ew), and you're exiting the bathroom into the kitchen where workers are working with food....
author: Karen H.

description: Looking for a brunch spot in Noe? Look no further; Chloe's is a great choice. Be prepared for a small wait. (Go to the liquor store across the way for a kombucha or grab an antique at Lovejoy's Attic down the street.) I started with a carrot dill purée soup, and ended with pecan pancakes. According to my boytoy, "they were the real deal...[and] everything was exquisite." I waited 10 years to come here and it didn't disappoint.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Came here on a weekday for brunch around 11AM, was seated right away. You put your name on list and there's an option for indoor or outdoor seating. I've driven by here several times and noticed a huge crowd so definitely got lucky for a Monday.

1. Ordered Scramble Special- came with spinach, tomatoes, artichokes, onions and cheese. Delicious if you enjoy artichokes! Comes with a side of toast (we had Rosemary toast) and choice of fruit or salad. (the jam with the toast was tasty!).

2. Portions are big- could not finish the scramble, toast or my fruits and I am usually the type to finish my brunch! 

3. Service was great! Waiter took great care of us, refilled our waters and coffees and checked up on us a few times.
author: Jenny Z.

description: Cute little brunch spot in Noe Valley off of Church street. They specialize in egg scrambles - and they are delicious! If you can treat yourself to an early morning before work weekday breakfast that's your best bet at not having to wait in line. This place gets very crowded on the weekends and has a long waitlist. If you do go on a weekend, put your name down on the list and be prepared to walk around for an hour or so to kill time. I always like ordering the egg scramble with avocado and jarlsberg cheese and my husband gets the cinnamon croissant French toast with real maple syrup.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
What a great find.totally by accident! Arrived early fora doctors appointment and saw this cute little cafe down the street.I was hungry and breakfast sounded good..
Wow! I had scrambled eggs, with freak tomatoes and bacon,, a fresh fruit bowl and whole wheat walnut bread with blackberry jam. I had to leave about a fourth of it and that's unusual for me!
What was supposed to be two eggs, looked  like 4-5 eggs. The fresh fruit bowl was a a meal in itself. The bread was homemade and the jam was to die for. The huge cup of coffee was more than enough without a refill.
In closing, if you're ever in Noe Valley, San Francisco, make this a stop!!
author: Hershel L.

description:
I had an absolutely AMAZING brunch here on Sunday with some friends. Had to wait a few minutes to be seated but it was well worth my time relaxing in the sun in the gorgeous Noe Valley community for the feast that I was about to have. We started off the meal with one of their fresh blueberry muffins which was so freaking good. Then for main course I got a ham and cheese scramble with their breakfast potato's on the side  (both tasty and perfectly cooked). My table also shared the cinnamon sugar croissant french toast with strawberries on top........oh my goodness gracious......I am not normally a sweet breakfast person but that French toast left me NEEDING more.

The wait staff was super friendly and attentive. I learned that it is a family run business that has had the same recipes for over 30 years......and even though the recipes are old the food was rimless!  I loved every second of being at Chloe's cafe. Would highly highly recommend!
author: Jason P.

description:
My husband and I take all our friends here for brunch! It is our go-to spot. The scrambles are always DELICIOUS, and we often splurge for a croissant french toast which is yummy as well. Being San Francisco, it is definitely not cheap, but I find the quality of the food and the large portions to be well worth the price. There is always a wait for a table on the weekends, but it's usually not too bad.

The service here is exceptional. All servers are very friendly and helpful. They are super nice with our dog, too. Sometimes he even gets treats :)

Cannot recommend Chloe's enough!
author: S C.

description:
I would have given this place a full five stars, were it not for the bad experience I had getting seated. Given it was windy outside, my fam and I wanted to get a table inside. We had already waited for over an hour, but for some reason, a party of 3 was seated before my family of 4. Of course we were a little frustrated. But when we approached the waiter about why we still weren't being seated, he explained that the table was too small, and that we would be seated when the next available table was open. This didn't make sense at all, because the last party who had been sitting at that table was a party of 5.

Besides the issue with seating, I really enjoyed the food at Chloe's Cafe. I can tell that everything on the menu is made fresh with high-quality ingredients. Prices also aren't too bad, considering that this is a brunch place in SF, and the portions are very, very reasonable. I got the special, which was a veggie-filled scramble (spinach, portobello, and roasted bell pepper) plus two sides (I chose a green salad and fruit cup). Super filling and satisfying. 

I can't wait to come back here again... but maybe next time on a weekday, because we had waited for more than 2 hours for a seat inside. (Note: we had come on a Sunday around 10:45 AM.)
author: Connie X.

description:
Small, but cozy. Not to mention, DELICIOUS FOOD! 

I've been to Chloe's about three times now over the last four years and every time I come, I remember how much I like it and wonder why I don't come here more often! 

The jarlsberg & avocado scramble is AMAZING. There's generous amounts of avocado and the cheese is melted to perfection. I like to add a little Tapatio on top for a kick and my god it's SO GOOD. For sides, I love starches so I get sourdough toast and potatoes! The potatoes are always well seasoned and they give you more toast than other brunch spots! Other options for sides include a salad or a fruit cup and I have to highlight how they actually put strawberries & bananas in the fruit cup, rather than just cantaloupe and honeydew like most places. 

I've also had the cinnamon French toast with fresh strawberries and omg!!!!!!! IT! IS! SO! DELICIOUS! Texture of the bread is amazing and it's the *perfect* amount of cinnamon. You have to get it with the strawberries-- it just goes so well together! They also offer a half order so that's perfect if you just want to try it! At this point, I've maxed out the number of exclamation points in one paragraph so just go check this place out ok, everyone that works there is super nice.
author: Marny N.

description:
My friends and I came here for brunch. We had a large party so we got their earlier than we intended to meet and put our name in. It's a small spot so there is limited table space. We waited for about 20 minutes for our table, which was not bad at all. We were expecting way worse!

The servers were so incredibly friendly and lovely when they sat us and took our orders. My friends told me that the scrambles are divine here so I went with that. I got the avocado and Karl's Berg scramble and I added fresh tomatoes to mine. I chose the rosemary toast to go with it and fresh fruit. The portions were very sizable and the food was incredible. I inhaled the scramble and the toast and fruit. The eggs were perfect, the avocado was fresh, and the fruit was super tasty and fresh as well. That rosemary bread! My goodness! 

I had a hard time choosing between sweet and savory so I suppose I'll have to go back some time to get more.....
author: Joanna V.

description:
YES! This is seriously what good brunch is all about. 

On a busy Saturday morning, the BF and I came for brunch. There was a small line in front of us, but the wait staff was efficient and quickly accommodated us according to party size. Chloe's is a small, family run cafe and due to their size, you'll probably want to limit your party to no more than 4 or 5. They can accommodate more, but the wait will be substantially longer. 

The positive is that they have both indoor and outdoor seating, so you can bring your pups to brunch.

What i love about Chloe is how inviting the atmosphere was--you felt at home and the owners and servers definitely go out of their way to make you feel that way. 

Moving on to the food, both the BF and I ordered a scramble (mine the pesto one with cheese and him the salmon). The scramble was perfectly seasoned, soft and came with a delightful side of home fries. The pesto was perfect and the cheese melted in your month. You have the option to chose btw home fries, seasonal fruit, salad, and or toast. 

Portions were on point and prices were decent for SF brunch. 

Another plus, they're not hesitant to refill your ice coffee for to-go. 

The menu is small, but definitely mighty. Nothing extravagant, but just good brunch.
author: Diane T.

description:
The breakfast menu was simple but the scramble and French toast I ordered were delicious. The space was small but charming. The wait staff was friendly and highly attentive -- my coffee cup was never empty.

The only drawback I experienced was that when we received our check, we were informed that they couldn't split it. Would have been nice to know that up front. If you're with a party, I'd recommend that you inform your waiter upfront that you intend to split to avoid the trouble we had.
author: Justin R.

description:
First time I've been to this great little spot on church street. There were quite a few people people waiting for tables, but I have to say they did a great job getting people to their seats. You can choose to eat inside or out. The food is primarily breakfast and lunch. They open up around 8:00 and close around 3:00. 
The breakfast was great, plentiful and full of flavor. The best part including the food is the staff. They all do a great job making sure everyone is doing great and enjoying themselves. I want to go back to try their lunch menu. They have a lot of great items on their menu. I would highly recommend this place.
author: David H.

description:
I showed up at 2:45 15minutes before they closed on a Tuesday, asked if they where still serving, & I was welcomed  with a positive & chill vibe.
my advice, try the banana & walnut pancakes with the egg scramble & potatoes they are on point. 
-peace
author: Colonel R.

description:
We love this place. The wait is sometimes long, but the people that work there are awesome.
Their omelets are perfect. 
Banana walnut pancakes are very good
Most food comes with fruit cups

Coffee is perfect any time of day (they close at 3 most days)
author: Jad A.

description:
Wait can be really long on the weekends, but the food and service are fantastic. 
They do excellent 2-egg scrambles and they have a great variety of the sides you pick for your plate (fruit, salad, english muffin/toast/bagel, home fries). The one with the avocado and cheese is really popular here. I didn't get it myself, but I tried some off my boyfriend's plate and it was really good. I customized my own scramble (spinach and mushrooms) and devoured the whole thing within 5 minutes! I love how hot and steamy the scrambles are when they bring them to your table. I feel like at a lot of places, the food becomes lukewarm by the time they reach you.
Overall, I definitely recommend this place, but be warned about the wait. It's a small cafe-- inside, they only have about 12 2-person tables (they join them together for bigger parties), and about 4 tables outside. It'll be worth it though!
author: Christina W.

description: Awesome breakfast.  Scrambled eggs with smoked salmon, dill and capers. Two sides - salad and fruit bowl.
author: D.J. M.

description:
Got the smoked salmon scramble with capers and the banana walnut pancakes. Both dishes were absolutely amazing (though some cream cheese in the scramble would make it perfect!) 

Service was great too -- coffee was refilled constantly etc., and one of the servers was a really kind man with very round glasses. The ambiance is cute. Come early if you want to skip the wait.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Let's start by saying that this cafe is ADORABLE (and how can it not be when it's in Noe Valley). It's pretty small and cozy with a bit of outdoor seating - perfect for a sunny day. It's got that diner-esque charm, without it looking like a diner and the service is very attentive (my coffee cup was refilled constantly, which I appreciated).

We arrived around 10:30/11AM on a Sunday and didn't face a wait (as a party of two), which was amazing. The menu features fantastic breakfast staples and they are happy to make adjustments for you. Everything is pretty reasonably priced for brunch at about $11-14 per dish. I knew I wanted scrambled eggs, but not exactly with the same toppings as the dishes on the menu. So, I told my waiter I just wanted scrambled eggs with spinach and mushroom and he was happy to get that ordered for me rather than fussing that it's not on the menu - plus points here. Each scrambled eggs dish comes with two sides and you can choose from home fries (these are delicious!) toast, fresh fruit and a salad. I chose the latter two. My friend ordered the breakfast bagel sandwich with home fries and toast.

The food came out pretty quickly! And I found the portions to be generous. I absolutely loved my scrambled eggs with solid portions of mushrooms and spinach inside . The fresh fruit was fresh indeed and came with cantaloupe, orange, blueberries and a few other fruits. Overall the dish was super hearty and comforting, which is what breakfast is all about :). My friend also enjoyed the bagel sandwich and ended up boxing up half of it to-go since the portion was so hefty. 

I will definitely be back for another hearty breakfast meal!
author: Sabina S.

description:
Charming neighborhood cafe with delicious food.

I've rode the J-Church train by this place so many times on the weekend that I had to come check out the hype for myself. Every weekend, you'll see a line outside this place. We managed to only wait a little while when we arrive around 9:30am.

They have both inside and outside seating. The wait for outside is usually longer. The turnover is pretty quick and people are in and out.. The inside is SMALL so I think big parties will have a harder time getting seated.

We ordered the avocado and Jarlsberg cheese scrambled eggs with home fries and a side salad and their 2 Pancakes with scrambled eggs and home fries. The portions are very generous. We had enough leftover for a 2nd meal later in the day. Everything also tasted fresh and well prepared. I loved their pancakes and home fries!! The pancakes were fluffy, light, and you can smell the delicious sweet batter. Their home fries were big chunks of crispy potatoes. Just the right amount of crispy without being soggy or burnt.

The service was only so-so for our meal. We had about 2 or 3 different people helping us out and not a dedicated server so it wasn't very personable. I will say that the young lady who was doing the bussing was very efficient. Our water glass was always full and she was quick to clear the plates when we were done.

Def recommend checking out if you're in the neighborhood!
author: Junella T.

description:
A friend and I came here at around 11:30 on a Monday. There is indoor and outdoor seating, and since it was a cold day we preferred to sit inside. We waited for around 25 min before we got seated.

Service was prompt and seamless. The interior reminds me of a studio apartment converted into a small cafe. It is a bit cramped in places but luckily we got to sit against the window so we had a bit more space. 

There are different scrambled eggs combinations that come with two sides. I ordered scrambled eggs with mushrooms (an add on), a fruit cup and wheat walnut toast. My meal was good and tasted standard. There were no stand outs in my dish, but it was still good.

My friend ordered the chicken apple sausage sandwich with home fries. Now that, was amazing. The chicken apple sausage was great and would taste even better in a scramble. The home fries (which I think they're known for) were fantastic. I would come back for them, but would bring my own bottle of sriracha to dip them in.

I've seen a few reviews regarding customer service. I personally didn't have a rude experience there, but it is different for everyone. I think because the place is so small, they try to streamline people and are rushing so people can be seated as fast as possible. However, that is only my theory.

Overall:
Food 3.75/5
Service 3.5/5
Interior 2.5/5
author: Guilliana J.

description: Good food but typical brunch place. Long line, especially for Saturday or Sunday Brunch. Try to be there close to opening time. Front porch and inside seating, cozy & comfortable vibes, makes me think I am at old auntie's place eating comfort food. I ordered pancakes with fresh strawberries and omelet egg dish. Egg dish comes with salad and home fries. Both dishes were basic. I liked the interior decorations and plates/cups they use- it's pretty cute. Strawberries were very fresh and pancakes tasted good but it didn't feel like it was worth an hour wait. I would go back and try different dish next time to confirm my rating but it was not really impressive the first time around. Windows are big and if you happen to eat next to window, it feels like you are stared at by people waiting outside looking at what you are eating/ when you are finishing. Front porch seating seems cool on a sunny day.
author: Adel A.

description: One of the best breakfasts I have ever had in San Francisco. The French toast is beyond amazing and they have the BEST breakfast potatoes... crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Impeccable service. The staff is warm, & friendly
author: Kristin L.

description:
Chloe's is a neighborhood gem. Great service, good food, fair prices with the cozy feel of your local neighborhood diner. 

The serving sizes at Chloe's are GENEROUS... there's no chance you'll walk out hungry. I highly recommend the croissant french toast with strawberries. My preferred tactic is to order the small order of the french toast AND one of the scrambles. Then my boyfriend and I split both dishes and get the best of both worlds. The breakfast potatoes are flavorful and soft. The scrambles are packed with whichever toppings you order. They offer a variety of sides, including fruit, and an unusual selection of toasts.

There's usually a wait after 10 am on the weekends. Personally, I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes for 2-3 people. The inside is SMALL, but there are additional tables along the outside of the building. Turnover is fairly quick, and the service is friendly and prompt.

Highly recommend!
author: Fiona F.

description: Great breakfast and friendly service. The coffee is great as well. Go there and you won't be sorry and I am sure you'll be back again.
author: Mehran A.

description: My second time here and better than the first. Amazing breakfast and the staff were amazing. They were so kind to my dog and kept bringing him treats and his own water dish. Highly recommend!
author: illy m.

description:
Ha! No wait time for me on a Thursday 11am morning. Ain't trying this place on a weekend 'cause I saw the line a couple times. Beware. 

The gentlemen working here are so hospitable. They cannot be nicer! Let's get to the food. I ordered the onion, cheese and potato omelette and it was delicious - loved the red potatoes! My side of fresh fruit had actual fresh fruit (you know how sometimes the side of fruit is all mussy and gross - not at Chloe's Cafe). The topper was croissant french toast with a side of fresh strawberries - again, delicious, fresh - I ate every last bite. 

I definitely recommend Chloe's Cafe with a couple tips - the inside of the Cafe is tiny, not stroller friendly for any mom's (stay outside) and try to avoid the weekend brunch frenzy if possible.
author: Irina R.

description:
Wow! The cute little cafe nestled on the corner was certainly a hit. I was visiting San Fran with my boyfriend from NYC and wasn't expecting this place to be so crowded. We arrived around 11:00 on a Sunday and there was a 20-30 minute wait for a table for two. 

The plus of the long wait is the speediness of the staff (which was a good and a bad thing). They were quick to take our order and bring out our food. While they were quick, it also made us feel a bit rushed which we understood as we watched the anxious and hungry customers watch us eat as we did before. You definitely get a great deal! I ordered the avocado/cheese (+added tomatoes) scramble. It comes with a choice of toast and either fruit/potatoes. I had the whole wheat walnut toast with fruit. The bread was different and delicious and the fruit was certainly fresh and versatile. My boyfriend got the pesto, mozerella, sun dried tomatoes and mushrooom scramble with  rosemary potatoe toast and potatoes (I secretly think he got the better order ;)) My boyfriend and I cleaned our plates in record time! :) the atmosphere was cozy and very Mom/pop. 

I certainly recommend for smaller parties and if you're willing to wait! They have outdoor seating but it was a little chilly outside for me. My only wish is that we could have stayed a little longer at our table to talk, drink coffee and enjoy our last morning in San Fran.
author: Maddy O.

description: This place was an amazing surprise: very quiet with a nice outside seating and the food... so good none of us was talking anymore :D I recommend the pecan pancakes and the pesto & sundried tomatoes scrambled eggs!! I am definitely going to come back.
author: Louise U.

description:
Another great brunch find in the City, located in the heart of Noe Valley! After 15 minutes of searching for parking, we got lucky and found one right in front. I dropped off my cousin right when we got there and she put our names down right away. No reservations available, but luckily the tables turn over very quickly. There is seating available inside and outside.

Now let's get to the food....so many menu items to choose from! My eyes were drawn to the amazing breakfast choices available. After much debate, I ended up ordering the smoked salmon omelette with fresh fruit and walnut toast. Best decision ever! The omelette was loaded with salmon, capers and other fresh ingredients. When I say loaded....I mean loaded!! There was salmon and capers in each and every bite. The walnut toast was delicious and I smothered the 2 slices with the delicious side of jam provided. The side of fruit was presented beautifully on my plate and was nothing short of sweet. The others at the table chose the Bacon and Tomato omelette and the Chicken Apple Sausage sandwich with home fries. They both raved about their meals. The coffee was good and strong and I didn't say no to the couple of refills I had. 

Now let's get to the service......exceptional! We were greeted right away and throughout our meal we were checked on consistently. Our water glasses and coffee mugs were never left half full and our meals came out efficiently and correct.

If you're looking for a new weekend brunch spot, check this place out! Great neighborhood too.
author: La C.

description: Get here early for a delicious meal! The special scrambled eggs with fresh veggies, fresh fruit, and homemade Rosemary Basil Bread were each wonderful!
author: Catherine B.

description: Got banana walnut pancakes, they were large portions and delicious. People are hospitable, cute little cafe. Prices are reasonable for San Francisco
author: Lance R.

description:
Sooooooooooo good and amazingly fast and friendly service! We went here based on a bloggers recommendation and boy were we happy we did! From the minute we stepped out of our Uber and got a whiff of the food we knew it was going to be great (and worth the wait). We ordered the Avocado  &  Jarlsberg Cheese Scramble with Home fries & Fruit, and the Cinnamon Croissant French Toast  with a side of the Apple Chicken Sausage (to DIE for)! 

We were seated within 10 minutes of being there. TJ was our server and he went above and beyond and even gave us a treat to take with us! All of the wait staff was extremely friendly and upbeat. TJ even offered us tips and things to see in the city as well as things to do for the rest of our adventure up hwy 101. If we are ever back in SF we will be back here.
author: Danielle L.

description: Such a cute neighborhood spot! Great food, great service, and large portions. Make sure to get a table outside on a sunny day.
author: Shabnam E.

description:
Charming old place with friendly people. Like most other Sf brunch places it's a long wait. I had the Dill egg salad and jalsberg.  It was something new and delivered on expectation. 

I did think that the side salad was enormous and to me it was too much for one person. Cute drinks
author: Vasini G.

description: I ordered an avocado and jarlsberg cheese combo swirled into eggs. This combo seemed pretty lit, but I'm used to having scrambled eggs that literally burst with flavor -- at home, I use cumin, garlic, a bit of rosemary, and soy sauce and so I should have foreseen the lack of flavor, but we live and we learn. On the scale of being blown away, I would rate this a sneeze. Upsides though: Chloe's is very cozy, had great view outside, and is a cute cafe. Intermittent fruit flies did not an incredible dining experience make, but that I do understand is not something the cafe can control on a granular level. The waitstaff was incredibly attentive and friendly, and asked my friend if she wanted coffee more than my mom has ever asked me to clean up my room. I would say that I should have paid 1/4 of what I did that day for what I got -- a salad and then simple scrambled eggs. I'll order something else next time (probably lunch) and give this place another go -- it was ruffling with some potential.
author: Celena C.

description:
One of life's joys is Sunday brunch, and this local spot hits all the right places in my tummy.  After a lovely evening with friends, I stayed over and was promised such a brunch.  Within a short walk, we arrived around 9:15am and put our names on the already growing list for seating.  

It's a quaint place, with outdoor seating as well, but considering it was still chilly this Dec. morning, we opted for inside only.  The wait was not too long, while we snuck a peak through the window to see what people were having.  

We got a table for 2 right in the middle, kinda near the door. When my friend asked to be moved to a corner table, since she was catching a cold, they accommodated and were very nice about it.

Based on the menu and our preferences that morning, I ordered the smoked salmon scramble with capers, with sesame bagel and cream cheese and mixed fruit.  Delicious!! And the bagel was toasted just right, and coming from this picky Jersey girl, who knows a good bagel when she eats one.  My friend had the pancakes and scrambled eggs and potatoes. It was plenty for her, as she had some left overs to go.

The decor was festive with Christmas decorations and lights. The ambiance was cozy and just the right amount of chatter.  The service was very attentive and they came to refill coffees several times.

A brunch winner!! What a great way to start the day.  We left happily fed and continued on our merry way!
author: Linh L.

description: Came for brunch on a Sunday. This place has great outdoor seating in the sun (but they also have umbrellas so you don't burn). The food was super delicious too, pancakes were my favorite! Definitely recommend this place and will be going back often :)
author: Camille H.

description:
Love this place ! Slightly pricey but if you love a google scramble then this is the place to go . If comes with home fries (which are delicious ) or salad ,  and toast with fresh jam . They fill your whole plate up other food so you will not come
Out of there dissatisfied .
author: Tessa B.

description:
Good food but very very aggressive service. I was there with two friends of mine and the gentleman who took care of us was extremely rude and unprofessional. He was rude to one of my friends in particular, ever since she got there until we left. I didn't quite understand why, maybe because she arrived and ordered after us? But is this a good reason to have an incredibly bad attitude towards a customer during her lunch? 
At the end, he charged us twice for a sandwich and besides that he wrote (by hand) a higher amount for that sandwich. I understand, it happens, but instead of "sorry, let me correct it", he screamed at us "this is what happens when you add things to an order" and  screamed again "you are not supposed to split bills" - Although we did not ask for a split check. Every other customer was looking at us at that time and we felt very badly, like we did something wrong. We did do something wrong - by simply going there. A nice lunch turned into a very unpleasant experience. Too bad for the other server - she was actually pretty nice.
P.S. Checks were written by hand very poorly and we did not receive a proper receipt.
author: Diana O.

description:
I enjoy going here with my sisters. It's my favorite brunch spot in the neighborhood! I almost always order the avocado and Jarlsberg cheese scramble. I love it!! The ambiance is great and the staff is always so wonderful.

And expect a wait if you don't arrive early. Don't get snarky with the staff and ask to order ahead of time because it ain't happening. 

Thank you, Chloe's. :)
author: Bernadette B.

description: My sister and I wandered into this cafe by chance for a weekend brunch. The food was delicious with generous portions and fresh ingredients. The service was also friendly (family-run business) and excellent: usually I have to constantly ask the server at any restaurant to fill my water cup, but I never had to ask once at this cafe. What a gem of a brunch spot in the city! We will certainly be back.
author: Janice K.

description:
This is probably one of the best brunches in not only Noe Valley but the whole of SF. Note that it is small and can be quite a wait to get a table. 

The portions are huge and the servers are really friendly despite the constant flood of customers. Service was genuinely quick and the place has a really comfy vibe to it. 

You can order pretty much anything on the menu and cant really go wrong with it. My recommendation would be the Avocado and Jarlsberg Sandwich ( Chloe speciality) with a glass of freshly squeezed Orange Juice.

Do check out this place if you`re in the Noe Valley neighborhood.
author: Pranav B.

description:
Had a great time here last week. I came in the afternoon for some late breakfast. Ended up getting their 2 French toast with sides of sausage and potatoes plus a mimosa. WOW! 

The French toast was great, not too thick and dry but perfectly what I wanted. I forgot to put butter on it because they looked so good. The sausage was good as expected. 

But what made this an epic meal was the potatoes. By far the best part of that meal were those crispy potatoes. They were super crisp on the outside while soft on the inside. I definitely recommend coming here. Plus my waiter was a super friendly gentleman. I forget his name but he was maybe in his mid 30s and had silver/white hair. I was outside and he still came by the perfect number of times to see if I needed anything. 

Unfortunately for me, their card reader was down so I had to use a random atm across the street to get cash which cost me 2.76 to use plus a 2.50 fee from my bank. 

Aside from that little issue, I had a great breakfast and will definitely be back for some more now that I work at the 24 hour fitness up the street
author: Grant H.

description:
1. This place is intimate and the staff There Knows That and they are on top of it.
2. The prices are comparable to breakfast in San Francisco nowadays. I however was able to eat off my order twice which is always something I look for.
3. It was DELICIOUS! So much so I thought dangggg I need to try to recreate this for da casa! Bomb. I'm actually drooling  just thinking about it! 
4. I now know where to treat myself to breakfast before work and to bring guest when they visit!
author: domenique c.

description: Small cute spot for brunch today. Only had to wait about 30 minutes. The food took a while to arrive but they were very busy so it's understandable. Speaking of which the food was great and delicious.
author: Michael M.

description:
Great Noe Valley Brunch Spot. 

This place is always packed and it makes sense -- its cute, it's been there forever, the service is friendly and the food is tasty and reliable. Because its a classic, the menu is on the basic side -- they serve simple, classic fare.
author: Stephanie M.

description: This is a review for the buttermilk pancakes. They were not pleasant tasting at all. Did not enjoy them in the least. Overcooked, dry in texture and bland. This is my first time here. The service was cordial however. The place is pleasant but small and you have to wait outside for a table. I wish I could say the long wait was worth it but it just wasn't for me. The only good thing I got out of coming here was that I supported a small business.
author: Review L.

description: This place has such a great vibe to it! Customer service 10/10. The food was amazing and tasted fresh! Portion size was perfect & the outside seating area is nice. Coming back next time I visit SF!
author: Marlene R.

description:
Clearly a very neighborhood brunch place.  Servers greeting familiar faces and patrons saying hi to neighbors at nearby tables.  

Came at around noon on a Saturday and surprisingly, there was no one waiting for a table besides us (the crowd started coming right after us, thank god).  I ordered the red potato, onion, and cheddar cheese scramble with fresh fruit and english muffin on the side.  Scramble was good.  My only gripe was that the english muffin looked like it was once toasted, but by the time it got to me, it had already gotten soggy.  Other than that, everything was peachy, just nothing spectacular that would elevate it to one of the greatest brunch places ever.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
In college, one of my favorite shows was Food Network's "Rachael Ray's $40 a day".

In the San Francisco episode, I remember she visited Citizen Cake and Swan Oyster Depot. Obviously, very "budget-friendly" places.  

As a broke college student, I thought to myself, "Shoot, I could do $20 a day in San Francisco!"

Pass forward a decade, unless you stick to $1.50 tacos and $2 baos (do these still even exist?) at ethnic dives,  good phuckin' luck on getting through San Francisco with $100 a day. Remember, San Francisco is home of the $15 cup of coffee that sold out before the day was over. 

I rarely go out for breakfast and the last time I did was 4 months ago at Chloe's Café. I'm so out of touch with breakfast prices that my jaw slammed to the ground when the bill came: $30 pp for some French toast and a cup of tea in a tiny mom & pop café?! Thank goodness for Mr. Visa (just don't tell my mom that)!

I've passed by Chloe's hundreds of times and there's always a large crowd on the weekends (tiny space that fits 20 inside and 4 outdoor tables). I came on a random Monday afternoon with a friend and there was no wait. We sat outside since we had our furbabies with us: http://bit.ly/1ZAj852.

Since I'm not a breakfast food person, I contemplated getting a salad or sandwich. Then again, that's like ordering fish at a steakhouse so we decided to go ham on breakfast. I ordered the much raved about Cinnamon Croissant French Toast w/ fresh strawberries ($13.95): http://bit.ly/25olWXh and my friend ordered the Cranberry Almond Pancake & Banana Walnut Pancake w/ scrambled eggs, fresh fruit ($15.50): http://bit.ly/1pBCydm. 

The cinnamon croissant french toast was lightly crisp and custardy. The plump strawberry and banana were perfectly ripe and sweet. The real maple syrup tied everything together.

I had two bites of my friend's pancakes which were ginormous. Both were fluffy and chock-full of fruits and nuts.  As I like banana walnut bread, I favored the banana walnut pancake over the cranberry almond one. 

We ordered a side of chicken sausage ($3.95) for the pups. I had a bite and it was a bit burnt but had a nice savory sweetness. 

Love the servers here - they're amiable, cheery, and attentive. We came for a late brunch so these guys must have been working since 6 am and they still managed to be all smiles. Tsk tsk to the inconsiderate couple who walked in 8 minutes before closing at 2:52 pm and wanted to dine in! The servers were nice enough to allow them to dine in even though they were closing up shop for the day. 

Chloe's is tiny so NOT recommended for any groups larger than four. The restroom is even tinier and is behind the kitchen (kind of awkward). It's smaller than a closet and the sink is outside. 

Street parking is easy compared to other parts of the city. I've never had issues with parking in this part of Noe Valley on the weekdays or the weekends. 

Brunch at Chloe's was satisfying but not something I would wait an hour for on the weekends. Additionally, $30 pp (including tip) for some French toast and a cup of tea is pricey. 

Would love to see Rachael Ray come back to San Francisco and have at it with $40 a day! Rachael, let's meet at In-N-Out first so you don't blow it all in one place, yea?
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Food looks delicious but wouldn't sell me to go coffee. Their to go cups are in plain sight with brewed coffee ready.  And they weren't too busy either. Maybe the lady was just lazy? She directed me to a coffee shop that is closes on Sundays, today is Sunday and a red bull will do.
author: Ish A.

description: How can I count the ways everything is so terrific.  Inside or out, it's a little bit of old San Francisco heaven.  Cash only, just so you know.   Jahrlsburg cheese mixed in with the avocado is the most flavorful scrambled ever. Choose the excellent croissant and fried potatoes in lieu of fruit cup and toast for a splurge,add a sausage and orange juice. You will be stuffed and satiated.  After eating here for 25 years I still get the same thing every visit. Lucky me I live just around the corner. Avoid the weekend.   I have tried this at home, but it just doesn't come close to tasting as good. a real SF treat.
author: John G.

description: Great brunch spot! Hadn't been in a long time and was happy to go back when some friends were in town. Food is amazing and service was so wonderful and attentive. It was a beautiful day out and we were able to sit in their outdoor seating. I've only been for brunch but highly recommend. Don't think you could go wrong with anything that's in the menu!
author: Emily F.

description:
Erm, we had to wait a LONG time on Sunday afternoon. Small place with limited seating- about 7 tables inside and 5 outside. Come during off hours. Do NOT come with a big group.

I ordered the Chloe salad, which the waitress recommended. While it was good, I would kick the healthy veggie habit next time and go in on some croissant french toast with strawberries, banana walnut pancakes, or avocado + carlsberg cheese scramble. I sampled my friend's banana walnut pancakes and they were delicious. The crispy potatoes are also good. 

My friends were irked by how tiny the bathroom was- nearly in the kitchen. They felt uncomfortable using it. Just saying. 

I would come back to this small mom and pop restaurant, given I was in the area. I don't have much of a breakfast sweet tooth, but I'm up trying the much talked about croissant french toast with strawberries.
author: Joanna L.

description:
Delicious food. Long wait for a table every time. Totally worth it! 

You must try the French Toast piled high with an enormous amount of strawberries. The blueberry muffin with jam is delicious (I think about it often). You know how sometimes the potatoes that are served at brunch at other restaurants taste like they were made several days ago? Not here. The home fries are fresh and tasty. The eggs with avocado and Jarlsberg cheese are delicious.

Every time we go, every little detail is perfect. The employees are friendly and clearly working very efficiently together.
author: Russell J.

description: I read really good reviews on Chloe's Cafe on Yelp and read about the wait that one has to go through.  I probably did wait about an hour to get seated because the restaurant is small but I think it's worth it if you want an amazing brunch!  Our waiter was great and kept checking up on us.  I ordered the Scrambled eggs, fresh fruit, and toast special.  That was so delicious!  I also ordered hot chocolate and that was also very delicious!  I highly recommend coming here for brunch.  It's one of my favorite brunch places in the city and the location is in Noe Valley, a nice area.  I just wish the restaurant was bigger so everyone wouldn't have to wait so long.
author: Mikayla M.

description: Terrific neighborhood cafe. We returned for another excellent breakfast. The food was delicious and plentiful. We ate pancakes piled high with strawberries, warm and gooey gruyere and avocado omelette, pancakes with crunchy pecans, and fruit cups. Excellent service.  We will be back !
author: Charles L.

description: I really love this place. The food is always so fresh, tasty, and generously portioned. Cute atmosphere on a sweet Noe Valley corner. Wait staff is always friendly and accommodating. Always a pleasure!
author: Alexander C.

description: Fantastic cafe! I went on a weekday and there was no wait, and the food came out really quickly and was delicious. As others have said, the banana walnut pancakes are delicious (even without syrup!) so I definitely recommend them. It was totally outside the kind of pancake I'd normally get, but I'm glad I did. I got a short stack and it was more than enough, though if you go for a full 3 pancakes, I'd get it. They're delicious! Plus (and this is my favorite part) the staff (owners maybe?) are super friendly. That alone would make me go back.
author: Angela M.

description:
Holy moly this place is delicious.  Went here with a group of 4 and sat outside, service was great and friendly, and the bathroom was hilariously tucked away past the kitchen.  The special scramble with pesto was so good and cheesy.  They don't skimp on ingredients in the scramble either.  I ordered the french toast with strawberries and it was amazing... seriously... mouth is watering reminiscing... also there was a full plateful of strawberries.

All of us will 100% come back here.  We got there around 12/12:30 on a Saturday and waited about 10-15 mins before being seated.
author: Shawn T.

description: Absolutely amazing little cafe, with incredible food. I went there for my birthday brunch and was very satisfied. The staff is extremely sweet and cares about giving customers great service. I highly recommend the cinnamon croissant French toast! Best birthday breakfast I've ever had!
author: Katrina K.

description: Food and service is stellar.  Super friendly and attentive staff. Great atmosphere, and a perfect place to brunch.  French toast was on point, smoked salmon was so good.  Definitely will return!
author: Barry K.

description:
There is a lot to like about this place.  It's small, but not too crowded, The noise level is good , you can talk without having to shout.
 The staff is attentive. The food is fresh.

I'm not giving it 5 stars because the breakfast menu is limited, and the coffee is not great.

They do an amazing job in a small space.
author: Sheila F.

description:
A little small and hidden place. 
Salmon scrambled eggs- there are also of pieces of salmon and rich color eggs. It's tasty but not salty.
I chose wheat walnut bread and a fruit cup. The bread is great, fresh and well matched with raspberry jam served on he side. I enjoyed various kind of fruit in a cup.
Banana walnut pancake - I prefer the one in STACKS but I like their maple syrup.
Their regular coffee is fresh.
The price is little high compared with other brunch place.
author: Kurumi O.

description: Yummy and probably the best brunch pace in Noe Valley. Got the onion potato scramble with added avocado, walnut toast and shared some banana walnut pancake. Delicious!
author: Christine P.

description: The breakfast here is sooo good! Everything on my plate was so fresh! I remember thinking this scramble is nothing special...why does it taste so freaking good! It was the freshness! The service was really good as well.
author: Danyielle L.

description:
AMAZING ( and I'm not just biased because that's my name!). 
Came here on a whim with my boyfriend today and so glad we did. A cute little cafe on the corner in the mission district. Everything about this place is terrific. From the ambiance to the wait staff to the food. Located in a cozy part of the city- right next to a fire station. There seems to be a lot of regulars who come in daily and greet the wait staff like old friends. 
We got there and opted to sit outside because it was a beautiful morning. There was no wait even tho we didn't have a reservation. We both ordered their yummy sounding special for the day and all I have to say is WOW. One of the best breakfasts I've had in a long time. My boyfriend and I were talking about it all throughout the day and planning when to go back. Inexpensive yet fresh and delicious.  Will most definitely be back.
author: Chloe B.

description: Very cute breakfast/lunch place. Only 20 seats inside. A few more outside. Good food nice staff. Biggest complaint is there are long waits. If you don't get there early you'll be waiting.
author: David H.

description:
Charming spot with indoor and outdoor seating. Good vegetarian options for lunch. I got the Avocado Jarlsberg sandwich and it was 5/5. Served on a most delicious walnut bread, it's basically a giant (super fresh!) salad.
I got there at noon on a workday and was seated immediately.
author: Dejana B.

description: Coming here was a split second decision between the other brunch places in Noe Valley, but now I can't imagine going anywhere else. The food is delicious and hearty; you get what you paid for and more. The coffee's delicious, and they don't skimp on the refills. The waiters are incredibly attentive, and they are very friendly. I'm looking forward to my next visit already.
author: Kenia M.

description: This is a small brunch cafe in Noe Valley. Came on a rainy Saturday morning (which is rare in SF), probably waited 30-40 minutes. The service was fast though. I would recommend the cinnamon croissant French toast with strawberries. They definitely don't skimp on the strawberries and they were fresh too. Spread a little butter on the French toast, pour on some pure maple syrup and you have a delicious breakfast. I didn't care too much for the banana walnut pancake. The scrambled eggs that came with it were rather bland too (even after adding pepper). However I would still come again to try some other dishes that looked good: smoked salmon, blueberry pancakes, and special scramble.
author: Tom P.

description: Omg, this place is sooooo underrated. Not only do they have superb service, but the food is just so spectacular. I usually don't like restaurant eggs, but man, this place is the only place I know that finally got it right. The pancakes were light and fluffy, the fruit was fresh, the potatoes were perfectly cooked with a slight crunch, I haven't even tried the French toast, but I'm sure it's amazing! If you haven't tried this place, please go. I guarantee you won't be disappointed!
author: Monet V.

description:
I was cruising through the city to catch an early afternoon flight out of SFO, and thought Noe Valley would be an easy on/off the 101 for brunch on the way.

The wait for our table of 4 wasn't bad, maybe 20 minutes, and could have been shorter had I been dressed for outdoor seating.

Chloe's is relatively small, and so is their breakfast menu, but it is obvious that they focus on quality and it shows. My bacon, tomato, and avocado scramble was quite a generous portion and was served with a nice side of potatoes that had a perfect season and crunch. The toast options are hearty.  You'll pay for this quantity/quality (maybe $13-$16 per plate) but I definitely won't be needing lunch!

This is a great little area of town and parking wasn't too hard to find down Church St. Service was friendly and fast. It is a bit of a tight squeeze in here, and I wouldn't recommend it for large groups, but for 2-4 it is a quaint gem.
author: Shawn W.

description:
Chloe's is a neighborhood favorite and is the place I most crave to go on weekend mornings. I live about a 5 minute walk from this restaurant and always seem to find myself here without really intending to. For 2 people, we have waited anywhere from no time to 20 minutes during the morning (before 10am) but I imagine the wait is longer if you come a bit later. They also serve lunch with salads and sandwiches as well which I have been meaning to try.

I ALWAYS get the North Beach scramble which has been a special for however as long as I have been coming here. It is the yummy veggie/egg scramble with mozzarella cheese and comes with potatoes/fruit and toast. It is extremely tasty and filling. The potatoes at Chloe's are sooooo good and spiced well that I just have to opt for them over the fruit, even though the fruit is at no extra charge and is more than your standard fruit salad. The bread that Chloe's uses for their toast is also fabulous, I believe it is from Acme. 

I have also sampled their pancakes and french toast, both of which are better than average. I do definitely prefer their french toast since it is more unique, though. I believe it is brioche french toast, if I remember correctly. Their coffee is also pretty good and they keep the refills coming.

You can expect to spend $15-$20 on breakfast which, while not cheap, is definitely worth it for the portion size and quality that you get. If you are in Noe Valley, you should definitely check Chloe's out.
author: Carrie W.

description:
Great breakfast items including pancakes! Very nice staff too. I went on a weekday (Today-Thursday) morning around 9am and sat outside with my dog. They were attentive and brought out a water bowl for my dog too. I ordered the special that includes 2 eggs, potatoes (but substituted fresh mixed fruit) plus 2 pancakes. For a few dollars more, you can either order banana/walnut style or weekly pancake special (this week was blueberry and slivered almonds).
The pancake was deeeeeeelicious!! Eggs were fresh scrambled as requested and the fruit was very fresh and included 5 types i.e. blueberries, strawberries, sliced banana, cantaloupe and honeydew melon. I also ordered coffee which was hot and robust in flavor.
I highly recommend Chloe's Cafe on Church Street!
author: Steve F.

description: Hands down the best neighborhood breakfast spot. Walnut banana pancakes and jarlsberg / egg scrambles with walnut bread toast is legit. Check out their Chloé salad for lunch too!
author: Gareth D.

description: Amazing. Highly recommend. The food and service was outstanding. I recommend anyone in Noe Valley to stop in and order the breakfast special.
author: Christina C.

description: Great brunch spot with something for everyone. Coffee is good and service on point.  Can get crowded but we only waited 10 min on a Sat. Fruit cup way better than potatoes!
author: Kenneth Z.

description:
This place is adorable! While searching for quality lunch options on my lunch walk, I popped in here.

Trout sandwich on Rosemary bread??? Yum! Everything is fresh and delish. Simple menu, but wonderful options. Great service. There 29 years of business really shines. 

Also, I saw the Chloe salad on the table next to me. Big and looks amazing.
author: Betsy F.

description:
This is great spot if you want a cozy brunch and don't want to wait 2 hours...you will still probably have to wait 30 minutes though...it is still San Francisco. 

The space is pretty small but they will seat people both inside and outside. The outside doesn't have a tarp though so hopefully it doesn't start raining mid meal. I went with a group of 6 and there's pretty much no space for a party that big inside. We sat outside and were a bit tight squeezed...we didn't really mind it though. 

It's a quaint little spot, but the food was delicious! I got the Avocado and Cheese scramble...but no cheese, and added bacon. So I basically made my own Scramble. I'm glad I did though because it was great! The potato rosemary bread was divine. 

The service was very friendly, but I felt like it could have a been a bit more prompt. They were pretty busy though as it was the brunch rush. 

I thought it was a tad pricey though. I guess that is what you get in Noe Valley though!
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
Chloe's is a cutesy neighborhood diner with a unique twist on breakfast food- and amazing service too.

FOOD- I ordered the salmon, dill, and capers scrambled eggs with potatoes and an English muffin. Eggs came out wonderfully fluffy with some very big chunks of salmon. The dill and capers paired with the salmon nicely giving it a very yummy savory flavor. The potatoes came out nice and crunchy, just the way I like them! English muffin came out slightly over cooked, but I actually prefer it that way. The serving was also pretty big which my stomach appreciated after a night of drinking.

SERVICE- Honestly some of the best service I've had in awhile. Our waitress was very polite, told us about the special for the day, and was constantly checking up on us, refilling our tea with hot water. She also seemed very sincere with her service, compared to many other places these days where they just go through the motions. Food came out pretty quick as well!

I definitely recommend this place over the many other Noe Valley brunch places in the area. You will not be disappointed!
author: Marie O.

description: Came here while visiting from out of town! I'm obsessed it is so so freaking good. I got the pesto scramble with egg whites (I think that is was it is called) omg the best breakfast I ever had! Home fries were amazing. Champagne on point even the coffee was good. Loved the atmosphere and the service was great. I will never come to San Francisco and not come here!
author: Amelia P.

description: Super awesome brunch spot, out favorite go to place for sat brunch. A tad bit on the pricey side but the quality and quantity of food paired with the excellent service more than makes up for it. I really like this one gentleman who works there, such a great human being.
author: Andy R.

description: Charming neighborhood breakfast and lunch spot, with outside seating. Excellent food and coffee. I had the bagel and lox platter, very generous, and the waitress suggested substituting avocado slices for the egg I didn't want. Yum!
author: David R.

description: It has been a while since I've been so pleased with a restaurant in San Francisco.  I miss the true neighborhood cafes where u have to sign in and wait for your table.  Breakfast was amazing there. Just the plain pancakes were cooked to perfection and the REAL maple syrup made all the difference. I also loved the home fried potatoes which were generously seasoned.  Service was as good as it gets and they are so helpful to get u a table quickly. Can't wait to go back!
author: Paul S.

description:
This place is really good, it's a long wait but it's definitely worth it. The portion sizes are pretty big so if you're hungry you're set. They offer really good specials & I love that I can get almost any side with my meal. I ordered a basic scramble & added some extras and they were super kind in making sure & asking if I wanted it cooked into my eggs. Made me happy. 

They make me happy & they give me practically whatever variation I want of an order so they get 5 stars cause it's great food every time.
author: Raymond S.

description:
If you are looking for a quaint corner storefront cafe this is the place for you. We arrived promptly at 8am as the doors were opening, we were not the first in line.
The avocado and cheese scramble a fantastic choice as is the potato, onion and cheese scramble.
Bottomless cups of coffee, large wedges of rustic toast all add up to a great meal.
author: Catherine P.

description: Today was my 1st time visiting this place for lunch, I must say , food is very very good. You get big portions and the prices isn't that bad.  The joint is small but they work quickly to get you seated.  There is outside and inside seating
author: Lisa W.

description: Food was fresh and good. Went for brunch, had to wait a bit for our table, but not too long and the service was quick and friendly. About as good as it gets for a tiny, bustling neighborhood restaurant known for brunch. We got the yummy, chunky banana walnut pancakes which we talked ourselves into believing they are healthy.
author: Sheviche R.

description: This was such a great breakfast spot, food was amazing eggs were perfect as was the coffee and fresh juice! TJ was the best! If your in town stop here for aure
author: Jose R.

description: There was a long line that we waited but it worthy. Portions were huge but tasty. Pancake was awesome.
author: Pinar D.

description:
Had a great lunch here! It is a tiny place and the menu seems pretty ordinary. But the food is definitely not ordinary! They had an awesome mushroom soup that was super mushroomy. The egg salad was fantastic--lots of dill and very nice flavored. The bread was excellent--I had a whole wheat walnut. Service was lovely. 

Everyone eating looked like they were loving whatever they ordered. Portions are very generous.
author: Jen G.

description:
I am so happy to have found this mom n pop, cute, neighborhood cafe! And I live not to far away- even better!!!

My gal friend and I were craving something to replenish all the calories lost during our spin class and found this! ;)

We both ordered hot chocolate, the bacon egg breakfast sammy and for dessert shared the yummy croissant french toast with bananas and strawberries, of course.

Everything was so good! And the staff, then gentleman working was SO nice and helpful. Customer service definitely goes a long way and this place has it plus awesome food.

Thank you for the great food, service and not judging us for ordering so much food haha.

I can't wait to come back here for french toast again!
author: Remy-Anne V.

description:
The croissant french toast was nearly gag inducing and wildly overpriced for what it was. Imagine a costco croissant, mush it up and stir it in with eggs, plop it on a griddle. It was that much of a mess.

It came with no sides. Strawberries as a topping were another $3. They served it with blah syrup and one tiny pad of foil wrapped butter. 

Gag.
author: Ryan B.

description: I had the scrambled eggs w/potato, onions, cheese and added the avocado-very good.  Walnut toast was nice as well. The good food came with a friendly staff-I would certainly go back
author: Sacha S.

description:
Starting off my 22nd birthday with brunch because it's a must when in SF.
The restaurant is pretty small, so prepare to wait a while.

Cinnamon Pancakes
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chloes-cafe-san-francisco?select=Jt8OiAIQDqDQ2uKoPcaM5w#_yPlTT4QMKB1YSBYOfA0TA

Smoked Salmon Scrambled Eggs 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chloes-cafe-san-francisco?select=Jt8OiAIQDqDQ2uKoPcaM5w#L_TEijx6uAUXi2B0uSLKNw

Banana Walnut Pancakes 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chloes-cafe-san-francisco?select=Jt8OiAIQDqDQ2uKoPcaM5w#JcHdkMtF6d_cJzCTmosJPQ

Smoked Salmon
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chloes-cafe-san-francisco?select=Jt8OiAIQDqDQ2uKoPcaM5w#Jt8OiAIQDqDQ2uKoPcaM5w

Strawberries French Toast
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chloes-cafe-san-francisco?select=Jt8OiAIQDqDQ2uKoPcaM5w#7Tz4nC56bJC7SmF-YyaGnw

Avocado And Jarlsberg Cheese Scrambled Eggs 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chloes-cafe-san-francisco?select=Jt8OiAIQDqDQ2uKoPcaM5w#--1NxAfb26l5_ZulU64m2g

All Omelettes are Served With Home Fries Or Cup Of Fresh Fruit And A Choice Of Toast: White Rosemary, Whole Wheat Walnut, Sour Dough, English Muffin Or Bagel. 

Now onto the critiques:
1. The scrambled eggs were good, but they weren't amazing. 

2. Everyone loved the banana walnut pancakes better than the cinnamon pancakes.

3. The smoked salmon didn't taste fresh. It was just decent.

4. The fruits were a bit warm, which was off-putting for me.

5. The rosemary bread is amazing!! Definitely recommend this bread over the others.

6. Their homemade jam for their bread is delicious! But then again, the bread is good enough so you don't really need the jam.

7. I originally ordered a cup of fruit because I thought home fries actually meant french fries until I realized it was breakfast potatoes. It was early in the morning, I'm not functional yet... I was telling my friend if I should ask to change to home fries instead, but decided not to since they already started cooking. 5 minutes later, my dish comes with home fries and not a cup of fruit! Did they hear me, are they telepathic, or did they just get my order wrong...Hm....

Overall, it just wasn't good as I thought it'd be. I have really high standards for breakfast in SF..
author: Samantha C.

description:
A friend and I went to Chloe's on a whim, looking for a decent breakfast. It's in a great location so we had high hopes for a bomb-ass meal. The service was great - really friendly staff; I wasn't even bothered by the small size of the restaurant, but this place has GOT to get their prices under control. Firstly, everything costs extra - even the freaking tomatoes. I was feeling boujee so I was down to spend some MONEY on a good breakfast, figuring the portions must be really big (so you get your money's worth, duh). Big mistake. Huge. Pretty sure I paid close to $5 for tomatoes to be added to my omelette, thinking there would be a heaping supply. Boy was I wrong. Paid $5 for a sprinkle of tomatoes. Yikes. Same with the bacon. By all means, I'm down to spend money on some bacon but not if it's an over cooked MESS. In my days, I've eaten many a burnt bacon but this was pretty bad. I didn't even finish it. Gordon Ramsay would spit on this bacon. Secondly, don't get the cappuccino. Our waiter said it was his specialty and that he likes to make it strong. Cool, I love strong coffee. What I do not love: burnt coffee. Double yikes. We were sure to finish it because it was expensive - like $5+ if I remember right! Though, we pretty much chugged it like you would alcohol in a plastic bottle, trying to avoid as much taste as possible. 

All in all, this place is cute if you're a rich tech kid with terrible taste or an insanely wealthy family with kids who don't care about seasoned food. 10/10 for location, 10/10 for staff, but if I wanted to waste $20-$30 on a half-ass meal, I'd rather go LITERALLY anywhere else. Sure, this city is expensive and meals can get pretty pricey, but even over-priced hipster restaurants deliver delicious food. Is this what the city is reduced to? Over-charging a mediocre meal to pay rent? Welcome to San Francisco.
author: Cassandra A.

description:
What a cute little place! And by little i do mean little. Not a place for big groups, more like a date place for breakfast.
Because it is tiny I didn't want to eat there for too long because a line started to pile up but they're fast with the food and it's delicious!
My cappuccino was yummy but the fact that a milk cup was already on the table before I got there made me iffy. Maybe serve it fresh? 
I got the croissant French toast with strawberries and it was really good. Right amount of sweetness and fluffiness. Egg taste was there and the amount of strawberries was a very good amount. Happy with the service as well, go check it out on a breakfast date but don't take more than 2 people.
author: Celeste F.

description: Mmmm delicious cinnamon croissant french toast. Fluffy, buttery eggs and perfectly crunchy bacon. To top it off, free iced coffee after I finished my iced mocha. Impeccable service.
author: Michelle D.

description:
Had a Monday off and was looking forward to go to a nice breakfast/brunch place. Chole's Cafe is close by and with nice reviews, decided to give it a try.

Probably because it was Monday, the cafe was pretty empty. I was going to sit at the corner table inside but noticed there were constantly two bugs (fries) flying around which was super annoying..... moved one table to the left instead.

Heard about how good their croissant french toast is, but it was a scramble egg kind of day, so I ordered their special scramble on the Today's Special menu.

[Special Scramble]: B+
Description: two scrambled eggs with mushroom, basil, red onion, sun-dried tomato and mozzarella cheese. Picked a cup of fruit as side and rosemary toast.

It was alright. Didn't really feel anything "special" of it. Personally I would prefer more mozzarella cheese because I could only feel the cheesy texture but nothing from the smell nor the taste. There was a strong flavor of sun-dried tomato and probably that's why it covers the tastes from other ingredients. Portion is acceptable. Rosemary toast was pretty good. Fruit was okay-fresh.

Not sure if I am impressed by this place but since its close by, I think I would still come back to try their croissant french toast and smoked salmon as well. They both look pretty good in pictures.
author: Simon C.

description: Chloe's has the best mimosas. They also have very delicious food and the sweetest wait staff in a cute and quiet neighbourhood. One of my favourite spots in all of sf!
author: Ryan C.

description: The perfect place for breakfast. I come here because the servers are so sweet, and the breakfast is a creative but traditional take on American staples.
author: Malaya M.

description:
Love loves the muffin and split pea soup. It's very cozy and warm. Hubs did the jarlsburg cheese and avocado scramble. The mocha was ok, but service and staff were wonderful. Perfect for a cold, rainy Saturday and I am sure, any other well-behaved weather day. 

Definitely coming back.
author: elizabeth c.

description: Was suggested by a friend who's visited before and so glad we went for brunch. Great food and service.
author: Vanessa M.

description: What a charming and yummy brunch spot!  I passed by the Muni on the way to volunteering in Noe and noticed this place was quite busy on a weekday.  Ok, so I made a mental note to go back for brunch.  I went yesterday and sure enough it was bustling on a Thursday lunch hour.  Luckily, I got a table outside and enjoyed a scrumptious omelet with all sorts of fresh vegetables and cheese similar to Swiss (I forgot the name, yummy mmm), plus house potatoes and sourdough toast with butter and jam.  Oh and coffee!  Yum!!  I loved it and service was friendly and quick!  I heard it is quite busy on weekends and holidays as they are open everyday.  I will be back next time when I have the chance!
author: Maile N.

description:
My first ever review goes to Chloe's Cafe. This place is adorable, the food is hearty, and the service is amazing! I've never bothered to write reviews before, but the staff really deserves a shout out for the professional way they handled a difficult situation. 

It's a long story so I won't get into it here, but the basic premise is that a difficult customer wants to jump the waitlist and take a table the manager was intending on giving to us (we were the next in line). Said man begins acting like a spoiled child, shouting things along the lines of "IS THIS FAIR?!" when the manager refuses. Did I mention there were other tables available inside, but he refused all of them, stating that he MUST sit outside? 

Anyway, I went up to the manager and basically said that we would give the man the table he wanted and sit in one of the other open tables. She was apologetic and expressed how thankful she was. Later, when it was time to pay the bill, the manager refuses my card, stating that the meal was on the house because she wanted to thank us for being so accommodating. The lady was just doing her job, yet she felt the need to thank us for simply being reasonable! And we ordered at least 50 dollars worth of food. 

I would have left a generous tip if I was carrying any cash, but I guess a review will have to do. Just wanted to thank the staff at Chloe's Cafe for being so considerate! 

P.S. Try the banana walnut pancakes. Also the mimosas are delicious.
author: Emily Z.

description: Delicious food and service, totally loved this place and will be back! My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our omelettes, pancakes, potatoes, and fruit salad!
author: Shari A.

description:
Second stop on our summer norcal roadtrip!
Brunch is always a must whenever visiting SF. Of course, its also because we can't wake up early enough to call it breakfast, heh.
Our party of 7 arrived around 11:30am and was seated at noon. The restaurant was packed and relatively small. The interior was super quaint and cute!
I got the smoked salmon scrambled eggs with potatoes and rosemary bread. The eggs also had capers which gave it the saltiness it needed but it did become overwhelming after a while. I also liked the fluffiness of the eggs. The dish was quite big so I couldn't really finish everything. 
I tried my friend's pecan pancakes and those were so good!! Wayy better than the eggs. 
I also tried my friend's avocado scrambled eggs and they were a little too bland. He had to put in a lot of salt to get some more taste out of it.
All in all, a nice spot for brunch.
author: Heidi L.

description: Chloe's cafe is my new go to for breakfast when in the Castro. Great conversation with friends around great food. The thing that will keep me coming back is the service. The waitress was very attentive throughout our meal, making sure we had enough syrup, butter, or utensils. She also made sure to confirm the orders before she communicated it with the kitchen so we got our food in a timely manner without mistakes. I recommend the South Beach special, scrambled eggs with cheese and spinach with a side of smoky Canadian bacon and sliced tomatoes. The perfect light and fresh breakfast! They have so many other food options to consider too
author: John H.

description:
Dear Chloe's, 

I'm so sorry I didn't discover you sooner. Your food makes me feel alive. 

In a sea of boozy brunches, your food and atmosphere bring refreshing relief in the midst of a city of Sunday morning sinners (myself included). 

Your omelettes are cooked perfectly, your staff is friendly, your tables are adorable, and your coffee isn't even averagely bad in that diner-sort-of-way. 

Twice isn't enough. I shall visit you again soon. 

Your New Friend,
Dray
author: Andrea D.

description: Chloe's is my go to spot for always delicious and nutritious brunch choices, and solid service. The servers at Chloe's have all been there for 20+ years and it shows, they are stellar. You can grab coffee inside to drink while you wait, and kids often visit the fire station next door for tiny fire helmets. I'd recommend the banana walnut pancakes and special scrambles.
author: Katie R.

description: Ordered pecan pancake but there was no pecan in it..had asked for strawberries on the side in pancake..there were no strawberries When it came..taste of pancake and syrup was bad..they claimed orange juice was fresh but it was not.All in all a bad experience ..not coming back here again.
author: Prerna M.

description:
Chloe's Café is a quaint little, casual restaurant in Noe Valley that serves breakfast and lunch. My sister and I came here around 9:30 on a Monday so we were immediately seated. It's a very cozy restaurant and I can see it getting crowded on the weekends. They even have a sign-in sheet outside.

My sister had the smoked salmon and bagel platter and I had the BLTA w/ home fries ($1.50 up charge in lieu of salad). I wished my sandwich came w/ iceberg lettuce rather than red leaf lettuce, but other than that, it was a pretty decent BLTA. The home fries were crispy and seasoned nicely. My sister enjoyed her smoked salmon and bagel but was confused by the sliced hardboiled egg that came with it. Whatever! 

Total for us along with two coffees came to $35 with tax and tip (cash only, by the way). Service was very friendly and the bathroom is TINY! I wouldn't hesitate to return if I'm back in the neighborhood.
author: Julie B.

description: This is THE BEST cafe in SF! I've been going there for 17 years. Service and quality has been always top. Try their French Toast (made of croissants) and strawberries! :)
author: Barbara B.

description: Amazing food! Especially the avocados in everything and the pancakes. The best part of this restaurant is the low wait time and the spectacular service. The two older men who work there are very friendly :)
author: Sophie Z.

description:
It is one of the famous cafes in SF. That's why I probably waited for a couple of minute but after I grabbed my seat, dishes were served quickly. Also, every dish was so delisious. I had French toasts with strawberry and banana walnut pancakes and the scrambled eggs with potatoes and cheese. Especially, I liked the French toasts, poured on with some pure maple syrup. It was the best I've ever eaten in SF. In addition, we can add some side dishes which we want to eat. For example, you can pick three types of pancakes and some fruits or home made fried potatoes.
Our waiter was friendly and kind. He often paid attention to us even though they were pretty busy. The price was reasonable. One dish is around $10. 
The atmosphere was really casual because the cafe was pretty small but I felt so comfy.
I think it's worth it if you want an amazing brunch. It's one of my favorite places for brunch in downtown. If you go to this cafe, you will be satisfied with everything.   
I really recomend this cafe.
author: Mari T.

description: Delicious! I had the BLT with chips. I requested sourdough bread instead of rosemary. Staff was very friendly. My daughter had the pancakes and they were delicious as well.
author: Patricia M.

description:
Food is average. Ordered the breakfast bagel. It was fine, but nothing special. Needs a little something, maybe arugula? 

Service is wonderful. Kept a full cup of coffee the whole meal. Coffee coffee coffee.
author: Michelle S.

description: This review is way overdue, I've been here twice I came here a few years ago on my birthday. I live in the neighborhood I always heard good things about this place is always packed especially on the weekends.
