They have seating outside/ inside they have a little book where you could sign its really tiny so it's not good for big crowds. The food is phenomenal the service is fantastic the food is fresh and hot just like I like it. Definitely will need to come back here its been awhile but I would come during the week because the weekend you can't even touch this place unless you're there when they open up. If you haven't been here yet and ur looking for a grt place to eat breakfast, brunch or lunch come check it out for yourself you will not be disappointed you will leave with a full Happy Tummie.... :)
author: Lizzie G.

description:
Tried out Chloe's today with a friend who lives in the neighborhood.  It was a cold day, so after a little wait, we were glad to be seated inside.
Volume was loud, and surprised that the amount of people crammed into this tiny space wouldn't upset the fire marshal- but, quaint, nonetheless. Two different waitresses came to help take our order on two separate occasions.  We asked both for water.  Neither brought it, however, our coffee and cappuccino were served promptly.  We finally asked staff for water, and joked that maybe they had forgotten it because they could not charge for it. 
Menu was pricey- paid about $19 for 2 eggs a la carte, sausage a la carte, coffee, and croissant french toast (which we split the cost of).  Food was well-prepared, but with the culture of diversity brunches in SF, nothing to write home about.
We came, we saw, we ate, we will spend our money elsewhere.
author: Sara B.

description:
Going to Chloe's Cafe is like going to the tea party from Alice in Wonderland. There are flowery patterns on the table cloth and everything is set very delicately inside the cafe. You can really just look all around you to absorb the fairy tale of it all. Because when that Cinnamon Croissant French Toast is placed on your table, you'll be grinning like the Cheshire Cat.

The French toast is topped with fresh strawberries and powder sugar. Needless to say, it is very aesthetically pleasing (Instagram-Like magnet). The cinnamon is not over-bearing, especially if you drown your toast in syrup. The Croissant Toast is like defined layers of sugar and buttery goodness. Soft to the bite, and sweet to the touch. Don't worry, there is no diabetes or cholesterol in a fairy tale : )

I saw a couple of peeps with reading material coming solo to Chloe's. I think I'll like to try that too. I'll put on my Reading Glasses for my Sequel experience. I guess I'll be eating Chloe's 'Through the Looking Glass.'
author: Ringo M.

description: Way over priced and over rated. We had brunch here ordered 3 meals and paid over $60. The food was just OK, nothing special. We had the French toast, egg sandwich and the avocado BLT. I have had better at places I've paid a fraction on the cost.  At first the service was very slow and the first server we had was rude, the second server was much better. Definitely not worth the visit in my opinion.
author: Danielle R.

description: This place was incredible! Breakfast bagel and walnut banana pancake was dank sauce! Staff was exceptionally kind too
author: Kurt A.

description: I love Chloe's. The eggs are perfect and have a buttery flavor.  The banana walnut (i substituted pecans) pancakes are AMAZING! The staff is wonderful and friendly.  We have been enjoying meals at Chloe's for for 20 years, and the food is consistently EXCELLENT!  we have NEVER had anything that wasn't perfect.  YUMMMMM!
author: Theresa K.

description: Great cafe with homely and unpretentious setting. Very genuine service. The cranberry and almond pancakes were on point - not overly sweet! The smoked salmon scrambled eggs was really flavourful as well. definitely worth a visit!
author: Grace S.

description: This is easily the worst brunch I've had in a long time. We ordered two eggs scrambles and they were equally terrible. One was downright mushy. Everything tasted bland and processed like you'd expect at a highway diner. The bread ("potato rosemary", "walnut wheat") was totally flavorless! i can name half a dozen groceries within a mile of this restaurant that carry bread to die for and at $15 a plate this is appalling.
author: Karthik S.

description:
AMBIANCE Feels like comfy homey cafe in the midst of a nice neighborhood.

FOOD
Perfectly fluffy pancakes! Simple, buttery, good old fashion pancakes. 

Scramble with sausage, cheese, and veggies, was super hearty, served with potatoes evenly browned and crispy.

CUSTOMER SERVICE Sweet service with a smile! Our server was attentive, kind, and funny.

PARKING Street.

OVERALL Great brunch experience. Just my pace for a weekday brunch.

TIPS Try the jam on the pancakes.
author: Elsie S.

description:
When I'm catching up with my friends in Noe Valley, we usually wind up at Chloe's. Well, depending on the time or the line here, sometimes Toast or Fattoush... Catching brunch before 10AM is usually the best bet, most people in SF don't wake up until 10AM on the weekends, but after that the wait at Chloe's Cafe is usually 30-60 mins.

Chloe's Cafe has a great spot right on the corner. Big open windows to see inside and plenty of table seating outside, when it's nice enough (which come on, it's almost always perfect in SF). The wait is never too bad, most people usually have dogs and are pretty friendly. I usually prefer outside, the inside gets a little cramped and noisy sometimes.

Once you are seated, the staff is great about refilling water/coffee. The food is of course excellent. The scrambles are usually my favorite, with fruit and a side of bacon. The fruit across all the dishes here is always fresh and tasty! Which brings me to the french toast with fresh strawberries, always delicious. The salads are surprisingly good for brunch as well.

Only downside is cash only.
author: Matt B.

description: If you wake up on a warm and sunny day in San Franciso and want a reliable place to eat standard breakfast fare in Noe Valley--Chole's is the place to go. The food isn't fancy--you won't find bottomless mimosas--but what you will find is warm and friendly staff serving a great breakfast at a great value. Try the always fresh and delicious "Chloe's Salad"--that and the great service keep me coming back week after week.
author: Nathan P.

description:
For a brunch spot in San Francisco the food is unimpressive but will do if you're in the neighborhood. If my girlfriend didn't love their salad I would pass by toward the mission for much better food and service. 

I asked if they could make a tuna sandwich into a tuna melt and they refused to melt a piece of cheese on top. They serve other warm sandwiches. Frustrating that they won't melt a piece of cheese on a sandwich. 

Do yourself a favor, San Francisco is the city of brunch, go and get some high quality food and good service on 24th or down in the mission
author: Eric S.

description:
Amazing little cafe!! Stopped in for breakfast and it exceeded my expectations. 

Service is very friendly we were approached by two servers for our meals/drinks/questions, etc. 

Food is great! I ordered the special of the day which was a scramble with red peppers, onions, spinach, Brie, and mushrooms. I ordered it without mushrooms and with egg whites and they got it perfect. My boyfriend got the other special which was blueberry pancakes and he loved them. Fruit cups were plentiful and so fresh. Also the whole wheat walnut toast is great with homemade jam that they provide! 

Great place don't miss out!
author: Jazzy W.

description: Agree with Danielle's recent rating: "overpriced and overrated" is spot-on. I was really looking forward to trying Chloe's given all the great reviews, but the food was mediocre. The croissant French toast was barely edible as it tasted strongly of egg, and everything else we had seemed comparable to diner food but at brunch prices. My friend and I are picky about orange juice and asked whether the OJ was fresh-squeezed, and the server insisted that it's sourced from a vendor who squeezes it fresh and that it's so delicious, but it tasted like Tropicana to us. You'll get much more exciting and delicious options at Griddle Fresh just a few blocks away in Noe Valley.
author: Heather P.

description: LOVED THIS PLACE! Can I say that again. This place is definitely 5 stars. Cute SF restaurant that has a mom and pop shop feel. Was greeted by an upbeat, friendly server and got my food relatively quickly. Portions are big and presentation is beautiful. Sidenote: bathroom is teeny tiny. But ain't gonna bring this review down.
author: Rachel K.

description:
So good! The service is truly one of the most memorable aspects of this restaurant; our waiter was extremely personable, approachable, and attentive. Not to mention he suggested I switch my ordering strategy for a more cost effective option--very honorable. 

My friend and I went during the week at around noon and were promptly seated (but the space IS very small...). I ordered the chicken apple sausage sandwich with a side of hash browns (which were good but not as amazing as others say). The sandwich was delicious, particularly the rosemary bread. My friend ordered the soup of the day and a side salad with sausage on the side, all of which were pretty simple but done well. Would totally come back!
author: Gianna D.

description: Best scrambled eggs and pancakes ever. lol bagel is also really good. The service is great TJ is very personable
author: Ryan S.

description:
Gilmore Girl Fan? If you are looking for a 'Luke's Diner' This place would be the closest you could find in the area! Cute little cafe in Noe Valley, Wonderful breakfast served in a very quaint atmosphere. The food has never disappointed. 

There is usually at least a 30 minutes wait on Sundays/Saturdays so get there early!
author: Kelly P.

description:
Their special srammble today was ao good I was going to order it after I finishwd my blt but I was too full. The blt was really good served on this rosemary bread that was also really good. There was a bunch of lettuce which I love and 4 slices of bacon. The tomatoes were thick sliced and juicy. 

The first time I came here I was not impressed but then again didn't remember.  Looking forward to coming back.
author: Rene V.

description:
Chloe's cafe is good for breakfast. My regular order: Scrambled eggs, chicken sausage, wheat bread and grapefruit juice(little sour). I like it though.

They have a nice outdoor seating. I like eating with fresh air. Its on Caesar Chavez and church. 

Parking and environment : Street parking and place is kinda okay. I would give 4/5 for cleanliness.

Got, they are waiting for you :)
author: Pratik J.

description:
This little gem is a delicious breakfast spot. We had the special- egg scramble with potatoes and toast, and the croissant french toast with strawberries. First time I've ever had croissant french toast and it was good but a little rich as expected. Both were really awesome. I would definitely go back.

The staff is friendly and the service is great. Coffee and water were flowing.
author: Fedi A.

description: Our favorite pancakes in SF! We always bring our out of town guests here and they all fall in love. The male waiter (I wish I knew his name) is the best! We can't get enough of their banana walnut pancakes. Oh, and their special scrambles tend to be very yummy.
author: Cindy V.

description: Good, easy and honest food.  Didn't blow my mind but was plentiful, tasty and with good service. Will definitely come back for that dill egg salad!
author: Lucy B.

description:
Cutest brunch spot in SF. It's small though so get their early or you'll have to wait a while (like may places in SF they don't seat you until your while party arrives).  Delicious and filling scrambles.  I highly recommend the avocado scramble, which turns your eggs green.

My friend had the French toast which looked bomb.....and it must have been as she wouldn't share. Ah well, I'll be back.
author: Vee S.

description: DElicious! Everything on the menu is fantastic so just order your hearts desire! All the staff is absolutely superb & even remembers your name & what you ordered. They might have a wait but worth it!
author: Shannan G.

description:
My gf & I had a perfectly acceptable breakfast here, hardly anything to crow about, though. We mainly decided on this spot because of the positive Yelp reviews, most of which must have been submitted by locals who really love the place. 

After writing my name on the waiting list outside, we got seated in about five minutes. Not bad for a busy morning, although the place has such a small interior it isn't hard for it to fill up quickly. 

I went with a fairly rote option of egg whites, bacon, toast, etc. You know, the usual breakfast fare. All of it came out tasting just fine. It's kind of hard to screw up such a simple order, though I have had it happen before. 

I think what turned me off here was the service. It all felt very impersonal and the wait staff was just running around the entire time. I get that because there were only two waitresses on the floor they were busy, but I had expected something a little more personable perhaps. There was no warm candor here; it was all business and all rushed.
author: Anthony A.

description: Was looking for a brunch in Noe Valley (What a cliché !).  I already went to two other adresses on 24th so I decided to try Chloe's cafe. I had a great experience . It was on Tuesday so I was seated quickly, the waiters were nice and the food was great !
author: Tristan S.

description:
A tiny eatery with a long line and tasty breakfast/brunch options. We stopped by mid-morning on a Saturday and were seated within ten minutes (felt like I won the lottery).

I opted for the special scramble of the day (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chloes-cafe-san-francisco?select=HG9u26b5gEmhfaSEn02u1w#yxjHefQvUvsy_Smxta58rA) with broccoli, red peppers, onions, feta, and loads of dill (it was dill-licious), served with toast and a side of fruit. Hotstuff McBoyfriend went with the banana walnut pancakes, which were excellent. Both tasty dishes were out quite quickly, and the coffee was topped-off frequently.

Great service, great food, decent prices.
author: Adena B.

description:
I have been a patron of Chloes cafe over 3 years off and on agreed, lines are crazy, portions can be small and pricey but today I found I hit my limit-  $26 for 2 scrambled eggs with spinach, side bacon, 2 pancakes and an iced coffee!!! Why?!

This is a huge overhead of what eggs and pancake batter cost.  Total ripoff...pancakes were not evenlight and fluffy.

All this began because there are no substitutions if Idid not want toast or potatoes...had to go ala carte.  The server never pointed out the daily special for $14.95 with 2 eggs and 2 oatmeal pancakes either.  She in fact stated matter of factly that the added expense was in requesting vegetables... uh spinach?

I explained my displeasure and got a patronizing sorry.  She kept me waiting for the bill and beverages and the food was so so, not even hot.

Never again...way too pricey- Toast down the street is fine, at least there are no surprise add on expenses
author: Camille T.

description: Loved this place! The food was fresh, filling and so delicious. Our waiter was super nice and so attentive and had great suggestions. I like that they use ingredients they get that day. We sat outside and enjoyed the sun. Can't wait to come back again!
author: Faamaite M.

description:
Upon arriving, it had a very bathroom-y smell which bothered me a little at first but it went away a little after that. Due to the rainy weather when I went, we got seats fast on a Sunday morning. I ordered the salmon and dill omelette with a side of fruit and my boyfriend ordered the banana pancakes. The omelette was okay. It came with toast and (homemade?) jam as well and the jam was so good! I got a taste of my boyfriend's pancakes and they were pretty freakin amazing!!! 
We had friendly service throughout the time we were there which is a plus. 

On the other hand, my side of fruit had a fruit fly in it so I barely touched it....
author: Ashley D.

description:
I had the egg salad sandwich. The bread was so hard I had to eat salad first and then have the bread as a toast. Both sandwich and salad were served in a dish so small food kept coming off, maybe a bigger dish won't hurt.
The egg salad was really good though (even if I had to eat it in parts)

It's not my favorite. I may come back, but for sure I wouldn't wait in line for this place.
author: Maggie J.

description:
Oh Chloe!  You delicious, tasty girl!!!!  We are gonna be friends for a lonnnnng time!  I must admit, I had my reservations about coming in here as it looked a little too, "Noe" for me but I have once again learned not to judge a book by it's cover!

I had the avocado & Jarlsberg scrambled eggs, home potatoes and a bagel.  The serving was not only delicious but it was also HUGE! (My kind of place).  Even the jam for the bagel was awesome!

If you happen to be in Stroller City and want a hearty, piping hot breakfast, give my homegirl Chloe a try!  I now understand why the line is out the door on weekends!
author: Brian S.

description:
Came here with a classmate for brunch. 

She really likes it, but I thought this place was ok. I opted for the French toast with strawberries. The toast is dunked in eggs and topped with cinnamon. I usually like my French toast really soft and tender. This place didn't have it soaked all the way through. It doesn't compare to grand luxe or radish French toast. 

Would I try this place again? Maybe but not for the French toast.
author: Stella J.

description:
Very rare that I take the time to write a review; however, this is one of those situations where I must give some feedback given how great my meal was. 

I had the jarlsberg cheese and avocado scrambled eggs with a side of bacon, english muffin and a fruit cup. In addition, my friend and I split the banana walnut pancakes. That breakfast rocked my socks. The eggs were incredible and no matter what you order you must have their pancakes. 

Service was phenoms as well. Very friendly. Couldn't have asked for a better breakfast in my SF visit!
author: Nick G.

description:
The only reason I deducted a star was because it is CASH ONLY. Don't be surprised, the sign is right outside. 

Anyways, love the atmosphere of the restaurant and this area of SF. Just a great vibe to start your morning with a breakfast from Chloe's.

My party had ordered the tuna salad sandwhich with the rosemary bread, Grilled Ham, Roasted Red Bell Pepper And Jarlsberg On Croissant , and Red Potato, Cheddar Cheese And Onion Scrambled Eggs.

Everything tasted fresh and delicious. The tuna salad in my sandwhich was different than the "usual" you tend to expect from a tuna salad sandwhich. It had egg in it but it was very welcomed. The croissant sandwhich was awesome as well. The roasted red bell pepper and that jarlsberg cheese is what set it off. The scrambled eggs with the red potato and cheddar worked well. Very cheesy and surprisingly better than I expected. 

Service was A+, it looks like it is family owned/ran, and the staff was on top of everything. We never had to request refills on water, and timing on everything was just right. 

This place is simple and the menu is not complex. Don't expect complicated items. It is really strictly a set menu of items of SIMPLE breakfast varieties.

Pricing is about $10 per person per entree (not including drinks). Portion is good, and quality and flavor is very good. 

SF is great for foodies and I know there are many other great places to eat breakfast, but you can add another one to that list with Chloe's.
author: Eugene N.

description:
I have been to Chloe's twice, but have not been disappointed yet. The lines can get long so I usually go early to beat the crowd. I love their cinnamon croissant french toast. I've had it with and without strawberries. I like them both! 

Service is friendly!
author: Candice H.

description: Staff was extremely friendly! We shared the cinnamon croissant French toast and the breakfast bagel sandwich with home fries, both were great. Great little cafe!
author: Alyssa H.

description:
Was there for brunch on a really nice day, so the rather long wait was no problem. Be prepared for a long wait, but it's worth it I'd say. Nice and very efficient staff that have a friendly no-nonsense approach, didn't take to well to adjusting ingredients due to allergies, it was more of a "ok then you can eat this" but not in an unfriendly way. 

I had the very generous chefs salad that was really fresh off the cutting board, with a side of scrambled eggs. 

Seeing the similarly generous helpings of eggs, bacon, pancakes etc on the dishes on the other tables,  I can definitely say I'm going back again to try more things!
author: Donnie L.

description:
Be prepared to wait if it is a weekend. Worth the wait though! Once you sit, food comes fast.

Phenomenal food and drinks! We had two of the scramble specials. The egg scramble was not oily at all and super flavorful they step it up on the ingredients! The bread the give you is similar to something you would buy at Acne bakery...mmmm getting hungry thinking about it. 

Definitely go here.

CASH ONLY (I had to go a few blocks to a bank). Also the bathroom is small and you have to exit the bathroom to wash your hands in the kitchen. I can see why they did it though, small real estate.
author: Drew P.

description: This place is just okay. I expected more egg options. I also did not enjoy the cinnamon croissant toast the way some others seem to. I felt as though I was eating something different--and it was not what I wanted. A big plus was the large portion of strawberries. The service was very nice. The older gentleman was sweet and helpful when we ordered and returned three times to check on us. I appreciate the outdoor seating on a nice day. Good neighborhood, too.
author: Paulina F.

description:
Came for the croissant French toast. The cinnamon taste was very pronounced, but it had very little other flavor. Unfortunately he maple syrup didn't help, as it made it overwhelmingly sweet, even though I have a sweet tooth. 

The house potatoes were unique and delicious. 

Of note, it's a very small restaurant.
author: Alex D.

description:
Came here on Tuesday at 2:30pm, my bf and I were seated right away. The restaurant has limited seating with about eight two top tables. 

I ordered the croissant French toast with white eggs whites, and a cup strawberries. I believe it was one of their specials. The French toast was simply it tasted like they used croissants from Costco and the strawberries were sour. I also ordered a side of smoked salmon, which tasted very fishy. It was obviously not fresh. My bf got the banana walnut pancakes and scrambled eggs with a side of fruit. Good thing I tried the banana walnut pancakes. It was way better than the French toast.  

Note: I probably wouldn't stop by during the weekends since long waits are expected, but if you do make sure you stop by an ATM since this place is cash only.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Really, really cute place for brunch! Indoor and outdoor seating is available (both times I came here, I went for the outdoor seating especially on a rare sunny day in the city) My girl friend and I came here for a brunch date and went for the Croissant French Toast; one with and without strawberries! I LOVED it! Like others may have said, it comes out really fresh and isn't too oily or soggy; instead it is just right! They let you add on the syrup and other condiments yourself, but I'd have to say after eating it.. I was really full. Also, it doesn't look like a typical french toast. Kinda looks like a pancake!

Great service too. Waitresses kept checking up and filling up our waters. I like!
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Chloe's Cafe has charm and good food to boot. I came here on a weekday morning last month and ordered their breakfast sandwich with potatoes. Come here for the potatoes! I like mine crispier and these were delicious- great spices and crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. Eggs were cooked perfectly as was my bacon-I asked for it, you guessed it, extra crispy! 

The staff was kind and gracious and it felt very much like a locals spot, which I enjoyed. I was able to relax and enjoy my morning breakfast at a new favorite spot when I'm in this side of the city.
author: Kara W.

description: I absolutely love this place. It looks small and not fancy but the food was way above my expectations. The bread was toasted just nice, and the eggs were soft and creamy, not dry like the usual scrambled eggs I order at a breakfast place. The potatoes were the best, love it hands down. There's not so much queue which is better than queuing long lines at other crazy breakfast places in SF!
author: Qianqi L.

description: This place is outstanding! Outstanding food & service. Everyone I bring here loves their red onion scrambled eggs!! As well as their banana buttermilk pancakes, it is simply divine.
author: Timmi C.

description:
I have been to Chloe's cafe several times. Ow. I love the food here, the banana walnut pancakes more than anything.
But the service leaves a lot to wish for. There are 4 waitresses and 2 of them are nice and 2 of them are in a really mad mood all the time. I had been yelled at, my mom had been yelled at, and my sister too in different occasions!. 
They should take care of their costumers, I will not be back in a long time. It is sad that the service they perform affects the restaurant clientele. Saying so, the chef they have saves the day. The food is delicious. There must be more people like me that gets yelled at but they cant stop think about those pancakes!
author: Dianis R.

description:
Came here on a Saturday, because birthday boy was craving for their croissant french toast and he hyped it up so much I HAD to try.  I like it, but the dish lacked a certain crisp to it I'd expect... 

Service was incredibly friendly.  Except for the brief, awkward moment from the (I'm assuming one of the owner, seems like its a husband/wife type of biz) older lady who came by in a hurry to try and sweep our bill and clear us out--understandable, they close at 3pm and it was around 2:45pm.

It's a good spot to go to if I'm passing by, because the food is gooooooooooooooood.
author: Whitne Y.

description:
Wednesday mornings ... No wait! Yay.

We ordered the following:
- Bacon and tomato scrambled eggs: quite nice
- pecan pancake: tasty but dry
- trout sandwich: very mediocre

Overall, the place was fairly average. The menu simply wasn't that exciting. Given the neighborhood and the plethora of awesome brunch places, I just can't get excited about this place.
author: Ankur V.

description: Came here for their cinnamon croissant french toast. Was slightly disappointed... I don't know what I was expecting, but it definitely was not what I hoped for it to be like. Adding strawberries cost additional $$. Wish I didn't add them, they were extremely tart. I also ordered a side of their smoked salmon to balance the sweetness of the french toast. I think next time I'll order something savory.
author: Lina C.

description:
5/30/13 Breakfast

Nested in Noe Valley, Chloe is a neighborhood breakfast joint. It's tiny with 7 tables but on a weekend and being the first customer, I scored the corner by the window. For a tight place Chloe has a big menu. They offer scrambles, pancakes, and salads and sandwiches.

*Special Scramble ($10.95): this changes everyday. Mine is a scramble with portobello mushroom, diced red bell peppers and Jarlsberg cheese. Egg is fluffy and there's plenty to eat. Served with a cup of fruit with strawberry, banana, cantelope, and honey dew. 

I'm gluten-free most of the time so usually skip bread for breakfast. Nut I note that Chloe offers banana walnut bread for toast in addition to the usual wheat and sourdough bread. Their croissant French toast also looks yummy with lots of strawberries.

Overall it's a decent experience. Hearty breakfast with friendly service. Portion is comparable to Cafe Red on 25th/Mission but they offer you fruit. The lady kept checking on me for more coffee. Be prepared to wait on weekends unless you get here early. Cash only.
author: Matt Y.

description: Oh my goodness, so good! Can't believe it was our first time there after so many years in Noe. Everything was perfect. We scored a table right away, our server was amazingly attentive and nice, and our breakfasts were nothing short of delicious. Such a great little Noe treasure! Thank you, Chloe's!
author: E. G.

description:
Surprisingly No Wait + Sweet Servers + Sunny Outside Tables + Cutesy Tablecloths Inside +

(2 Bananalicious Pancakes + 2 Nicely Scrambled Eggs + Extra Crispy Home Fries = My Usual) + 

An Occasional Order Faux Pas + Cranky Better Half + $11.75 + Cash Only =

SATURDAY BRUNCH AT CHLOE'S CAFE
author: Amy C.

description:
This is a really cute breakfast diner located in Noe Valley. There is outdoor and indoor seating available. The menu had a good variety of items to order from. After eyeballing the selections after a while, I finally decided to go with the avocado and jarlsberg cheese egg scramble with white rosemary toast. My friend ordered the tomato and bacon egg scramble with home fries. We both decided to share an order of banana walnut pancakes and let me tell you... it was so delicious! Gluttony at its finest. 

I'm not normally a breakfast type of person, but I do have to say that I enjoyed the meal very much so. Everything was cooked to perfection and the pancakes were amazing, chock full of walnuts! I believe that whenever a menu item describes itself as such, I better see plenty of that specified ingredient. Chloe's Cafe did not let me down. No skimping on ingredients here!

I definitely recommend Chloe's cafe for all you breakfast/brunch people out there and even those who aren't so much into breakfast, like myself. I highly doubt you'll be disappointed. Keep in mind that seating is limited; however, the wait does not take too long to be seated. I waited approximately 5 minutes for indoor seating. Outdoor seating would've been much less.

I'm so glad that my friend enlightened me to this place! Maybe I'll be more open minded to breakfast joints from now on! All thanks to Chloe's. 

Great neighborhood spot! The service was great.
author: Ann S.

description:
Nothing says a good morning like a balanced breakfast. Okay, maybe this breakfast isn't that balanced, considering the high sugar content...but nevertheless it's so good! I was on Yelp with my friend trying to find a place for brunch that wasn't closed yet (it was 2:00pm when we started our food search)..and behold Chloe's Cafe in Noe Valley, San Francisco. 

FOOD
Let me start off by talking about the Banana Walnut Pancakes--they had like the perfect proportion of walnuts to bananas to pancake mix. The pancakes were so soft and fluffy. I really didn't need to add the syrup because the bananas were sweet enough.

Next up is the Croissant French Toast. When I took my first bite, I was seriously confused. I really couldn't say I was eating a croissant, or french toast. It was hard to convince myself that it is a hybrid of croissant and french toast. But I loved it! One thing to note is that the price for strawberries is seasonal--we added $4 for some strawberries, which is kind of a splurge.

VENUE
The reviewers were right. Chloe's Cafe is very small (less than 10 tables), but gives off a "homey" feel with its simple old-fashioned tablecloths and wooden wall-panels.

Would come back.
author: Vicki C.

description:
Delicious food, quick service.  The staff was very detailed, attentive, and friendly.  
Not sure about parking, we took an uber there.  
I would definitely go again.
author: Amber D.

description: Been to a few places in san francisco. We were recommended to go to this place and we are very happy we did. The first place here where the servers was super happy and good at their job. The food was amazing and the mimosa are a must!!
author: Tiara J.

description:
Chloe's is a quaint little restaurant reminiscent of a French countryside village cafe. With no more than 20 seats, it's compact and simple. Yet, from the table covers to the accents of the outside architecture, there is something so blissful about it. 

We came on a Sunday afternoon for brunch, and they were surprisingly able to fit all 6 of us quickly. Any more and they might've had some trouble.

- Croissant French Toast w/Strawberries: Deliciously fluffy and not too sweet. If you get french toast anywhere else, they'll pack loads of sugar into it. Here, they sprinkle a bit of powdered sugar and cinnamon, but the rest is up to you with syrup. The strawberries are definitely worth it, especially when topped with cinnamon and more powdered sugar. The small portion (2 pieces) is more than enough.

- Grilled Ham, Roasted Red Bell Pepper And Jarlsberg On Croissant: Served with grilled potatoes, cucumber, onion, and ketchup. This was my friend's order and I got to try a bit of it. Simple, but delicious. It's warm but not overcooked. The ingredients all blend together wonderfully. The potatoes are nothing special and make a nice side dish.

- Banana Walnut Pancakes: My friend couldn't finish his, so I helped him about a bit. You get the soothing aroma and taste of banana, with the crunchy texture of walnut, all in a dish I usually avoid at breakfast places for its blandness. To quote my friend, these are "bomb dot com." 

Service is attentive and friendly. You'll often see an elderly lady running around with ingredients, who just might be Chloe. Two other servers seem like her daughters and are always on their feet helping out customers. Seems like a honest family-run establishment, which I can always have respect for.
author: Dmitriy S.

description: Yum! This place is so good. Food is fresh...Banana nut pancakes are amazing! Eventhough the restaurant is small they don't rush you. Worth the wait.
author: Sandra L.

description: Wonderful place that I visited in my first Mother's Day! Food and service was superb.
author: Sbeen A.

description: TJ is the sweetest and makes the best Soy Latte.  Most places don't know how to handle the soy and he brought us the foamiest latte I've had.  He's also so attentive and delightful. The pancakes are delicious, my brother talks about them to everyone, and they only use fresh fruit, never frozen!
author: Ana L.

description:
I came here on a weekday for breakfast in my trying to gain weight phase, and ordered the Cinnamon Croissant French toast with fresh strawberries. After the first bite I realized I had just tasted something I had never had before, and it was pure awesomeness. It was refreshingly buttery, moist and sweet without having to spread any butter on top! Even now I am staring at the pic I took after writing this review and it is making me hungry again.
I complemented the French toast with a side order of chicken apple sausage, which was a good savory complement and not too salty which is just how I like it. 

This neighborhood restaurant is so cute and sweet I feel like I'm eating breakfast in a doll house. Not sure if I would come back on a weekend since the crowds could be hard to handle, but for a weekday Chloe's will definitely be on my return list.

One tip: Cash only!
author: Mark Y.

description:
Very warm and friendly service but we found the food very heavy and didn't enjoy the meal. We ordered the brie/tomato croissant, french toast (small order), and a special of the day scramble.

We have been trying a new brunch place every weekend for a few months now and this is the first one which didn't impress us. But the other reviews are good so maybe our experience was odd.

Good with Kids - No.
Food Quality - Felt very heavy
Food Taste - Average
Food Originality - Average
Price - Reasonable
Customer Service - Excellent
Ambiance - Average
author: Vibhor C.

description: I ordered the Pancakes and wow. They were REAL hearty pancakes made with love. I love eating food that feels like it's "Homemade" and thats the exact feeling I received from Chloe's Cafe. The service was great too, very friendly and hard working. I really sensed their dedication to the place. Personally the only thing that would stop me from coming back frequently is the price, but considering its location in Noe Valley, I'm sure its reasonable for the neighborhood. Just not in my budget.
author: Angelique G.

description: I live down the street from this joint, so i go here very often. I love this place and i'm always pleased with my meals!
author: Danielle S.

description: My cousin and I have visited this "find" the past two weekends.  We are hooked on Chloe's BLT and Avocado on Rosemary toast.  Small slices of cucumber and red onion are available for you to enhance this sandwich.  Bacon is wonderfully crisp and there's a bite of bacon in each bite.  No scrimping.  The avocado covers the sandwich and the sliced to-mah-to provides a refreshing flavor to the sandwich.  The lettuce is crisp and fresh.  Mmm mm!!  A generous sandwich, leaving no room for dessert.  Wait staff, especially TJ, are warm and friendly.  Even the customers are warm and friendly.  We sat beside a wonderful couple who had "yelped" for a restaurant outside of their neighborhood.  They were happy with the food, and we were happy with their company.  The indoor dining consists of approximately 8-10 tables, some of which seat four.  Outdoor seating is available, and on nice sunny Mission days are ideal for those who want their Vitamin D in the raw.  I live in Sacramento and my cousin in Fairfield.  Chloe's is the place we will be visiting when in the City.
author: Yulana L.

description: Pictures are totally deceiving. This little brunch spot is exactly that, little and cash only. Even though we were immediately seated, it took forever and a day to get our food. Though their strawberry French toast was amazing, their scrambles and country potatoes were mediocre. If you want to order the French toast and want something savory as well, definitely make sure you have a group of people there to share with you, because it is massive. I really wanted to love this place, but maybe I came on an off day. I totally wouldn't be opposed to coming back and giving it a second chance.
author: Cristal C.

description: Almost worth the long lines for brunch.  If you time it well and get their early enough, you'll feel it's worth it.  Lots of choices on the menu and nearly everything is very good.  My faves are the pancake and french toast options, the scrambles are so-so.
author: Saminda W.

description:
Chloe's Cafe- San Francisco ( Noe Valley neighborhood)

Ahhhh-  brunch at Chloe's. That's the part where you're actually eating...

It started with us driving around the Noe Valley area, trying like bonkers to find a place to park on street. It was Saturday morning, and apparently everyone in the neighborhood had the very same idea. Trying to find a parking space was like urban combat. We found metered parking 6 blocks away. Not the end of the world, it's a neat area to window shop and people watch!

We visited Chloe's for the first time, and found that there was a pretty good line outside. This is a tiny little hole in the wall neighborhood breakfast joint and it sure was crowded. We immediately noticed that the very limited number of staff did the work of 20 people each! They greeted everyone that walked up to the sidewalk sign in chart to put yourself in line for a table. The waitstaff chatted us up a little bit then rushed off to deliver food and attend to dining guests.

We soon discovered that the inside dining area was teeny time, as was the food preparation area. It is actually awesome because you can watch your food being prepared and delivered, and it is a very cozy, very clean, very nicely decorated place. Like eating at your Aunt Alice's for family brunch!

We ordered a ham and sausage omelette, banana Walnut pancakes, and croissant strawberry French toast. The food came out pretty quickly, and the attentive waitstaff kept the coffee coming. The food presentation was truly amazing. Each of the breakfast items came with gloriously prepared and displayed fresh fruit. The portions were very very hearty. The pancakes were fluffy contact with walnuts and banana the strawberry French toast was loaded with fresh sweet strawberries. And the omelette was stuffed! 

We will most certainly be back for brunch again. We will also plan on checking out some of the other neighborhood gems in this neat enclave. Try it!
author: Rick S.

description: Great food and service. Banana walnut pancake was our fav. Also they accept credit card!
author: V R.

description:
One of my favorites in SF. Every sip of mimosa brings me joy while sitting outside watching the firemen wash the firetrucks as the J line rumbles by. 

I come to this tiny hole in the wall for a cute neighborhood brunch and most importantly the baked brie and roasted tomato croissant... This tiny bundle of joy on the menu falls apart on your plate and in your mouth with an indescribable amount of flavor. I have yet to find a better combination of flavor and ambiance off the beaten path but still easy to get to. 

They can have my money any day and I'll be happy to give it to them while I soak up the sun and sip my mimosa, as always, garnished with a strawberry.

P.S. not good for groups don't bring more than 4.
author: Justin T.

description: 5 minute wait to be seated (we arrived around 12:30pm on a Wed) friendly service, brunch comfort food & now they accept Visa & MasterCard .. Awesome! Always my neighborhood favorite!
author: Geraldine R.

description: Really really great food and service! One of my favorite brunch spots in San Francisco!
author: Nani B.

description:
You don't have to "scramble" to anywhere else for the perfect scrambled eggs! :P

Chloe's Cafe, a small & quaint mom & pop kind of brunch restaurant makes great scrambled eggs. We had the avocado scrambled eggs which was eggcellently  scrambled (yay for not being runny!) had a lot of avocado mixed in (perfect for those avocado lovers!). The potatoes were delicious, but I enjoyed the fruit cup even more (bananas, strawberries, etc). The pecan pancakes included a generous amount of pecans and was pretty good.
author: Emily C.

description:
This a nice little place to catch lunch or breakfast. 

Kind of hidden but the food is super good. Got the eggs special with jarlsberg cheese, so delicious. 

Employees are nice and check in frequently to make sure your ok. 

On rare sunny days there's tables to sit outside but on our usual cloudy cold days recommend sitting inside.  There's not many tables so if you get there during rush times there might be a wait.
author: Rogelio V.

description:
This place is pretty great. Not amazingly spectacular to justify the predictably long line on the weekend for brunch. But yummy cinnamon croissant french toast with strawberries and I love their egg scrambles (especially the avocado/jarlsberg cheese). 

Go outside of the brunch rush to avoid the wait--(before 10am, after 1pm). 

Cash only!
author: Sarah D.

description: Enjoyed the food atmosphere and service in this quaint little cafe in Noe Valley.  We were looking for a breakfast place that was open during the week and stumbled on this cafe. We were so happy we did. I had cinnamon french toast covered in fresh strawberries.  I ordered a small order but had enough to take home. It was so good!
author: Rj H.

description: friendly waiters and a very good quality of food, even if the fresh orange juice comes from the bottle ;-)
author: Harald K.

description:
This is on the corner of church & 26th, and it's got that quaint little vibe. The inside is super small but there is outside seating as well, but I feel that creates that aspect of that atmosphere that I like. This is a really busy spot and service is a little slower(ok, very slow but that is to be expected), but great waiters nonetheless. 

The chef salad is great, fresh & crispy vegetables. The produce is on point to say the least. The house dressing is really delectable. The portion was pretty generous, and the ham and turkey were really flavorful. 

All in all a great dining experience in SF. I would definitely come back.
author: Leigh S.

description: Very fresh and fast service. The place is small but accommodating. The veggie scramble was huge and I could hardly finish it all. Coffee was great as well.
author: Danielle F.

description:
Chloe's is one of my favorite brunch places in San Francisco! Looking for parking is tedious, but those long minutes of scavenging for parking is worth it. Great service, friendly staff, and yummy food!

I've had their omelettes (The salmon scramble is my favorite!), french toast, banana and walnut pancakes, and mimosa! 

Chloe's never fail to disappoint :)
author: Emily L.

description: Solid place for a solid breakfast! Their buttermilk stack is flavourful entirely on its own, but I opted to add strawberries. It came piled with fresh ones! The coffee was strong and tasty, and refills were prompt. They even put your coffee in a to-go cup once you're ready to head out if you like! Also can't beat their selection of breads here. Excited to come back and try lunch!
author: Angela E.

description:
Cute little breakfast joint with classy Frank Sinatra music subtly playing in the background. Food and service are also on point. Love!

My friend and I got the following delish and highly recommended breakfast items: Avocado & Jarlsberg Cheese Scramble, Red Potato, Cheddar & Onion Scramble, and the Banana Walnut Pancakes. 

We originally did not order all three, just the first two. Then my friend found a hair in her scramble and discretly flagged our waitress. The waitress apologized profusely and took it away. She came back with a menu and asked my friend if she would prefer something else so we decided to go with the Banana Walnut Pancakes. What a good move since it was so scrumptious!

        --Avocado & Jarlsberg Cheese Scramble: You can easily mess up such a combination by making it too bland, but they know how to pair the correct cheese so it's not too lacking nor too bold for a scramble. The lively green avocado was a buttery, velvety addition. I highly recommend this one, especially to you skeptics!

        --Red Potato, Cheddar, & Onion Scramble: This scramble could've easily been too salty provided the cheddar but they added just enough! It could've been too starchy, but the potatoes were cooked just right. Delicious for the most part until we found the little uninvited strand. 

        --Banana Walnut Pancakes: I'm not a pancake person since I quickly grow tired of the cakey taste. BUT, these were exceptional! Paired with some maple syrup... they were divine. Absolutely divine. I most definitely would get these again.

In being sincerely apologetic for the previous mishap with one of the scrambles, they only charged us for one meal. We really appreciated this customer service oriented manner! We're all entitled to mistakes, and we're glad they acknowledged it and tried to build our trust again. 

Cute, petite place... tasty food... and accommodating service. :)
author: Kathleen N.

description: The wait can be pretty long at Chloe's.  But once you've eaten there, you'll understand why.  We always drop by during off hours so the wait is never a problem.  When the weather is nice, it's a great place to bring the pup with the outdoor seating available.  I'm a big fan of the cinnamon french toast and the pecan pancakes.  But everything else I've tried has been delicious.  If you have a chance, check it out.  Highly recommended.
author: Alex G.

description:
Came here many moons ago with my former roommate. 

Brunch was mediocre.
author: Jboogie L.

description: A great neighborhood breakfast spot. We love coming here. The service is friendly (not always the case in the city) and the food is consistently good. Don't come here expecting some foodie fantasy meal. It's good food in a cozy spot served by kind people.
author: Teny S.

description: I got a tasty California-style salad with avocado carrots and greens. Solid sized portions, friendly service, nice atmosphere. Can't go wrong here other than waiting for a table during the brunch crush.
author: Joshua G.

description: I had the dill egg salad sandwich and it was good, but I got an Italian baguette and the egg salad got smushed out. I also had a lemonade. It's a small, quaint restaurant with a nice breakfast and lunch menu that will leave you satisfied. Service is good.
author: Denise C.

description: I decided to finally check this little gem out. Definitely charming & lives up to its homey reputation. The staff, however, are less than friendly. I was seated and immediately asked if I was ready to order my meal before being given a menu. I get that this is a locals' spot, but, um...maybe I want to have a minute to decide? Croissant I eventually ordered was soggy. I'm disappointed.
author: Tamara V.

description: Lovely brunch cafe. Cinnamon croissant French toast was svery good! Unique! I picked this place because of the name Chloe....which is my name and I have no regrets.
author: Chloé E.

description:
Over-priced diner food. Menu doesn't have anything unusual. Pancakes are bland and very fluffy. They serve artificial maple syrup. Paid $50 for short stack, and two egg dishes and coffee. In any city in the USA, that would cost $20. 

Coffee was really bad too. We got both black endless cup of coffee and a cappuccino. SF has amazing coffee available. So, I have higher expectations. 

I wouldn't eat here unless I lived in the neighborhood and it was the only place available. 

Also, it's popular and there are often long waits for a small number of tables.
author: Jeff C.

description: Chole's cafe is a must on my "take people who visit" restaurant list.  Their french toast is the very best and I love their sandwiches too. Its very cozy and I love that you can eat outside in the sun on warmer days. This makes it the perfect place to have brunch and visit while sipping on mimosas.
author: Angela D.

description: Stopped in this neighborhood café for lunch. Great sandwiches and salads with very fresh ingredients. My half tuna salad and a garden salad was delicious. My wife had  an avocado and cheese sandwich which she couldn't finish. The sandwiches are quite large, fresh and tasty. The place has tables on the sidewalk as well as inside it's small and local and a very pleasant place to have lunch.
author: Roy H.

description:
This place was good, atleast for my first time. The boy & I came here on a random Tuesday for a late lunch. 

I had ordered their special scramble of the day(?): The Northbeach Scramble. It had mushrooms, tomatoes, pesto, and cheese. I thought the flavor was just OK and the scramble was a bit on the runny/wet side. I don't know if it was due to the veggie ingredients or the pesto but the dish could've been a bit more dry. The house potatoes were good though. 

The boy however had a shortstack of their buttermilk pancakes and LOVED it! He's still talking about it several days later. So giving it 4 stars because he was a fan. 

The place is small, so unless you're coming on a random afternoon like the boy and I did there's a good chance you'll have to wait. I may come back just to try the pancakes.
author: Jocelle A.

description:
Cute place, very tiny.

Good coffee. They have a special house blend.

Croissant french toast, we got a short statck, its a bit heavy but still tasty. 
Bacon tomato scramble was good. The tomatoes really made the dish. 

Staff is very attentative and nice.
author: Erica L.

description:
Of all the brunch places that I've tried so far, Chloe's Cafe is just a-ok. It's cozy and quaint, but they managed to seat a party of 6 in there. I came here to meet with some friends before I drove back home to LA, and it was about noon. I had actually already eaten in the morning somewhere else but was able to eat 2nd breakfast (like a hobbit)!

I got the french toast (no strawberries since they weren't in season, it was kinda expensive to add them on). Regardless, the french toast came out and they were pretty good. Light and fluffy, def a good choice for 2nd breakfast. I had some coffee with it, pretty standard.

It's nice, but I'm definitely keen to try some other places.
author: Erin H.

description:
Mmmm my favorite breakfast spot. Everything about this place is delicious- you can't order a bad dish! My very favorite were the banana pancakes. 

Only reason why it doesn't get full stars is the unfortunate San Francisco parking situation and the fact that it sits like 20 people max lol. It's a very small establishment. But most definitely worth the wait!
author: Kaitlin G.

description:
Oh Brunch, how I love thee. You may even be the best meal of the day to me. I'm brunching up all the restaurants in my neighborhood and Chloe's is a good one. I've been here several times and it's been consistently good with large portions.

Although I see teams of people waiting outside for their breakfast, I have never waited longer than 10 minutes to be seated. Guess I'm just lucky or smart to get there at the right time. The last time I was there with Rosy and Kel, it was not crowded and the service was excellent. 

The coffee is hot and good, they will bring you as much as your heart desires. I guess you can only have so much, right?

I usually go for the Jarlsberg Scramble, but last week I had the Bacon and Cheddar and added Avocado. It reminded me of a club scramble and was very tasty. Try the Rosemary Bread, it's pretty awesome. 

My only complaint? It's that they don't have an Eggs Bennie on the menu. Such a crucial element in my brunching. Please work on it Chloe!
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Recently I've been on a weekendly brunch binge. Yup, I'm also making up words.

Chloe's was this past weekend's adventure. No wait, hooray! Okay, maybe like 5 minutes, but for brunch in SF, one can hardly call it a wait. 

ALSO, they were apparently cash only, but they accept credit cards now!

Service is prompt and friendly and the coffee cups never went empty.

What went into my belly:
House special coffee - cleverly named Fog Lifter. I'm no coffee connoisseur, but the coffee tasted nice and light, not too acidic. I don't like super acidic coffee.

Croissant French Toast - It tasted fluffy, cinnamon-y, and good, but I felt like it was overly "eggy" if that's a thing. I guess in French Toast, you can see the toast and it's just slightly dipped in the batter, but for the Croissant French Toast, I didn't really see much croissant, but just saw a lot of the egg batter and doesn't match some of the pictures I saw on Yelp. Anyway, you make of this what you will. :P

Special Scramble - We got the special scramble of the day.  I forget what was all in there, but I remember the sun dried tomatoes, mushrooms, and lots of other stuff. Haha. It was good, came with home fries, and toast.
author: Dolores L.

description:
I challenge you to find a better breakfast/brunch in the city. You will not be disapppointed with the daily specials on the board. High quality egg scrambles, tasty rosemary toast, and something so simple as a fruit cup/bowl.....nobody in the city does it like Chloe's! Yes, there can be a wait most times. Friendly and efficient staff here.
Also, it says good for kids: no.   My kids disagree. I have been taking them here for years and they love the pancakes/eggs/fruit cups.
author: Jodie S.

description:
How should I feel about Chloe's.....I'm torn. It's good, but it's not like OH MY GOD THIS IS GOING TO KILL ME GOOD.

The lines outside Chloe's on weekends is way too long. I never come here on weekends. I don't understand why people would stand in line for 40+ min to get scrambled eggs. Let's just say I never wait for scrambled eggs.

That being said, I eat here very often. Often enough to see some why it's great.

Why I think Chloe's is one of the most crowded brunch place in my hood:

--- CONSISTENCY. Yes, I just realized that. No matter what day you go, when you go, the food will always taste the way you tasted the first time. The eggs are never runny, the toast are never burned, and the coffee is the same. For this point alone, I think this place rocks.

--- Their scrambled eggs probably uses butter (and maybe dash of milk) in it, because it's much more tasty than your averaged scrambled eggs. Top it with some black pepper too!

--- Their pancakes are always good. Sometimes they have special pancakes where they throw in some almonds and fruit, but it's pretty much always the same good stuff.


Here's some minor points I don't like about Chloe's:

--- cash only. There is an ATM machine in the corner store next door, but still. I don't like it.
--- small menu. This is both a blessing and a curse. If I don't want scrambled eggs or pancakes, I'm out of luck.
--- too long of a wait on weekends. I usually just go to Fattoush which is 3 doors down and has *amazing* mediterranean style brunch with a bigger menu.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Cute little cafe that serves amazing breakfast food.  I got their special of the day scramble with spinach and tomatoes.  French toast was full of fresh strawberries on top and very delicious.  

Service was good.  I came in a little (ok...fine....like...40 minutes) before my friend and the waitress had me sit down and browse the menu while I waited.  She didn't seem to mind that the whole restaurant was already filled up.  I felt a little bad, so I ordered a grapefruit juice first.  

They are cash only, so be sure to carry some cash when you come here!
author: Jenny L.

description: Sooooo good! The croissant French toast here is by far my favorite item on the menu! I love croissants.. And I love French toast so this is just amazing. I've tried the different pancakes they have and they're also good. The restaurant is kind of small, so you'll probably be waiting a bit so get here when they open! Service is great and friendly.
author: Tammy N.

description: This place is a really great breakfast place.  The food seems fresh and it pretty tasty.  Went on a Saturday morning and didn't even wait 10 minutes before a table opened up.  The server was very friendly and attentive.  Definitely recommend for a cute breakfast place.
author: Diana M.

description:
Local gem! 
Very friendly and fast service. The food, wow! So good! I had the salmon scramble and added cream cheese and onions. My friend had the blueberry pancakes. Those won't disappoint ya either. Give this place a shot, well deserved 5 stars! Will be coming back soon. :) #homefeelingambiance
author: Dina R.

description: The wait time is super long.  The place is super small. The toilet is tight. The sink is tiny.  Red potato scrambled eggs is like home cooking. Very little oil. The potato on the side has a strong butter taste.  Cappuccino is ok.  Waitstaff is cordial.  I am not waiting in line for this again. The food is not bad. But the line is too long.
author: Byron L.

description:
Excellent food, and much better than I remembered from a visit several years ago.  I guess it would be, with all those Zagats ratings framed on the wall, and 23's and 24's for food!  

I ordered a two egg scramble, and added chicken apple sausage, tomato and mushroom.  Turned out to be a delicious savory combo (great at the restaurant as well as for leftovers!)  It comes with a fruit cup that isn't one of those typical goopy concoctions of cantaloupe, wintermelon and a bit of pineapple.  It was a really nice cup with slices of banana, strawberries, wintermelon and orange!  Also comes with your choice of toast, with jam.  I had the whole wheat walnut, which, truth be told, was a bit dry.    

My brother ordered a special - scrambled eggs with portabella mushroom, yellow bell peppers, green onion and choice of cheese.  Also with toast, and choice of fruit cup or home fries.  Also had a blueberry muffin which was moist.  He really liked his meal too.  

Note they don't do egg white substitutes, but they do have soy milk!
author: Vivian W.

description:
This is my go-to breakfast place. Everything here is absolutely tasty. My favorite is their smoked salmon plate. It's got tons of delicious "accoutrements!"

Their daily specials and soups are always spot-on. You can really see that everything they serve is fresh. And the strawberry jam/jelly is definitely great!
author: duane a.

description:
Extended set.

With Markus: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/markus-schulz-tickets-14901598081

Next day at Chloe's: Cinnamon croissant French toast topped with strawberries and a chicken apple sausage egg white omelette with home fries and wheat walnut toast.

French toast was different, sweet but with little structure. Generous helping of strawberries was almost the best part.

Omelette was excellent. Digging through the multiple slices of toast and jam and mound of potatoes felt like it would never end. That would be fine. 

Also had their house drip blend which didn't need milk (only 2% available) and somehow made only five hours of sleep from the night before seem tolerable.

Wait was less than thirty minutes around 2pm. For such a popular and cozy neighborhood institution (around since the '80s) it seemed more than reasonable.

Not sure you can say that about the price. About $30 for two individual dishes, shared French toast, coffee, tax and tip for the friendly staff. Felt it was a bit high.

Five stars for Markus. Four for Chloe's.
author: Jason B.

description:
Amazing.

Chloe's was my first brunch in the City and to this day remains my favorite, and not just for sentimental value!

All of their scrambles are to die for. My favorites are the tomato bacon and salmon scrambles. Their potatoes are perfect every time and their fruit is always fresh and tasty. Drinks are delicious, the coffee never stops pouring, and the staff is awesome. What else could anyone want?

Well, maybe a shorter wait, which can be painfully long during weekends hangover rush hour. Also, the place is cash only, so come prepared (or download Venmo to pay a friend back).

Aside from the great food and staff, the atmosphere is what really gets me coming in time and time again (at least once a month, in fact). Whether you sit inside or outside, Chloe's always feels warm and homey.

I already can't wait for my next Chloe brunch next weekend!
author: Teiki K.

description:
Weird place.  Only serves scrambled eggs.  No fried, no omelets, no egg whites only.  Probably use institutional liquid eggs to save money.

Toast on Church and 30th ... so much better.
author: J B.

description:
OVERALL GOOD. ENJOYED THE MEAL.  DIDN'T HAVE THE UMPH FOR 5 STARS.

The croissant french toast with strawberries wasn't as spectacular as I would have expected for such a delicious sounding dish.  It wasn't bad, but would not order this again.

The eggs - avocado and cheese needed some bacon but was very good with a side of acme walnut bread/toast

The coffee was outstanding. "Magic" coffee from napa/sonoma? I need to google this stuff..

Nice low-key brunch spot - would be awesome if it was a "walk-in" place where you did not have to wait for a table.  Very small (limited seating) inside - a few tables outside when the weather is warm.
author: Melody T.

description: This place was unbelievable. It's not big so you're going to have to wait for a table especially if you want to be outside for brunch on a sunny day. Even so, the food and attentiveness of the service was good enough to command an hour wait and my a 25-minute wait. We loved it!! Fresh squeezed OJ, the avocado jarlsberg scramble, and the French toast with fresh strawberries- all fantastic. I liked the scramble best, with extra fruit and a side of chicken apple sausage. Definitely coming back!
author: Liza S.

description:
This was our second time coming here. Six of us ate brunch here for $90 plus tip.

Be prepared to wait 30-45 minutes on the weekend. The service was friendly but extremely slow. Definitely do not go with a group of more than 6. This place is best for groups of 2-4. We all enjoyed our food and the potatoes that come with many of the entrees are SO good! Wish I wouldn't have opted for the fruit instead.

Bring your pup and enjoy your meal outside :)
author: Sofia M.

description:
We saw this place on our way to Pomelo one Sunday brunch and decided that this one would be a place that we would have to try this place as well. We looked it up on yelp and croissant french toast? We'll have to get it. 

The boy ended up getting the cinnamon croissant french toast and man was that delicious. In addition, he got it with strawberries and it was good! A little bit of syrup, french toast, and strawberry is a great combindation. 
I ordered the potato, cheese, onion, and sausage scramble. It was delicious. It was VERY filling, but the portions aren't that bad. Super good. 

The place is pretty small so go early! We got a seat inside which was nice, but outside isn't bad either.
author: Nina Y.

description:
We ate here twice in the two weeks we stayed in the neighborhood. 
Food was great both times. Mimosas are $6.25 each.
Their smoked salmon is fresh/not fishy. Pancakes and eggs are both fluffy and delicious. Bacon and hash browns were crispy.
We paid with a credit card with no problems.
author: Carrie N.

description:
GREAT BREAKFAST FOOD!!!!!

My boyfriend and I shared the french toast and it was THE BEST FRENCH TOAST I had ever had.  It wasn't soggy like 90% of places serve it, but instead crunchy. I think that's what sets it aside from most breakfast places. It also went well with the strawberries. 

I got a trout sandwich, came with homefries. The sandwich was yummy, and had a kick in it from the dijon mustard. The bread was crunchy and soft at the same time, and it was overall a great sandwich. Homefries were great as well. My bf ordered an egg scramble special with basil, tomatoes and onions....pretty good. If you love eggs, I'd suggest an egg special!

I loved the service a lot - the Asian lady (does anyone else notice that all breakfast places seemed to be owned by Asians? just an observation) was so sweet and made us feel at home :)

Come on a weekday if you can, we were lucky to snag a table for 2. Plus the parking will be easier!
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
I don't think a restaurant needs to roll out a red carpet in order to deserve 5 stars. Chloe's Cafe is presents simple comfort food that's fresh, quick, and very reasonably priced. Tucked away in a quiet corner in Noe Valley, Chloe's was a very good find for delicious brunch on a Sunday afternoon. My bf and I went around 11:45am expecting to get quoted with a 45min wait time, but we ended up only waiting around 10min (we beat the rush; a huge line started forming after we sat down and ordered). 

What we ordered: 
- special scramble of the day: 3 eggs, scrambled with spinach, basil, tomatoes, and brie. served with your choice of toast (I chose whole wheat walnut) and fresh fruit or house fries (I chose fruit). Fantastic. The eggs tasted super fresh (and I normally wouldn't be able to decipher between different tastes of eggs, but these tasted GREAT) and I swear the food was served less than 15 minutes after we ordered. Quick. 
- banana walnut pancakes with standard eggs scramble and fruit. The pancakes were so fresh and made with love that you could easily taste the crunch of the walnuts mixed in with the sweetness of the bananas. So good that you don't even need to drizzle it with syrup. 

If you're looking for wholesome breakfast foods that won't break the bank and without the greasy after-feeling (you know, that food coma feeling you get after devouring too much poorly made hash browns and rubbery sausage links), come to Chloe's.
author: Helen W.

description: The service here is so good (food is great, too) -- but the warmth of the staff really makes coming here such a delight. Definitely recommend!
author: Mel G.

description:
So ummmm...there was a wait on a Friday around mid-morning. Don't people need to work (myself included)??

That was enough to keep me intrigued and waiting in line at Chloe's as I watched people devour their croissant french toast with fresh strawberries ($12.50 or $10.50 without the strawberries), their egg scrambles, etc.

I went with what appears to be the most popular dish - the croissant french toast with strawberries.  I believe it came with 3 whole croissants cut in half and the entire plate was decorated nicely with fresh, sweet strawberries.  It was a nice twist to french toast that I hadn't experienced before and definitely hit the spot.

The group I came with also got a variety of other dishes, including egg scrambles, omelettes, etc. and no one had anything bad to say about the food!

Service was great, but expect to wait a little bit of time due to the limited space (both inside and out)

If you're ever in the area, I'd definitely recommend checking out Chloe's!
author: Andrew C.

description:
I used to frequent Chloe's for the cinnamon croissant french toast... until I learned to make my own cinnamon challah french toast at home, which I feel is quite comparable. I do, however, still have fond memories of Chloe's and would return if I were ever in the area and wanted a nice a brunch meal. If you are a fan of sweet over savory brunches... please, please, please order the french toast for your own sake. It changes the game. 

I also remember enjoying (quite a bit) the chicken apple sausage and their breakfast potatoes, which were pan fried for awhile giving it a great bite and crunch even after it's been sitting out for a while. 

There are a bunch of breakfast/brunch spots in the city and Chloe's is one to try!
author: Kim N.

description: cute little breakfast spot. wait and parking wasn't too bad on a Friday afternoon. avocado eggs were fantastic! the jam was flavorful and sweet! service is great and food delicious!
author: Jenn T.

description: I live down the street from this place and I try and go here all the time. The food and service is great. Awesome brunch place on a weekend.
author: Nicholas F.

description:
The food here is good, no doubt about it but there is one dish that stands out the most to me and that is the....

Strawberry Croissant French Toast, I took one bite and the thoughts of Fall and Christmas surrounded me. A big smile came across my face and I couldn't be any happier, I just felt so warm inside.

If you love the holidays this might be the dish for you...It must be the cinnamon, it has to be that,or its everything, just the combination of flavors engulfed my tongue and all I could feel was the winter season.

Give it a go~
author: phillip w.

description:
All I'm going to say is Strawberry Cinnamon Croissant French Toast.....you can thank me later

Custardy, soft, & the strawberries are extremely sweet & juicy - this is my kind of frenchie.  Served w/ REAL maple syrup

3 out of 4 of our group ordered it & all plates were cleaned w/ multiple Mmmms throughout the eating

We all ordered the Small portion - props for offering small & large options!  While you think you'll be able to polish off a large, take my word for it, the small ain't no small!

Our 4th groupie chose the Banana Walnut Pancakes & was pleased w/ his choice but I could tell he was secretly jealous...I have not tried their pancakes (as I always go for the frenchie) so can't speak on it, 1st hand, except to say they were BIG, looked cakey ( like I like them ) & soaked up a lot of syrup.....which in my book, is also a good thing

Best tip:  as w/ anything in SF, you want to get here early.  We arrived around 9:15am on a Sun & there were already 2 tables ahead of us

CASH ONLY
author: Adrienne G.

description: I have lived in Noe Valley for more than four years now, but I had never been to Chloe's until recently. I don't know why I never made it, but I'm glad that I did. I highly recommend the banana walnut pancakes -- the banana slices and walnuts are baked into the batter, which is delicious. The service was polite and efficient -- they were pretty busy, but attentive (refilling water glasses, etc.). The wait was around 25-30 minutes on a Sunday around 11:00 a.m. We sat outside, which was nice -- the sun was a bit blinding, though, so if this bothers you, it might be best to wait for an inside table.
author: Katie M.

description:
Good breakfast food.  I enjoyed the smoked salmon, capers and dill omelette.  The fruit portion was generous.  Overall a good place, my friend and I went late afternoon on Saturday and waited just under 10 minutes.  

The service was a bit slow, but totally understandable given the small footprint of the cafe.  

One plus was the waiters walked through frequently enough to fill my water glass.  I'd label this place as a safe bet for a consistent breakfast to lunch experience.
author: Andy S.

description: A scrumptious, ultimate breakfast. Everything was faultless about my eggs with avocado and jarlsberg cheese. It was cooked to perfection with just the right amount of cheese and ripe avocado. The accompanying fruit (cantaloupe, banana, strawberries, honeydew melon, and orange wedge) was ripe and full of flavor. I will be returning!
author: Irene N.

description:
This is one of my favorite brunch places in the city. Cute and cozy.

Like most popular brunch places in the city, you need to wait in line. So get there early. It is worth the wait.

Croissant French toast with fresh strawberries is a must.

Bring Cash!
author: Molly T.

description:
i am torn between a 3 and 4 star. The service is AMAZING and the waitstaff are so nice all the time. they really accommodate to people with kids. 

But the food is not that great in all honesty. it's fine, but that's about it. nothing is really all that fresh. orange juice tastes like it's minute maid, not freshly squeezed. 

but the service is great, so i don't mind coming back!
author: Eunhee K.

description:
I do think the wait (at Chloe's and similar mom and pop greasy spoons in The City) is a bit ridiculous. But like waiting in hoards of 25 for reasonably priced rental open houses and wrapping 18th and Dolores waiting for ice cream like we're fittin' to see Prince at DNA Lounge, it's just something we all do.

And Chloe's is certainly a delicious and solid spot. One of those places that magically is able to bring you a hot meal in sub-7 minutes and despite perpetually having a long wait, DOES turn tables pretty quickly (though that doesn't matter much when there are 25 names ahead of yours but popularity is no fault of Ms. Chloe, now is it?!?).

I actually stole one of Chloe's scramble recipe's and use it pretty regularly when I am making breakfast for people. Eggs, Jarlsberg cheese (they use this in a lot of the scrambles and I really like it), chicken apple sausage and avocado chunks. These are some of my favorite things!
author: Serena Q.

description: Fabulous place! We went after the brunch rush so got seated very quickly. The place is really pretty inside. The food and service was great. Best bacon & tomatoes scrambled egg I've had and finally a place that seasons their potatoes. The rosemary bread was incredible. It was all delicious. The mimosa was great too. They only take cash so make sure you bring some money with you. If there's a line then it will be worth the wait.
author: Kelly M.

description:
My go to brunch spot after zumba with my friend!

Sometimes there can be a wait but it's never more then 20 or 30 min which is pretty good if you trying to catch brunch in the mission/noe valley.

Came here yesterday and it was a great day to eat brunch outside for once. We all ordered our usual breakfast fare. I tried their tuna salad and got a side of their toasted walnut wheat bread. The tuna salad was huge and it was really fresh and delicious. The wheat was also pretty good. My friend got the rosemary white bread which I do want to try next time as that looked pretty good as well.

Usually I do order the scrambles as those are hearty, flavorful and very filling. I always want to save room for their croissant french toast but end up too full by then. :(
Their french toast is really good though so I'd definitely would recommend it!
author: Christine W.

description:
Had a really bad experience at Chloe's Cafe yesterday. My first visit after seeing lines every weekend for years. Met a friend for late lunch at 2:15 p.m. There was a sign on door that said kitchen would be closing at 2:30 (instead of 3). I walked in and asked if it was ok to still have lunch. I was told yes.

We quickly ordered. The food didn't come at same time, which was odd.  My eggs were cold and bland. The decor was rundown and not charming. Five minutes after getting the food, a worker started tinkering with the nearby oven hood. "Are you closed? Should we leave?" I asked.

I was told no but they proceeded to clean and mop around us. It smelled like amnonia and I had no interest in finishing my meal. We paid and left. I would never go back.
author: Noma F.

description: The food here is absolutely amazing and the service is even better! Tj, pim, and Lisa are the best!!!!
author: Sami S.

description:
My friend took me here because we needed a place that has outdoor seating and would accommodate pets. 

We waited a few minutes for a table and when we sat down, the wait staff brought out a water dish for our dogs! 

I ordered the red potatoes, onions scrambled eggs w/ chicken apple sausage and it was really good. The dish comes with home fries and toast. The home fries were really good as well, perfectly seasoned. The home fries were more like pan fried potatoes.

I would definitely come back, even without my dog.

Downside - Cash Only!
author: Terry C.

description:
3.5 STARS

my bf & I came here around 11am and there was no wait! awesome. the line seemed to grow around 30 mins to an hour later, but not surprised because this place is super tiny (only about 10 tables inside and a few outside) and it has pretty good food. the menu is simple - basically only a few scrambles, French toast, pancakes, and sandwiches. 

avocado and Jarlsberg scramble (4/5) - really simple scramble with chopped avocado and melted cheese. I thought it was really tasty, but my bf wasn't a fan of the Jarlsberg cheese for some reason. more for me. :P it also came with a small bowl of mixed fruit and toast of your choice. we decided on the wheat walnut bread and it was really good especially with the yummy jam. I'm not even sure what kind it was, but it tasted a little like raspberry.

cinnamon croissant French toast with strawberries (3.5/5) - a little bit disappointed with this. the French toast was soft, but nothing really unique about it. I almost couldn't tell it was croissant? it was really good with the maple syrup though and I appreciated the generous amount of strawberries they serve on top, which is also drizzled with cinnamon powder. 

chicken apple sausage (3.5/5) - juicy and tasty, but nothing special.

greens salad (3/5) - the greens didn't seem super fresh, but they give you a lot of veggies especially carrots. it also comes with a small sliced baguette and vinaigrette dressing.
author: Stephanie G.

description: Great breakfast food! Love how they serve mimosas here. It can be a little pricy, but it is worth it. Everything thing is quality and freshly made.
