Even the fruit tastes fresh and perfectly ripe. The downside is that it is a very small place inside. It can get noisy when packed and seating is close. They do have a few tables outside. Also can get busy so don't come when you are really hungry expecting quick seating.
author: Andrea R.

description: Cute little place. The food was good. Okay prices. Nice service.
author: Luna A.

description:
One of the best experiences I have had in SF 
This place is tiny but cozy

Banana Walnut Pancakes were awesome :D

Great place to go with a small group or a romantic date

A must try if you are in SF
author: Max P.

description: Had the criossant french toast and momosa. The servers were extremely nice and food was incredible!  The vibe in the Noe was wonderful today :-).
author: Tikisha O.

description:
One  of the best restaurant   for  brunch,   The place is really small so there was a little bit of a wait. about 20   minutes,  he criossant french toast   with   tomato  and  ham  is  good,  and  Scramble egg($10.95):(  include   bacon onion  and   tomato) is very   good.   But the  Coffee is bad,. I'm a regular now, the  sugar very  dirty, it  is  very  bad  .
 Cash only!  no  credit card!
They do have several sidewalk tables that are available in nicer weather

早午餐最好的餐廳之一，這個地方是非常小的，所以等待約20分鐘，criossant  法式吐司蕃茄和火.  炒雞蛋（$10.95）：（包括臘肉洋蔥和番茄)非常好。但是咖啡是最差的。我要的是普通 的咖啡,糖很骯髒.  這是非常糟糕的飲料.
只收現金！不收信用卡!
人行道也有幾個座位,   取決於天氣"好"或"差"
author: Eric W.

description:
Had to kill some time, so I went to  breakfast. Chloe's Cafe was near, so I tried it. First, it's clean and has the feel of a classic breakfast spot. It appears that there is often a line from the reviews. Other that the size, or lack options, I'm not sure why there would be a line.

The potatoes were  a little burned. They only make scrambled eggs. Let me say that again...THEY ONLY MAKE SCRAMBLED EGGS. I typically don't eat scrambled eggs since they make me vomit if not perfectly cooked. But the eggs were fluffy and well prepaird.  

The bacon was like sizzelean. Not high quality. Kind of like cruise ship bacon.
Not thick and too fatty. The coffee was good and the service was attentive. A few changes, like a fried  or poached egg and better meat would make this a 5 star place.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Great for breakfast and brunch!
I've been there twice. Had pancakes and eggs. The food was delicious and the service was good.
author: Rotem N.

description: This place is amazing! It's small and we had to wait about 15 mins after they had only opened an hour before but it was worth the wait. Outdoor and indoor seating is a plus and very pet friendly! The food was perfect. I definitely recommend the avocado and jarlsberg eggs. The hashbrowns and raspberry jam were just as great. The food came out quick and hot and the service was wonderful! No complaints here. I never review anything on Yelp and I just had to review Chloe's!
author: Katerina C.

description:
It's a small and cozy little cafe, filled with a homey atmosphere.

I came here and didn't really know what to expect (since he found this place). I ordered scrambled eggs with avocados, sesame bagel, and fresh fruit. The portion size was delightful! I say everything tastes better with avocados...and this dish was exactly the proof of my notion!

I definitely approve of this place for brunch, but don't expect to bring a large group.

P.S. The restroom is super small. It's smaller than the size of your closet.
author: Bonita K.

description: Me and my family have been coming here since I was a kid in 96 97 era I think always the bomb, still as an adult. I always get the avocado sandwich and a side salad with vin, hella good!
author: Valeriana L.

description: We had the avocado-jarlsberg scramble and banana walnut pancakes. Both dishes were quite good with the pancakes feeling more special. They were thick, tasty. The banana was on the subtle side and the walnuts offered a nice texture. The scramble came with a choice of artisan bread. Overall, it was quite good, but without being very good.
author: Manjesh N.

description:
Very nice place for brunch 
It was a sunny and warm weather 
We ate outside 
The waitress was nice 
The potatoes are good and 
The EEG are very good too !! 
 I recommend this place 

Good point : you don't need to wait 1h ! It's shorter
author: Laura B.

description: Excellent breakfast, charming space, very small, maybe 10 tables inside, several more out on the sidewalk. Fast and courteous service! Great experience, nice vibe!
author: E. Bond F.

description: Great spot! Great service went in on Sunday for brunch waited maybe 20 minutes beach was fine for a Sunday brunch day ordered scrambled eggs with Apple sausage basil mushrooms and avocado it changed my life! Coffees is great too! Definitely would come back!
author: Jackie R.

description:
OK. croissant cinnamon french toast with strawberries and pure maple syrup.

and the homefries are extra soft, plump, and seasoned, but super crispy on the outside.

still have yet to try the ridiculously decadent looking pancakes.

that is all.
author: Jessica C.

description: Love Chloe's for breakfast. It's not often that we go out for breakfast but when we do or when we have family or friends in town, Chloe's is my go to. I usually get the special scramble of the day. Portions are generous and everything is very fresh. Staff are friendly. Can get really busy on the weekends but the sign up list out front is a good system.
author: Rachel R.

description:
Coffee (with prompt refills) in cute mugs: STAR
Yummy banana walnut pancakes: STAR
Strawberry + cinnamon french toast: STAR
Special scramble with basil, veggies, and brie: YUMMY STAR
Sweet asian lady staff: STAR

Goodness all around =)
author: Christine Y.

description:
The pancakes are heaven!! Banana walnut was better than the pumpkin one they have right now. You can taste the actual chunks of banana, and they are not stingy with the walnuts! You get perfect bites (= I didn't get to try the french toast everyone is raving about on here. But the potatoes are awesome too, good seasoning with skin on to make it a bit crunchy, just how I like it (= 

It's a tiny place so expect to wait on busy days. One thing I wasn't crazy about is their "fresh orange juice" is just Odwalla orange juice. Not really the fresh I was looking for. But the food made up for it (=
author: Latisha S.

description:
Sleigh bells ring, are you listening, 

In the lane, snow is glistening (powdered sugar snow)

A beautiful sight, (croissant french toast)

We're happy tonight, (my belly and I..)

Chloes in Noe, 

makes CINNAMON CROISSANT FRENCH TOAST 

strawberries piled high and rosy

it is one french toast i heart the most 

nice and powdered sugary snowy 

Walking in a winter wonderland...
author: Angela W.

description:
There was no wait when I arrived Saturday at 12pm, but they ran out of their daily pastries!! 

SO SAD...

This place is really cute and has a couple outside seats. If you're looking for a quaint place for breakfast and want out door seating for 2-3, Chloe's is a perfect.

Breakfast here is definitely legit - I'm glad I came, though next time I'll pass on the croissant french toast since I've discovered that no matter how buttery or chocolatey french toast is, I simply just don't like it. 

The food is traditional, and I'm more a fan of contemporary breakfasts where I can get more than the regular ol' pancakes, eggs, or french toast. But I'll be back some Sundays when I'm looking for a quiet place on a corner to sit and catch up with an old friend.
author: Jess C.

description: Wow this place has amazing scrambles.  I know, I thought the same thing, how can you make a scramble any better than at home?  But these are awesome!!  I got the salmon one and it was really good.  The home fries/potatoes were awesome too!!
author: christopher h.

description: Went with a friend while walking around on a whim and it was great! I got the strawberry french toast and I have to say, I FOUND MY NEW FAVORITE BREAKFAST PLACE. It was really delicious!
author: Diana K.

description:
Great fresh and simple breakfast/brunch food. The wait can be really long on the weekend so just be prepared with a coffee in hand or stroll around noe. 

The walnut bread is amazing, so are the potatoes. They have bits and pieces with a great crust from the grill that has been cooking them all day. 

Cash only!
author: Mario P.

description: We went there for a brunch and it was delicious!! We had the chance to eat outside, the sun was perfect and we were offered an umbrella but didn't want it. The pancakes were delicious the staff super nice l, it's definitely a place that I would recommend having brunch at!
author: Julien S.

description:
Came for brunch on a Saturday. There was a wait but it was doable. We started ordering drinks (an orange juice and a latte). I asked for nonfat milk in my latte and they had none? I don't think it would be that difficult for a restaurant to buy non-fat milk so that was a bit off-putting...

Our food came and our drinks were nowhere to be seen so we had to ask again, again a little off-putting especially since they were not apologetic about it.

I got the french toast with strawberries and it was sub-par. Needed to drench it in syrup to make it taste good. I really expected a lot from this place considering there is constantly a line out the door but they really came up short for me.
author: Alexandra W.

description:
I don't understand. 
I met a friend here on a high recommend. 
They don't let you order egg whites...at all. Ever. Even if you want to pay more...the answer is "no." 
I understand that this probably makes it "easier" on the staff and chef, but shouldn't you offer a healthy option at a cost that makes sense to your restaurant? 
So, if I have a cholesterol issue, I'm just "out of luck" here?
They also do no substitutions.
This is San Francisco. There is gluten free EVERYTHING and vegan EVERYTHING. 
So, the way I feel is....if you want to be heavy handed into ordering what Chloe's thinks is good for you...go ahead.
The food is not that great. I can find equal quality on the very same street...actually, within the same BLOCK, for less hassle.
author: Melody M.

description:
I would give Chloe's an average 3 star rating - it's nearby, fairly cheap, and the staff is friendly.  However, today they served me microwaved bacon. I'm not sure if this is typical, but it was unpleasant and gross. I took them down a star for the terrible bacon, as bacon is a brunch staple and really is not hard to get right. 

DON'T ORDER THE BACON, or maybe any of the meat here. Also, be prepared to wait at least 20 minutes and to order your scramble "dry" if you don't like your eggs runny. Runny seems to be their standard for doneness, which plenty of people prefer. Otherwise, their food is unremarkable but filling.
author: Kristyn L.

description:
I'm surprised by all the low ratings as I loved Chloe's quaint atmosphere with food served on plates that remind me of the kind that my mother has in her kitchen. The place had a very warm, home-y feel (although the decor looks NOTHING like my mom's house) and so we opted to eat in the warm indoors rather than sit outside.

My only complaint is that they are cash only however there is an ATM machine right across the street. 

We stumbled in around noon on a random weekday and there was absolutely no wait. I've seen the brutal wait around brunch time on the weekend and loved that we were able to walk in and be seated. We kept flipping back and forth, back and forth on the menu since almost everything on that menu made my stomach growl. Decision making for even minor issues like that is not my thing because I tend to overthink and analyze so I had to discuss and outweight what I want and didn't want to finally be able to decipher what I was going to order. This drives my husband crazy. 

The food had a very homemade appeal to it which also reminded me of the stuff my mom cooked up in the morning when we had large breakfasts with the entire family. I enjoyed my dish and so did my husband. Service was quick and attentive. I even saw the owner go outside to give a fresh bowl of water to a black lab outside although she looked pretty busy clearing tables, serving food and running around in the kitchen. 

I will definitely return.
author: Esther A.

description: Came here after a morning run on Saturday. The wait was about 15 minutes. They have both indoor and outdoor seating. We got the scrambled avocado and cheese dish and bagel breakfast sandwich. The scramble was good but it was mostly cheese and very heavy. Also got the banana walnut pancakes which were worth trying. It was a nice place to try out but it's not a place that we're itching to go back to.
author: Ashley R.

description:
We've been here a few times for brunch and have loved each experience. 
The service is very attentive and the quality of everything we've tried has been spectacular. 
Wait time has always been about 10-15 minutes. We sit outside in the sun, and they regularly help us roll up the umbrella for some shade. it's a  quiet and relaxing atmosphere with other guests enjoying the weather and food, it looks like it can get a little busy inside though. 
I especially like their fresh fruit, the strawberry on their mimosa is plump and refreshing, and the fruit on the pancakes and french toast are generous. The coffee is also really good. They are cash only, and it's worth every dollar. 
We plan on coming back regularly.
author: Dillon H.

description:
This is one one my girlfriend's favorite place! And mine too! 

Granted, I've only tried the Buttermilk Pancakes with a side of bacon and a bowl of fruit but they're definitely the best pancakes around. 

My girlfriend, however, has tried the Fresh Green Salaf, Chloe's Salad, Grilled Ham, Grilled Brie, Avocado and Jarlsberg Sandwich, Giriled Chicken Apple Sausage Sandwich and I think the Tuna sandwich. She's in the process of trying all the other food on the menu too!

Obviously, we go to this place a lot...maybe too much?

It's a nice small spot and It was bigger because it can get crowded sometimes, especially in the morning and sometimes the afternoon on the weekends. That can lead anywhere to a 20 or 60 minute wait time. Definitely worth it though!

The waiters are also very nice and the food is usually prepared in about 15 minutes even when its busy. 

We're already going here next week, if we have time.
author: Phillip B.

description: Big portions with scrambled eggs that are consistently fluffy. The only issue was the bacon seemed like the thin, microwaveable, pre cooked type found in many grocery stores. I was expecting fresh thicker cut bacon. Everything else was great though, including service.
author: Henry T.

description:
Chloe's Cafe is a very cute and cozy place to grab breakfast and brunch! Seating is limited inside (about 10 two persons table) but they offer seating outside. Since today was rather chilly, my friends and I opted to wait for a table inside. Lucky for us, the wait wasn't long, we only waited for about 15 mins. 

The menu is rather typical, your average egg scrambles, sandwiches, salads, home fries, fresh fruits, pancakes, bacon, and sausage. 

For myself, I ordered an avocado, jarlsberg cheese and chicken apple sausage egg scramble w/ home fries and wheat walnut toast. 
A friend had the fresh pear w/ almond pancakes and other friend had a turkey sandwich. For drinks, we had a mimosa, grapefruit juice and lemonade. Pancakes were fluffy and moist, the egg scramble was not a disappointment.

Overall, the food was good but nothing spectacular. Nothing blew my taste buds away, but it was a enjoyable meal over great conversation and company.

CASH only. Cash is king.
author: Jenny K.

description: Really cute neighborhood place for brunch with the hardest working staff in town.  We went at 9am on a Sunday morning and there was already a line.  There is not much indoor seating so expect a wait.  Most of the breakfast items come with a choice of fruit salad or potatoes, which is nice since fruit is usually extra.  I have never seen staff work harder at a restaurant.  They were running food indoors and outdoors non-stop and must have stopped by 4-5 times during our 1-hr meal to refill water and coffee.  Food was great and I will definitely be back.
author: K D.

description:
I don't understand the draw to this place.

Food:  It's ok.  Standard breakfast/diner fare.  Everything I've ever had here has been edible, sometimes even good.

But really now - no substitutions at ALL?  (strictly enforced)  In San Francisco, the land of hippies and health-food nuts?  You can't even use egg whites?  REALLY?  

And no cards?  I CAN'T USE A CARD?  

Service?  Eh.  Standard.  Nothing special.

Again - I don't understand the draw of this establishment.  There are always long lines, especially on weekends.  I'd rather go to Savor on 24th, which has WAY better food, WAY better service, doesn't mind a couple healthy substitutions, and takes cards.  

Eh.
author: Michael D.

description:
We came here on a Saturday afternoon and were the only customers. (No wait... maybe the food is more spectacular, when you have to stand in line for half an hour to get a table :-))
We sat outside, which was pretty nice. The service was ok-ish, the food was tasty, but nothing special.

I had scrambeled eggs with spinach and feta cheese, some fruit and two pieces of toast with jelly. The husband had a BLT sandwich with blue chips. I thought the eggs were way too expensive (over 10 dollars) for the rather small portion size, the BLT was ok pricewise. 

The closet-sized bathroom (which is admittedly very clean) freaked me out a little. Also the fact that you have to wash your hands in the freaking kitchen when you're done.

No credit cards either, that's a bit of a bummer.

Overall an ok place, but  a bit overrated in my opinion.
author: Alexa W.

description: I love, love, love the food here! Be prepared to wait on weekends or peak times, but I think it's worth the wait. Enjoy.
author: Blue D.

description:
Tip: Cash Only.  
Great service with good breakfast -- try the banana walnut pancakes.
author: Meg C.

description: Good brunch though expect wait as the space is tiny.  Liked how they weren't stingy on the strawberries for the French toast.
author: J L.

description: CROISSANT FRENCH TOAST.  So gooooood! Cute little spot for brunch and everything we got was yummy. If weren't for the location being a bit out of the way, I'd definitely go back more often. Probably on my top 5 list for best French toast in the city.
author: Lisa H.

description: The food is well worth coming here!!! We are from ontario California and were on vacation and came to Chloe's and if I were to go back I most def. will come here for breakfast!!!
author: Vanessa C.

description:
So add this to the dynasty of women named breakfast joints you should try (Brenda's, Mama's, Dotties...)

Here's a quick breakdown of what we ordered and now drool over.
Dishes: French toast plain (I'm not a fruit on my food person) w/ raspberry jam & Jarlsburg & avo scramble add chicken apple sausage.
Served with: Walnut wheat & rosemary white toast.  Home fries are yum.  Raspberry jam homemade & delish.  Homemade ketchup.   

In my to go container they wrapped my toast in foil separate from the other food.  This is just one of the small things they did that shows they care.  Awwww

Chloe's is conveniently located off the J line in case you are not in the Noe hood.  

Keep in mind it's cash only and requires dedication b/c of their long waits.
author: Alexis B.

description:
Right on the corner of a quiet part of Church street, this place was hustling. With only 7-8 tables inside and maybe 4 outside, seating was limited. Tables turned quickly, though, and as soon as we were seated we were greeted and ready to order. 

The coffee was delicious, not too strong but definitely had something to it. The food took a little longer to come out but we could see that the kitchen was very tiny, and the ambience of the cute, vintage-esque dining room made up for it.  

-Bagel sandwich with bacon and egg - nice portion, fresh veggies on the sandwich, fried potatoes = YUM. 

-Cinnamon Croissant French Toast with strawberries- very rich, but the strawberries helped cut the super sweet flavor. Great texture, and I had enough to take home for the next day's breakfast. 

While you may have to wait a little bit and be a little cramped in the dining room, it's just part of the experience of this place. Worth it!
author: Morgan H.

description: A popular brunch spot with 2 distinguishes from the rest. Jarlsberg cheese and their Fog Lifter coffee blend. The outdoor seating is split into 2 regions - Caribbean (26th st) and Antarctican (church st). So I you are sensitive to it either wait eons for the 26th st seating or sit indoors.
author: Varun T.

description: Small location, friendly staff, and a decent menu with plenty of healthy options.
author: Pamela R.

description: Sup-par service. I politely requested for a waiter and received attitude in return. Was informed that my party had to stay seated a minimum 20 minutes before being able to order per my conversation with the waitress. Utterly ridiculous. Giving it two stars because the food was good.
author: Sasan R.

description:
I came here before and I had such a good impression of this place, so I had to come again since I am back in the city over the holidays. What other place to grab my first breakfast of a new year?! Chloe's!

I ordered the infamous avocado and jarlsberg scramble and my sister ordered the Croissant French Toast.

Pros:
- fresh ingredients
- small cafe - "cozy" like atmosphere
- good attentive service
- server came quickly to take our order

Cons:
- Does not accept credit/debit cards
- No set price for the addition of strawberries to the croissant french toast ("additional price depending on season" - something like that)


I barely had to wait since there was only two of us. We were seated quickly, server came quickly to take our order, and food came soon after we ordered. After this time at Chloe's, I do not think I will return bc the taste of the food is average and easy to remake myself. But if I were to return, I would order the croissant french toast.
author: Shirley M.

description:
This restaurant is so charming. There was a wait outside when we arrived but we were seated within 5 minutes. This restaurant is teeny tiny, there are about 6-8 tables outside and about 10-15 tables inside tops. The kitchen is tiny and you have to walk across it to get to the bathroom but there's just something so cute and quaint about this place.

The food was delicious. I had the bacon tomato scramble with walnut wheat toast an roasted potatoes. Serving size was huge and prices were good. My decaf cappuccino was also yummy and hit the spot.

Would definitely recommend this place for small parties. 

Great place to have brunch before strolling the shops on 24th Street.
author: Betty C.

description: We went to SF on vacation and was told we had to eat brunch here. Wow! The staff was super nice, we were seated fairly quickly (it was Sunday), and the food was AMAZING. I highly recommend this café. Oh, and the portion size is quite large as well.
author: Lia K.

description: Be prepared to wait a while for groups of 4 or more. We waited for about an hour on a Saturday at 11am. Nothing worth waiting for. I have been wanting to come to Chloe's to try their croissant french toast. It was okay. You can also add strawberries for market price. What's that all about? It was an additional $3 for me, but they weren't especially juicy or sweet. My husband's banana walnut pancakes were dry. Breakfast options are pretty limited to pancakes, scrambled eggs, and croissant french toast. The wait staff was friendly though, and it's cash only.
author: Sophia B.

description:
I loved their croissant French toast x)
I went there for Saturday brunch and waited for about 20 min to get a table.
author: Rio S.

description:
Portion good, taste good, temperature good

Wait...not too bad depending on what time you go

Lovely neighborhood
author: Vince W.

description: If You have time to burn and want to watch the staff move extremely slow this is your place. Minimal tables and sloooooooow service. Don't bother.
author: dave s.

description: Have to say - while I hear great things about Chloe's and its may partner's fav breakfast/brunch place. I continue to leave with "ehh. was ok" opinion. Certinely not one worth a huge wait. We went last sat am - had perfect timeing so didnt have to wait more than 5 min. Our food arrived super fast and hot. A good thing as we were hungry. Overall they meal was a nice tasting plate - but the baked goods werent nearly as imporessive as in the past. Its a small place - so be prepared for a raised volume of noise - especially with parents with young children who may not have learned to use the "inside voice". Service is efficient  but you arent made to feel especially welcomed - especially as the place gets jumping.
author: Frank S.

description:
Not my favorite place to have breakfast.
The food is good but not fantastic (but love the Carrot cake): omelets are ok, but the bagel is disappointed (I know: we are NOT in New York! Right!?).
Nice terrace in Noe Valley.

Complete review (in French): http://blogs.lexpress.fr/styles/french-foodies-chronicles/2012/01/23/decue-par-le-brunch-de-chloes-cafe/
author: Chloë O.

description: The food was so great! And the fruit cup was a fruit cup worth substituting home fries for! The price was fair for a San Francisco breakfast cafe. The wait was pret long when we got there but being only 2 people flexible about inside or outside seating, we were at a table in under 3 minutes! The coffee was fresh and the staff was very nice.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Banana walnut pancakes were the best I've ever had!  Staff was great. Would definitely go again.
author: Nancy C.

description: Wait was a long time. The service was great though. Bagel breakfast sandwich was amazing.
author: Kaylie S.

description:
Been eating at Chloe's for almost 20 years.
Their focus on only a limited set of items on their menu has allowed them to provide great food every time.
They specialize in breakfast / scrambled eggs and pancakes.
Their lunch / sandwich selection is also excellent quality and taste.
The only downside is that because it is so small and so popular, if you don't get there before 8:30 - 9:00 AM on the weekends you will probably face a 45 minute plus wait. 
After 1 PM (they close at 3 PM) you can get 'brunch' breakfast and lunch with probably no wait. 
The staff is friendly and helpful and many of them have been there for years.
A great neighborhood cafe but just remember is VERY popular!
author: Armando H.

description: Everything is super delicious!  The walnut banana pancakes are the best! Best way to eat is when they are still warm! Highly recommended this place :)
author: Nancy R.

description:
Love Love LOVE this place. Today was our first time there. We WILL be back! Great servers, super nice and sweet. 
Food was of the hook! Delicious, scrumptious and every other -ous you can think of. Good strong coffee. Quick service.
Can't wait for the next time.
author: Eva R.

description:
Totally cute!  This kind of reminds me of my Aunt Dolores' living room when I was young.  It's decorated in fashionable old-lady decor - warm and inviting.  It's small - there are only a few tables inside - not the best place for groups of more than four.

Eggs are only served one way - scrambled.  Being that scrambled is not my favorite way to eat eggs, I was hesitant, but once they arrived, I was really happy.  These were some of the most perfectly scrambled eggs I've ever had.  Light and fluffy and delicious.  They tasted really fresh.  I also added cheese to them.  They are very specific about the cheese they serve, which is awesome, they name the type of cheddar, they don't just say "cheddar".

Another great quality of Chloe's is that they have an option that is both sweet and savory - eggs, pancakes, and fruit.  YES!  This way I didn't have to make the usual difficult brunch decision of either sweet or savory - I had both!  I also sampled my friend's cinnamon french toast with strawberries and it was sooo good.  

Service is friendly and super fast.
author: Natalee F.

description:
DAYYYYYMMM GINA!

When I want breakfast, I also want choices.  You know, I like pancakes but I also like a big ol helping of protein.  Usually I'm relegated to ordering a regular breakfast with the sorry, boring lone pancake on the side or getting a full load of pancakes with a side of eggs.  Where is the happy medium?!?

It's at Chloe's where you can order the Walnut Banana Pancakes and it comes with a delicious helping of eggs.  The eggs are fluffy, delicious and they spare you the grease.  The pancakes are similar, fluffy and light to the point where you don't feel like you have a dense bread object in your gut when you're done.  The walnuts and bananas were distributed in excellent proportions so much so that I ate the whole stack and all the eggs (what a hog!).  Throw in the coffee refills that kept coming my way and Chloe's is on my shortlist of excellent breakfast spots.

I realize we don't all have the opportunity to leave near a Muni stop but finding out that this place is a comfortable J ride away is a nice touch.  It's a cash only joint so make sure you've got some green.  Additionally the place has maybe eight tables if you don't count the ones outside, so make sure to plan your attack accordingly (weekdays or come early, yes everyone wants brunch at 11am on the weekends).
author: Steven R.

description:
Choe's Cafe is a cute spot for breakfast with good service and generally good food. The pancakes and the croissant french toast were tasty. 

However, Choe's has a major flaw. You can't order eggs any other way than scrambled, and there is no option for egg whites only. This is a breakfast/brunch basic, and the fact that they don't do them is pretty silly. I spoke with our server, and she said they essentially have a vat of premixed eggs that they dollop out when someone orders eggs. This is pretty unappetizing, and needlessly cheap an inflexible.
author: Nathaniel F.

description:
Impressed. To say the least.

I hated the fact that I had to wait 45 minutes to get seated but I did love the food and the friendly service. Chloe's Cafe is quaint and very cute, it reminded me of eating breakfast at a friend's place. I ordered the pecan pancakes short stack but ooh it was definitely action packed! It was light and fluffy. I also got a chicken apple sausage on the side which I enjoyed. Inclusion, Chloe's Cafe is worth raving about, and although I hate to admit it, its also worth waiting 45 minutes for! =)
author: C M.

description:
Super cutesy, comfy brunch place :) 

Probably the best mimosas I've ever had y as far as everything else goes you can tell they get all their ingredients fresh so it's all tasty!
author: Maya-Luisa G.

description: Cash only, expensive ,and so bland (and bleh).  I have no idea how this place gets 4 stars...  AND there's a wait on weekends?  Kinda ridiculous.
author: Marcele K.

description: This was recommended to us by a local we met at a store.  We made the frustrating drive over to the neighborhood (lots of construction going on at the time of review).  The guy who greeted/served us was super nice and we got a good vibe.  The person recommended the croissant French toast and that sounded heavenly.  I wish it was.  I don't know if we hit them on a bad day but mine was practically inedible.  I don't know if they bake it or something but it never seemed to hit a griddle, the hubby agreed.  Mine was overflowing with scrambled eggs.  No, I didn't order scrambled eggs.  This was egg batter left inside the crevices of the croissant and made an eggy, runny mess.  I was so hungry, I ate it anyway but really wish I got something else.  It was the beginning of a bad food day for me from start to finish.  Sigh.  Probably wouldn't go back since I had my experience and while the hubby's wasn't quite as bad, he said he didn't care for it and it sounded better in theory than in practice.
author: A. S.

description:
Chloe's is awesome. 

I love my Sunday brunch with friends. It always makes me happy.

We came to Choles and I had the veggie egg scramble with toast and fruit. It was amazing and tasted ever so good. 

Dont just take my word for it, this place is great and definitely worth a try.
author: Anthony S.

description:
The food was fantastic but for the price I was hoping for more of it.  Remember, I'm from the midwest though where the portions flow-eth over.  Cinnamon Croissant French Toast is a huge plus and on the day we were there they had blueberry pancakes on special!  So fresh and gooey... Great coffee with sugar cubes on the table was an unexpected and appreciated touch.

Overall it was really good, but i like my places more greasy spoon :-)

Cash only, limited seating, but super cute.
author: Jessica S.

description: One of my favorite brunch/breakfast spots in the city. It's a small location and they don't take reservations, but I've never waited more than 20 minutes for a table. The staff is quiet and efficient, working under the radar. It's incredibly easy to get to since the J train drops you off 20 yards from the entrance. I've never had a bad meal here and the mimosas are delicious!
author: Emma M.

description:
We've been to Chloe's Cafe twice now. Both times we've been fortunate enough to eat inside (too cold outside). Service is so-so - the servers always seem distracted and overworked. Thankfully, the food makes up for it. The best thing we've had is the cinnamon croissant French toast with strawberries. To.Die.For. Unlike any other French toast we've ever had. 

We've also ordered a couple of the egg dishes - Avocado and Jarlsberg Cheese and Bacon & Tomato. Both were excellent, as is the bacon ordered as a side. The side of fresh fruit is yummy as well.

We'll definitely keep going back to Chloe's for the sublime French toast.
author: Tara M.

description: Great food.  Best breakfast I've ever had here.  Sandwiches are solid too.  Great potatoes, jam and eggs.  Coffee as well.  Service is usually solid.
author: Zach H.

description:
3.5 stars!

If only they had non-Cinnamon Croissant French Toast. I've been looking everywhere for Croissant French Toast (after trying it at Planet Dailies in Vegas), but no luck anywhere. At Chloe's Cafe, while they do serve Croissant French Toast, it's filled with cinnamon, which is a no-no for me. I asked whether they could make it without the Cinnamon, but was rejected as they pre-make the batter... unfortunately.. Though I tried some of my friend's.. the edges without the cinnamon, and it was heavenly! If only I could have more without cinnamon...

So I opted for the Banana Walnut pancake with scrambled eggs and home fries. The banana walnut pancake was okay, but definitely wasn't the star. It was rather dense and dry instead of light and fluffy. It was kind of a let down, seeing what great reviews there are for these pancakes. The eggs are normal, but the home fries were pretty tasty! 

Overall, decent brunch place. But, it's cash only and limited seating available. Please make non-Cinnamon Croissant French Toast!!!
author: Michelle L.

description:
After getting lost trying to find it...several times..we were initially disappointed when we rolled into Chloe's at 10 am on a Sunday.  Thrilled we could find a table, but the menu looked lackluster--no egg whites?  No spinach for my omelette?  After hitting my Yelp app and deciding that nothing else in the area looked good, we ended up staying at Chloe's and were both pleasantly surprised.

Went for the special scramble (broc, feta, tomatoes, something else) w/ walnut whole wheat (excellent) and the 3 stack of blub pancakes for me.  Pancakes were thick, luscious and doughy, each imported from Chile berry popping perfectly in my mouth--if you're a thin pancake person you won't appreciate these, but I thought they were great.  What a pleasant surprise that they come with real maple syrup, a rarities these days.  My 3-stack was filling, but the pancakes could have been a shade larger, given that I saw a 2 stack go by that looked plate sized, and I got envious--but overall, I think we were both glad that we stuck it out.

Cash only, but there is an ATM across the street.  Hit it early--when we left at 10:40 there were at least 10 people waiting outside for a table.
author: Rachel N.

description:
You like pancakes? Good. Then you are going to come here for them. They cram fresh fruit and nuts inside! I had a pear and almond slivered pancake. Awesome! I hate pears and i love this pancake! So fluffy and still it has the goodies inside to make these cakes the best! Before I had that one I had cranberries and almonds inside. Equally awesome! 

They also do a great french toast by the way.

They do eggs scrambled and that is it. I like my eggs every single way and sometimes I like them in other fashions other than scrambled. But hey at least the eggs that they scramble are awesome. Home fries are your standard fare.

Staff is sweet and super nice. Want a wonderful morning filled with wonderful breakfast goodness then come here.
author: Zachery H.

description:
(*CASH ONLY*) Had an A-OK lunch here (it sounds like breakfast is the main attraction). 

Pluses: 
+ Service: while it was a bit confusing as to how long I should wait to be seated/seat myself, the service was prompt and water was regularly refilled. 
+ Food: my father and I both had salads. One green, and one tuna. Everything was fresh and the serving sizes were large. I was dismayed that they were out of the split pea soup and passed on the beef barley. 
+ Reasonable prices (for Noe Valley). 

Minuses:
- The bathroom is awkward in the back and is just a water closet in the kitchen space. There were no toilet seat covers. Since it's a decently priced (for Noe Valley) cafe it's okay. The place is too small for a regular bathroom but I would suggest they do stock toilet seat covers. 

This not a minus but a suggestion that they add some gluten free breads so those that can't eat wheat can enjoy the yummy-sounding sandwich choices.

I would go back. It's a nice low-key place in a good area with decent parking. :)
author: Kristi D.

description:
I love this place. Been here twice now. 
I always order their croissant french toast. Is so good. 
Can't say enough good things about this place. 
Definitely go there early or else there will be a wait.
author: Smiley H.

description:
CINNAMON CROISSANT FRENCH TOAST!

Dies.*


*Happy.
author: Monica R.

description:
I don't really understand why Chloe's is so good. The menu really isn't anything crazy, there's almost always at least a twenty minute a wait on the weekends, and there are a million brunch places that sell the same thing. But Chloe's is just so much better. I've been here at least ten times, and every time I like it more.

I've had pretty much every vegetarian scramble on the menu, and I can't really choose a favorite (though the avocado and jarlsberg cheese with white rosemary toast is probably my go-to). They almost always have some delicious special scramble for a fine price. I'm not a huge pancake person, but I'm always jealous of whatever delicious concoction the table next to me has ordered up. Best of all, my coffee cup never goes empty and is pretty solid.

I don't think there's a brunch place that I've been to that does brunch as consistently solid as Chloe's. It's relaxed, it's delicious, and I wish I could go every day.
author: Justin S.

description: Sweet diner like spot with fresh food. If it was warmer out, the seating outside would have hit the spot!
author: M S.

description:
I have been going to Chloes Cafe for well over 10-12 years now and I really can't think of a bad breakfast that I have ever had there. Yes, the place is tiny ~ it seats just a maximum of twenty people inside* (and maybe a few additional  rug-rats, too), but it is usually worth the wait if you get there any time after 8:30am on the weekends.

My breakfast on Sunday was no exception. I forewent their standard printed menu (and don't bother trying to click on the "official web-site" that they have linked here on yelp to find out what they normally offer; it is not correct) and ordered off the weekend Specials chalkboard. I have found this to always be a great choice. I had the "Fresh Herb Scramble" (they had it in quotation marks themselves, but I probably would have done the same here to distinguish it as the name of the meal, anyway) ~ two scrambled eggs with basil, dill, cilantro, tomato, mushroom, and a choice of cheese (Jarlsberg, Cheddar, Cream Cheese, or Feta); served w/ home fries or a cup of fresh fruit, and a choice of toast. This was all very good and "Fresh", Mr. Albert.

If you would like a little more detailed take on my recent visit, please click on my profile here and check out my stupid breakfastary 'blog.

*(They do have several sidewalk tables that are available in nicer weather, but when was the last time you saw the Sun shining before 11:00am this Summer?)
author: Brian M.

description:
As  far as an American breakfast-- this is as good as it gets! You want an omelet, home fries, a bagel? This is it!! They offer a variety of egg styles, waffles, pancakes and the ingredients they use are always super fresh! Great value and portions for your money in a cute quaint cafe that gives GREAT service, which seems to be nonexistent in San Francisco!

A plus:

+outdoor seating
+great service
+outstanding home style breakfast
author: L V.

description:
Rather odd little place. Don't get me wrong, I love supporting tiny neighborhood establishments, but the service was a little lacking. If I could describe it in one word, it would be neutral - not bad, but not good either. When our food was delivered, I don't think our server said a single word to us. Just put the plates down and walked away.

As for the food, from looking at the menu I think the only thing worth getting is the Cinnamon Croissant French Toast. And it was so amazingly delicious that it made up for everything else (like not having any sides, the menu being overpriced, and the only eggs served there come scrambled). Plus, from looking at it, I couldn't tell if it was actually made from a croissant, or just brioche. But I didn't really care. Crispy on the outside, custardy on the inside = yum.
author: Amanda S.

description:
I absolutely adore this little brunch place! My friend lives close to the cafe and we always stop by here for brunch before venturing out in the city. It is located on a street corner with street parking all around, and the wait is usually around 15-20 minutes for a table for 2. You can choose to sit inside the small cafe or outside on the sidewalk area, perfect for a sunny San Francisco day (because there are so many of those...). 

I have tried the strawberry cinnamon croissant french toast, an avocado/jarlsberg cheese/chicken apple sausage scramble, and a pesto sundried tomatoes mushroom and cheese scramble (brunch special that varies by day). The croissant french toast is a truly unique concoction topped with syrupy sweetness, powdered sugar, and fresh ripe strawberries. I personally like the scrambles more, although the avocado one didn't knock me off my feet like the pesto scramble did. Something about the way avocado mixed with Jarlsberg cheese in one bite...not my thing. The pesto, mushrooms, and sun dried tomatoes, though, make for an amazing combination of flavor, and the eggs are scrambled just right so they are still fluffy. The home fries are also delicious, crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, not overcooked and dry like a lot of other brunch places. 

The service is great - everyone is very friendly and attentive. My friend loves to guzzle water and the waiter came by and refilled her glass (and occasionally mine, once every 5 times he came around) at least 15 times in a meal. The food comes out decently quickly as well.

Overall, great service, delicious food, and nice outdoor seating. I definitely cannot wait to go back and try the famous pancakes and sandwiches!
author: Joyce H.

description:
Thank you again Yelp for finding me another superb brunch spot. 

Noe Valley is a culinary heaven. My friend had our regular lunch meetup. If you are lucky enough to get a weekday off like yours truly, then the wait is not bad at all. It was beautiful out, so why pass up the outdoor seating? The only waitress, who was very nice and attentive, despite taking care of every table, should be commended w/ extra tips. 

We decided to split an order of banana walnut pancakes, scrambled eggs, side of fruit, and a BLT avocado sandwich w/ homefries. The pancakes are freakin good. The banana blended perfectly with nutty walnut flavor and once you add the syrup... damn so good. The BLT was delicious as well, slightly creamy and salty from the bacon. I would skip the homefries, however. Maybe I'm not used to them because they seemed slightly soggy and lacking in flavor. 

AND to top it off.. they are priced very reasonably. Chloe, I will be back!
author: Thomas L.

description:
This is my favorite brunch spot in the city!!! It has got the quintessential mom and pop vibe and the BEST French toast in town. Each fluffy bite is filled with so much love. Yummmmmmmmmm!

Heads up: cash only
author: Tina S.

description: The food here is delicious! I have not found any other place who can beat their croissant french toast, that comes with an explosion of strawberries over it. The coffee is good too, which is important to me because most places with good food don't pay mind to serving good coffee..
author: Alyssa G.

description: BLT sandwich was pretty good! Very filling for the price and the corn chips were good.
author: Michael Y.

description:
The food isn't bad, it's just...okay. Very basic, run-of-the-mill breakfast foods and sandwiches.

I was not excited by the menu, so I was not at all surprised by how bland/boring my meal was.

P.S. Is it just me, or is it weird everything is served with those blue corn tortilla chips...?
author: Austin C.

description:
Place is great. Over the last few years it seems to have become far more crowded, and at this point expect a wait on the weekends. That said, the staff is friendly, and the food is great for the price. 

This isn't Bar Tartine, with a ton of crazy sauces and yada yada yada, just good old brunch food. If you're in Noe and need breakfast, go here.
author: Clarke D.

description:
My daughter did not like the Pancakes. Why, you ask. She said "they do not taste like the ones at home". I told her, the ones at home come from a box and have the worst stuff added to them. This is what good, made from scratch pancakes are supposed to taste like. She was of "OHHHH". Reevaluating my parenting at home as we speak...sigh. 

The food and service was amazing. We were in SF for a baptism and wanted to try out as many restaurants as possible. We found Chloe's, here on Yelp...gracias! Chloe's staff accommodated 7 adults and 3 children in their tiny restaurant, with a smile on their face... I was in shock. You damn San Franciscans really are a happy bunch. 

We squeezed in and started the ordering. I had the Blueberry pancakes, home fries and eggs. Yum! The pancakes went down like butta, with my coffee. The home fries are the best home fries ever (add hot sauce). My wife ordered the eggs ranchero (?). Well they were also juicy, perfectly cooked + they added feta...delicious. All that food ordered and spread across the table looked like it was cooked for royalty - wait, were are royalty..ha. 

When I visit SF again (maybe even move there - in love), I will take an early flight and starve myself just so I can make it to Chloe's for breakfast.
author: Ennos P.

description: I love Chloe's! The food is always tasty, huge portions so lots of leftovers when we get hungry in the afternoon, and the service is always great. No frills, but that's really a breath of fresh air in SF.
author: SF M.

description:
This is a great breakfast place, probably the best in Noe Valley! Don't let the wait deter you, your patience will be rewarded with breakfast food that is to die for. Chloe's serves very large portions for a breakfast place, so come hungry!

Some highlights:

Croissant french toast w strawberries - This is probably the most fattening way you could possibly make french toast. You may need to join a gym to recover from it, but trust me it's worth it :-)

Their omelettes are freaking delicious, the best by far are the bacon/tomato and the smoked salmon omelettes. Large helpings of home fries and avocado really make those eggs sing.

In all, this place is a knockout, but perhaps a bit too decadent to make it your regular breakfast place. For the once-in-a-blue-moon indulgence, though, it is perfect.
author: David P.

description:
Banana-walnut pancakes = yum.

The lines for this place on a weekend?  Obnoxious.

Not accepting credit cards, despite the volume of business they do?  Obnoxious.

Maybe Chloe's is feeling the brunt of my dissatisfaction with dearth of good SF breakfast options.

The food is good.  But the butt-itch factor of all the other issues makes it a place I won't go to...
author: S.T. C.

description:
Brunch there seriously blew me away
really good!
We had omelet and pancakes
author: pouria m.

description:
BRUNCH-A-LICIOUS!!!!

not a disappointed elite yelper. 

I've been in the mood for brunch places lately and haven't found that stood out and servered something different. But after passing by this cafe and seeing it packed (on weekends), it must be a hit. 

I've decided to check it out on a random Thursday Mid-morning to avoid the crowds and to kill time before my appointment. The atmosphere of the cafe was very "homey" and it wasn't dead nor was it overly packed. You have to put your name on a list because it's very tiny and I only waited 5 minutes before seated. I felt like the people eating there were all regulars and knew each other by first names or whatnot. Was everyone neighbors? 

PALATE 411.
As a recent vegetarian, i've decided to go for the scramble all under $10 bucks whichever you choose. Here's my order: WHITE ROSEMARY TOAST, SCAMBLE WITH UNION RED AND GREEN PEPPERS, BOWL OF FRESH FRUIT, and a side of the house potatoes (had a choice between fruit and potatoes, i couldn't decide so i got both). 

AMAZING. I've never had White Rosemary Toast. Loved the herb flavor. Had some jam but wish there was a selection of jam. My scramble was very flavorful and delicious, who needs meat!!! the bowl of fruit was so pretty and the fruits were sweet (except for the melon at the bottom). The house potatoes were regular house potatoes. nothing that would make my mouth water. Next time when i come back, i'll know to order the bowl of fruit over the house potatoes. 

The one thing that really make me fall in love with this place was the community. Everyone seems very friendly and local. The owners and service was on point and loved their hospitality. It's a small venue but two elderly couple in wheel chairs were very welcomed in, everyone knew them, the owners talked with them as if they've known each other for ages, it's that homey and you can it's always packed because the regulars definately come back. it was very beautiful to see. 

I, MYSELF, will definately be back.


Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description:
After sitting in a stuffy plane for a six hour flight from Philadelphia into SFO and a fresh-air stroll around Noe, I was ready for lunch with something clean tasting. At the suggestion of my daughter (who lives here), we selected the Chloe Salad and have to say that it was impressively presented yet simple and satisfying. As a foodie and a critic-at-large about eateries, Chloe used very fresh-tasting ingredients (except the tomatoes were underwhelming, of course, for this time of the year) and a savory house dressing.

Service was attentive, friendly. It's a neighborhood cafe which gives it a local appeal and, in considering this category, deserves 3.5 stars.

Update: March 3. Had their egg scramble special which included choice of cheese, red onion, spinach, and broccoli that was cooked to perfection. Broccoli is often difficult to include in egg dishes because it can be too undercooked or cooked almost beyond recognition. But Choe found the perfect balance. Accompanied by fruit salad and sour dough toast (other bread options exist), it was a delicious breakfast. This cafe seems to be vegetable-forward rather than the meat-centric offerings in similar venues. Their attention to balancing what each vegetable offers an egg scramble is evident with every bite.

With this second trip, I would encourage others to embrace this local gem. It's definitely a 3.5.
author: Kathryn R.

description:
Excellent service and great food! Went for brunch today (Labor day) and of course there was a waiting line. These are always a good sign for restaurants so we felt it was worth the wait.
Found street parking nearby, which is always a great omen, which made our wait seem even shorter. Although 8th on the list, we did it.
The menu is a nice combination of breakfast and lunch items. I had the scramble with smoked salmon and capers. DELICIOUS! For me it was rightfully portioned. That and my cup of coffee and I was set. My wife had the sausage sandwich, which was a nice combo as well. My 9 year old went for her usual everywhere we go - pancakes. The pancakes at Chloe's is nice and thick. The short stack was more than enough for her.
Service is tops! Making your meal an enjoyable one in every way is what they do, and they are awesome at it.
Make your way to Church street for your next breakfast/brunchtime meal!
author: Mark M.

description:
Absolutely splendid.

The first time I was introduced to Chloe's I knew it was a match made in heaven.  I am all about breakfast and Chloe's has a great, cozy spot in my heart.  I've even dropped in, by myself, without notice once, for some early afternoon delight ;) 

Banana Walnut Pancakes: tuh-die for.
Cinnamon Croissant French Toast: France couldn't do it better. 
(Ahhhhhhhhhh the REAL maple syrup makes you wanna mosey on up to Canada and slap a bear with you short stack, all while wearing a smoking jacket and reading the Chronicle sports page in your house slippers)
Egg Scrambles: Chloe baby, you know what Daddy like don't ya?
BLT: BIG LOVELY TREAT!
Fresh fruit on the side: makes my conscience confide.

Let me say something: the coffee here is not expected to be gourmet here but oooooooo is it good!

The fact that Chloe's is small and makes you wait only makes me appreciate all the more the magic that emanates from this delightful cornerstone of Noe breakfast joints! 
Bravo Chloe's, you have made my stomach smile :) 

Last but not least, the service here is on par with the food. Keep it up ;)

*Cash is King and the only payment accepted here.  Stroll to the ATM across the road if you forget munchie money*
author: D V.

description: Good breakfast and service.  It's not worth waiting more than 20 minutes however (not sure if there is a brunch place in Noe Valley that is worth the wait).  Banana walnut pancakes were the star, but I don't typically eat dessert for breakfast, so I probably won't return on a regular basis.
author: Janelle F.

description:
Service starts from the moment you get there so me and 3 other girls were waiting inside the waitress told us to wait outside in the cold. Ummmm, really? Yeah there's no space inside but we weren't blocking anyone's way of eating and we were practically in our tiny circle. Whatever... 

Food is ok, I've had better breakfast food... I had the Thursday Scramble: Omelet with pesto, mushroom and mozzarella with fresh fruit and sourdough. Eh... 

Don't think I would come back... Really tiny... Flies in the restaurant flying over your head ... long wait ...
author: Jennifer S.

description:
The breakfast/brunch menu is pretty small compared to most restaurants. I took a chance and ordered a very sample scramble - Jarlsberg cheese with avecado. I like my eggs really soft scrambled and Chloe did not disappoint. The scramble just melts in my mouth. The boyfriend had the bacon and tomatoes scramble, which he enjoyed. We shared a small order of the croissant french toast. It was good, but I can make that stuff at home. 

All in all, Chloe is a great place for Sunday brunch on a sunny day. They would use a few cushions on the chairs outside though.
author: Alice W.

description:
Summary: a well-run neighborhood cutie that executes classic breakfast staples well in a cute and cozy cafe

After furiously researching on my phone while my friend drove, we finally settled on Chloe's Cafe before picking up E from her hotel near the Metreon. The Streetfood Fest made the Mission a no-go zone, and we didn't want to wait anywhere for more than 20 minutes. Chloe's Cafe fit the bill with positive reviews overall, but not enough reviews to make us worry about waiting too long.

We put our names down third on the waiting list, but having a group of 3 hurt us a bit, since there are tables aplenty for groups of 2. And for warm-blooded or bundled diners who could withstand the cold and fog that morning. When we were seated 10 minutes later, we squeezed into a corner table that was just right for 3 small girls, like us.

If you're looking for an EXTENSIVE breakfast menu, don't come here. The only egg options here (as mentioned in other reviews) are scrambled (with various topping choices) and in a bagel sandwich. Pancakes (regular, pecan, or banana walnut) and their cinnamon croissant french toast are also breakfast options, but there's not much more. I SO appreciate pared down menus... It facilitates expedient decision making by customers and allows the kitchen to only offer options that are well-prepared. I thoroughly enjoyed the cinnamon croissant french toast: not too eggy, not a cinnamon bomb, not too soggy, just well-executed and good. Mind blowingly awesome? No. But a wonderful Saturday morning breakfast treat. I nibbled at E's avocado scrambled eggs and was impressed by the light, fluffy, well-seasoned but not too salty product. Yum! The banana walnut pancakes (2) were quite large. We couldn't finish all of our food. Prices were great for an SF weekend breakfast (~$11/person). And their coffee wasn't a hipster artisan brew, but it was still quite tasty. :)

Thanks for the help in finding this place, Yelpers! I wouldn't waste my time waiting more than 30 minutes here... but that's because I'm lazy and stingy and would rather make breakfast at home for that kind of time and energy. If I lived in this neighborhood, this would totally be my go-to, since the line was short before 10 AM. When the sun came out around 10:30, the outside tables looked superb!
author: Hannah C.

description: This is a cute and cozy brunch/breakfast place. Came here on Saturday around 1pm and probably waited 15 minutes. Me and my boo sat outside and it was perfect timing since the sun was out and kept us warm. But be warned it is San Francisco and had the sun not been out I would have much rather sat inside to avoid the cold foggy SF weather. I love how you can have your coffee constantly refilled. The servers did a really good job at that which led to long conversations and great place to catch up with a cup of joe. We ordered the avocado jarlsberg cheese omelette and french toast (made with croissant) with fresh strawberries and a chicken apple sausage. All in all we both enjoyed our food and was not overly full. But it was good. Quite honestly this is just one of too many different brunch places in SF. Try this place if you want a decent place to catch up with a friend that is warm and cozy. The food is average and nothing spectacular.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Over hyped and over rated, Chloe's is locally famous so that means over an hour wait on weekends and holidays. The eggs are runny and the menu is typically uninspired. It's a hole in the wall so be prepared for tight squeezes and sub par service. It seems a hassle for them to regularly refill their minuscule water glasses. 

Please note they only take cash which is fine since I won't be back. 

Boogaloo's here I come!
author: Andy Z.

description: The food was great and the wait wasn't long for a 2 top. Definitely a solid breakfast choice, try the walnut pancakes!!
author: Thomas A.

description:
Good place for brunch. But the wait is really long, longer than the waitress estimates. Remember that it's CASH ONLY!

They ran out of the whole wheat toast so I got the muffin, which was surprisingly good. Not too sweet!
author: Joyce L.

description: Good Brunch. Get the frenchtoasts. I like their outdoor seating.
author: Denise M.

description:
I came here for Sunday Brunch and luckily got seated right away. I say we were lucky because we honestly got the last indoor table. I ordered one of each of the fancy pancakes (banana walmut and pecan) with scrambled eggs and fresh fruit. My cousin had the grilled brie and tomato croissant sandwich with home fries.

The pancakes are some of the best pancakes I've ever had. They do not skimp on the banana nor the nuts. Because of that, they are very filling. The sandwich was also fantastic. There was so much cheese on it. And the tomato cuts the creaminess so the balance is just right.

Eggs are eggs, though. Nothing amazing. Chopped fruit was fine. The home fries were okay, but better with salt, pepper, hot sauce and ketchup.

My advice? Stick to the pancakes.
author: Mary D.

description: Great staff. Food was ok. they pour their eggs so you will have them scrambled and like it. your bacon will be thin and microwaved, no thick cuts. these little piggies probably had a cough. there will be a sign in wait, and "cash only" makes Chloe's simple yet not great. they kept the coffee coming and thats why for the third star.
author: k m.

description:
Looking for a cute, delicious cafe on a Sunny day? I'd recommend Chloes! Today was such a beautiful day to go to a cafe and eat at an outdoor cafe. My friends and I sat outside since we wanted some kind of tan going on. The neighborhood was nice and of course clean!

I ordered the Red Potato, cheddar cheese, onions with avocado as an additional scramble eggs. With the choice of fresh fruit and Rosemary white bread. My my, it was delicious! When the food was put in front of me, it definitely feels like a home cooked meal! The first bite I took was just nom nom nom delicious!! It was cooked perfect! The jam was JAMMIN' with the toast! Fruits was sweet and watery! I love every bite of the meal!

I'll definitely come again in the future but.. not anytime soon since my dish came out to be $11 since I added avocado.
author: Lianne D.

description:
It is such a cute little brunch place. Definitely come during the weekday because there is no line. My friend and I went at 11:30am and the place was pretty much filled already. I ordered the cinnamon croissant french toasts. I would suggest getting 2 pieces because it gets really filling. I even had fresh strawberries on top and it was really delicious. The french toast wasn't super sweet and it wasn't soggy, which made it perfect. I even tried some of my friend's smoked salmon scrambled eggs and that was good too. they do put a lot of salmon in it, so it comes out a little too salty.
I also had their latte.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
DELICIOUS ..

had the eggs , cheese , and avocado and I added mushrooms.
The bread they serve you is delicious and home made.
The meal was tasty, eggs cooked to perfection and the ingredients taste very healthy. The potatoes are good and taste herby and seasoned, although they did taste a little watery in the middle.

Really good ,big portion .YUM
author: Mariangeles C.

description:
cash only

you MUST try

1. the scrambles (add some chicken apple sausage)
2. croissant french toast (definitely add strawberries)

who knew scrambles could be anything above average.
author: Leslie K.

description: Went on a whim & was not disappointed. The staff were super friendly & the food did not disappoint. The service was fast & they really made my morning. The place is quaint & comfy. I'd definitely recommend this spot for anybody just wanting some good company & great food.
author: vinny m.

description:
Long waits when you have a lot of friends .
7peps = est 60min

But well worth the wait. 
Great staff.
Delicious food.
REAL maple syrup at no extra charge.
No wonder the food is great with the great and real ingredients.
author: Po L.

description:
Came here for Saturday brunch.

Street parking wasn't too hard to find, and there was no line at the door. The place is a little cramped, but not packed.

I ordered the small order of cinnamon french toast w strawberries (huge for a 'small order') & chicken apple sausage, and my partner-in-crime ordered the chef's salad. 

It smelled a little funky inside the restaurant so we switched to an outdoor seat. Even though the weather was super nice, we just felt like broiled eggs since they forgot to put the shades on the tables. (I know they have shades bc they were lying on the ground behind us..) 

Service was OK in that they didn't forget about the peeps outside, but our table was sticky with maple syrup. 

Food was also OK. My cinnamon toast was good, and the chef's salad was good too, but nothing out of the ordinary. Chicken apple sausage tasted super sweet. 

We stopped by Lovejoy's (the store) afterward for some loose leaf teas. 

If you're like me and live in the peninsula, don't drive up to the city just to go here unless you have other plans in that area. 
If you live in the city, stop by for a quick obligatory brunch.

Maybe if they were cleaner I'd give 3 stars.
author: Yoko R.

description: Cute, local feel. Very friendly and charming! However the restaurant is extremely small and parking is a real pain. My smoked salmon scramble was very salty and the potatoes had a lot of garlic. However, overall they have good prices and a nice local vibe. Perfect if you want to get out of where all the tourists are!
author: Molly M.

description:
Came on a Sunday around 10a and there were about 5-6 parties already in line.  We waited about 15 minutes (not too long!) and were seated outside on a beautifully not-too-cold day.  

Between 2 of us girls, we split the following 2 dishes, portions were satisfying:

1) Croissant french toast + strawberries (SMALLER SIZE ordered): loved this! perfect amount of sweetness and portions

2) Special - Scramble with spinach and tomatoes: yum! comes with bagel and the most delicious jam ever, and a bowl of fruit

Coffee was delicious, comes with refills.  Friendly service, food takes awhile to arrive on the table, but ooh, the wait is worth it !

After brunch, we took a short and enjoyable walk along Church to 24th St where we browsed a number of cute clothing and gift shops.  A wonderful day out!
author: Maxine C.

description: Their BLT sandwich is to die for. I order it every time I come here. Don't get the potatoes though. They aren't that great. But other than that, yummy!
author: Chris H.

description:
My brother was visiting from LA mid-week, so we decided to give this place a try since it's too busy on the weekends. We didn't stay very long as the menu didn't look at all appealing to us. Granted, my brother is from LA and always has to customize his menu selection. he's the type of guy that can order a club sandwich and customize it to the point that it becomes a french onion soup.

Still what he wanted was egg whites - surely that's not so difficult. "Only scrambled" the annoyed waiter said, disgusted that we even asked for a different option. Although I appreciate a chef's choices, to only have scrambled as an egg choice for breakfast doesn't make any sense to me. We walked out and headed to a place with less attitude from its menuy AND staff

Pass...
author: Danielle J.

description:
Oh Chloes..... i had high hopes since everyone built it up for me. But i really didnt like it. the food was really rich and not too flavorful- too much butter in everything.

I agree with other reviews that getting them to make one little change to an item is hell- come on, breakfast is supposed to be about flexibility too!
author: Carolina S.

description:
The cinnamon croissant french toast was amazing!! I ordered the small portion and it was the perfect amount and comes with loads of fresh strawberry slices. 

It took a while for a waitress to take our order but all in all Chloe's is great. Worth the wait for a table and on a sunny day sit outside, it tends to get pretty loud inside since it's so small.
author: Kate J.

description: This review is mainly for the croissant french toast which I found to be absolutely delicious. I love french toast and I love croissant. Put them together and I am a happy camper! This place is really small and doesn't sit too many people. We came here on a weekday so we got seated right away. Also, make sure you have some cash on you, they don't accept credit cards.
author: Monica W.

description:
[Omg, the main picture for this page looks delicious ! Why did I not try that ?? Wah !]

So my friend and I were referred here, being told that it was "soooo good". Seeing as how we love love love brunch, we were excited ! The Yelp and Zagat signs and the full restaurant only increased our excitement. So after a short wait, we were seated. I was in the mood for Eggs Benedict, but this place only makes them scrambled ? Interesting.. We both ordered the Veggie Scramble/something similar [avocado and some kind of cheese and some veggies]. It was good.. but tasted like something that could`ve easily been made at home. Nothing spectacular about the combination of tastes. Just very, very average. We found ourselves reaching for the salt and pepper every other bite to give it SOME kind of taste. The fruit cup was super fresh though, I will give them that. 

Perhaps.. we just ordered the wrong item ? Perhaps we shouldn`t have both ordered the same thing ? Next time I`m in town, I`m willing to give Chloe`s another chance. Until then~~
author: Dominique Y.

description:
Seriously, love this place.. the french toast and the egg scramble was out of this world. Made to perfection, be sure to get there with an appetite and there is usually a wait on the weekend... though, they serve fast and their coffee is really yummy. 

Quaint place.. so get there with plenty of time to hang a bit, but know the food is worth the wait.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Two things I can always expect at Chloe's:

  1. A long line
  2. Perfect scrambled eggs

I will gladly deal with (1) in order to get to (2).
author: Jennifer B.

description: My family and I recently vacationed in SF and ate here based on yelp reviews.. We enjoyed it so much we went back again! The French toast and pancakes are both very tasty - a little disappointed with only scrambled egg option, but they had a big choice of add-ins. We all were very satisfied with the breakfast! Weekdays there was no waiting, we waited about 20 minutes on a Saturday morning.
author: Vicki C.

description: The food is really good, but it' totally not worth the 1:30hrs wait to be seated plus the 30 min wait to be served on a Sunday (totally not going back because of the long wait), especially if you are hungry. The banana pancakes are delicious, the french toast with strawberries are good and the mimosas are ok.
author: Carolina J.

description:
if you like egg scrambles then this is the place for you! the fiance and i came here after several failed attempts at other brunch spots (the other choices were all closed for president's day). luckily chloe's cafe was open today and we enjoyed some of the best scrambles and banana walnut pancakes we've ever tasted.

i had their special scramble (see chalkboard in the restaurant for daily specials) -- basil, tomatoes, and brie -- served with fresh fruit cup and my choice of toast (i opted for the whole wheat walnut over the white rosemary). the eggs were good but next time i'm going to try the smoked salmon scramble because the lady next to me had it and it looked very delicious! the fiance had 2 banana walnut pancakes (awesome!), 2 scrambled eggs, and fruit cup and a side order of chicken apple sausage and roasted potatoes. he cleaned up most of his plate including the sides!

great alternative breakfast spot esp when you're craving some good ol' fashioned scrambed eggs and toast.
author: Helen Y.

description:
It was actually a crisp winter morning when I went to Chloe's.  I sat outside; the inside is small and filled with people when I arrived for brunch. Seating was quick, happening within half hour of when I arrived. 

You have to love Noe Valley.  The sun comes through and shines in this corner of the city and it makes my search for the perfect breakfast joint that much more delightful.  I was warm and though the occasional breeze touched off a chill, I was glad for the coffee and conversation with my friend.

There was some amount of talk before our food arrived.  It helps to see the warmth lifting from the plate.  It made the food come alive, especially with the light shining on it.  But I feel it set my expectations too high.

They say hunger is the best spice and I did over order that morning.  I sampled each plate and found the flavor lacking.  It looked delicious and the portions were decent.  Service was good (though some extended winds welcomed thoughts of a heat lamp).  I feel I am sensitive to salt, but just a pinch more would've been great.

Otherwise it was rather simple fair which fits in nicely with the quaintness of the locale.
author: Bobby K.

description:
Great breakfast spot!! It is small so you might have to wait 20-30 mins but the food is tasty!! 

I had the Croissant French Toast with strawberries 5 Stars and the Bagel with smoked Salmon!! Definitely satisfying!! 

I would go back any day!!!
author: Gina S.

description: I can't come here and get a bad meal. It's insanely delicious, fresh, cooked to perfection. Help is prompt, friendly, welcoming. Coffee is awesome. I'm a regular now. Bring your mom here.
author: Alison M.

description:
All the leaves are brown, and the sky is grey, went for a walk, on a must eat at Chloe's day. 

Been to Chloe's maybe a dozen times in the past few years...OMG. 
OK, well, Chloe's has become a Noe Valley cult breakfast / lunch  place....and maybe rightly so. 

All is good .....for me.....SSSS:  (scrambles, sandwiches, salads, service).... Trout sandwich is great, the Rosemary toast is addictive, Service is always great.  I only will go to Chloe's on weekdays, too much of a crowd on weekends.
author: Matsuo U.

description: Fantastic eggs and fresh ingredients. A great little place if you don't mind a bit of a wait and slowish service. Definitely one of our goto joints. Fyi, Cash only.
author: Jeff K.

description:
CASH ONLY. Chloe's is like the size of my room at home. It has a really comfortable feel inside, although some might consider a little claustrophobic depending on where you're sitting and how big you are. I had the scramble special which consisted of all things I like: brie, mushrooms, tomatoes, spinach. It came with choice of toast (english muffin for me), and potatoes. I was afraid that the whole thing would be an overload of cheese, but it was just the right amount of brie. I think it was around $10. I was bummed that I couldn't finish the entire thing and I was leaving SF, so I couldn't take it with me. I also ordered a mocha which was around $4 and pretty good. I hear their french toast is groovy, but I was in more of a salty than sweet mood.

There was a slight wait (about 15 minutes) even with the rain, even though we got there around 9:15. After that, it was game over, because the wait turned into about an hour. 

Service was very friendly and the hostess reminded me of a high school English teacher I once had. Even with the very limited seating, you didn't feel rushed to get the heck out of there by the staff. If anything, you might be guilted into hurrying up a bit if those outside standing in the rain are peering inside waiting for the yummyness. 

Overall, a great place for food and a cozy atmosphere. I would advise going with a group bigger than 4, and expect a wait. There's normally outdoor seating, but obviously none with the rain.
author: Ming-Jou C.

description:
My husband and I wanted to try a new brunch spot and decided to try Chloe's last Sunday. Unfortunately, we had a very disappointing experience - we ordered the croissant french toast with strawberries and the eggs with potatoes, cheese and something else. 

1) Croissant french toast - the egg batter was too thick so all I could taste was egg. What a waste of a croissant & calories! :-( Also, the strawberries were very sour.

2) Eggs with potatoes - all we could taste were the potatoes! 

Overall no balance of flavors/ ingredients. 

Also, the place is so small that an employee decided to take a huge trash bag out through the front door. 

Sorry :-(
author: Ami D.

description:
went here on a Sunday afternoon, expected it to be crowded but we got seats right away! It all looked soooo delicious, and the atmosphere was very nice and cozy. I got the garden scramble which was the special of the day, with the potatoes and the white rosemary toast. I also got a side of chicken apple sausage. My scramble was AWESOME... but the toast.. the toast was amazing! oooh and the potatoes had those little burnt pieces I love so much. The man meat's got a scramble, though I don't remember what. He also got a short stack of the banana walnut pancakes which were SO FRIGGEN GOOD.
I can't wait to come here again! Although it was filling I def. didn't feel disgusting post eating here.
author: Lexie L.

description:
4 stars for this place is way overrated. 

What really turned me off is that the kitchen/storage areas/bathroom are FILTHY. Just make your way back to the bathroom while you're there and you'll see. 

We went here on a weekday and were surprised that there was a wait. Food was good (not very good, not great), and completely unoriginal. I got the croissant french toast which wasn't as good as I had hoped, and my husband got the sausage sandwich. He liked the sausage sandwich ok.

I'll never understand how there's a wait out the door for this place when Pomelo, just down the road, has open seats. I hope that you, conscious reader, avoid the herd mentality and try somewhere else.
author: A H.

description:
Chloe's is like an old boyfriend  or girlfriend that all your friends seem to remember and love.  Very popular, the food is good-looking, tastes alright too.  I can't remember my last meal, why I stopped calling. Maybe Chloe's was "the one" and I didn't know. Was I an idiot to let such an obvious breakfast place get away?  Maybe, just maybe, she'll give me a second chance.

So I come around again. Get a two-top outside with rickety metal chairs.  (Honey, don't you love yourself enough to put on a little make-up?). The menu has a lot to offer, but nothing sounds appealing.  I keep thinking about what I'm missing...hash browns, poached eggs, waffles.  Halfway through the date, my mind starts to wander to other breakfasts, other locations, other loves.
