Chloe, you're really nice.  Any guy or girl would be lucky to have you.   It's not you, it's me.  I would be settling If I start seeing you again.  I'm not in love. It's not a good fit. Both of us can do better.  Goodbye.
author: Lisa R.

description: I loved it.  If the wait wasn't so long, it would get 5 stars.  Try the pancakes, eggs, and hash browns!  Very dog friendly.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Food was good and came quickly!  We sat outside so that our stroller could park next to us and enjoyed chatting to the table next to us.  Our server was hospitable but gave off a laid back vibe, not too over-bearing which is nice.  

Annoying that they don't take credit cards.  I bet the ATM across the street makes bank on people like us that forget to bring cash.
author: Sara C.

description:
One of the things my fiance and I like to do is take a day off and head over to Noe Valley for some weekday brunch on a nice day. You get to avoid the weekend brunch crowd and still get to try a new place without having to wait for ever. So she found this place on Yelp of course and we decided to give it a try.

It's a really small place so not sure what it's like on the weekends. I had a sandwich with smoked trout that was good. She got a traditional breakfast with eggs, toast etc. Both of soon realized that we should have ordered the pancakes and French Toast. Tons of fresh strawberries and that seems to be their specialty. 

Regardless I enjoyed my food. Everything was very fresh. Service was pleasant. It didn't blow me away but it was still better than just an A-Ok. We'll probably head back when in the mood for some pancakes.
author: Hyung L.

description: Ummm delicious! I have been in various brunch places in the city and yet this is my favorite one! I have been in here twice just ti make sure that I was not deceived by being hungry in the first trial. Second time still tastes so good. We ordered today's special scramble with avacado add and short stack panana walnut pancake. I love when brunch places come up with some creative receipea like this instead of just plain pancakes with fruits or regular french toast. Wait time was not bad and worth it. They brought patatoea instead of fruit as our side by mistake but they add fruit with no charge. I would definetely try this place again!
author: Emel M.

description:
There are some things that as sure as the earth is round I just know are true.

I know that my mommy loves me.

I know that in a few more years my waist measurement will exceed that of my bust...  but probably not my ass.

I know that my spending habits need to be reigned in like dogs in a dog park with a female in heat.

And I know that if I go to Chloe's I will get a tasty breakfast with great service.   We bring the girls and the waitresses give them books to read.  The coffee is good and refilled often.  And their scrambles and pancakes are spot on.  The space is small so we get there when it opens.  

I know when I leave I will be full and happy, waist measurements aside.
author: Cort T.

description: A really good brunch place. Their special included scrambled eggs with cheese and pesto, fruit, and fries or toast. It was just the right portion, which was flavorful, but not too heavy. We also had mimosas which were good -- although a bit pricey (at $5 each). The wait was pretty long, however, even at 1.00 - 1.30ish.
author: Thomas C.

description:
I've been here twice, and both times have had a sincerely crappy experience.  The most recent time was just two days ago, so I feel up-to-date enough to post a review on this biz...

Chloe's Cafe always has a line out the door for a table, and so I think people assume it simply MUST be a good place to eat brunch...but I heartily disagree!!  The dining space is tiny with very few cramped tables available...that's why there's always a line!

The menu states that you cannot make substitutions for a variety of dishes...that's a crappy policy considering there are a TON of people out there with culinary allergies who will be punished by this by either being unable to order a dish or get their money's worth!  Besides, this is a basic brunch restaurant, not a 4-star Zagat-rated restaurant with a celebrity chef where dishes are prepared with a great degree of skill...they're slapping pancakes and eggs on plates, for pete's sake!!! It's not rocket science!!  The "no substitutions" policy usually tells me that a business is generally inflexible and that I probably won't enjoy my experience...and that was definitely the case here!

Despite the declarations of "no substitutions" on the menu, I asked anyway, because da*nit, I have food allergies...this isn't just about wanting to be difficult!  The waiter was snippy and rude to me when I asked him to substitute "a little bit of avocado" for the mixed fruit that was supposed to accompany my breakfast.  I explained that I'm allergic to the fruit he listed off (I have a TON of allergies, if you can't tell by my other reviews!)...and his offer to sub breakfast potatoes wouldn't work for me either, due to my garlic allergy.  Note that I didn't ask for an entire avocado, just a few slices...you can't tell me that that's sooooo much more expensive than the heaping serving of fruit that accompanied my friend's breakfast.  

The waiter's response was, "Well, it seems like it's easier to just let you have it than say no..."  Wow.  Obviously he didn't want a big tip.  My friend was ready to jump out of her seat and beat him down, she was so angry!!  I think because going to Chloe's was her choice and I hadn't loved it the last time I'd been, I was less invested in liking the experience this time around either and therefore wasn't surprised by this acidic response!

I also ordered a side of bacon, because I like meat with my pancakes and eggs (which this limiting menu doesn't offer!).  For $2.75/side order, I got two tiny strips over burnt, uber-thin-and-crispy bacon.  Ugh.  Sooo not worth it!

My glass of milk cost $2.50 (according to the bill)!!!  Really?   $2.50 for milk???  That's almost as much as an espresso beverage at Starbucks!!!!  

All said and done, my breakfast was seriously mediocre, no better than many of the other restaurants I frequent in the city, and cost me a lousy $15 before tip.  For that price, I'd rather go to the Beach Chalet or Kate's Kitchen or Savor, or any of the thousands of less expensive brunch places in San Francisco!!!

For the rest of our breakfast, our waiter ignored us, other than to occassionally glare at us for still being at his table (I could see his expressions in the mirror along the back wall).  Another woman came by and filled up our water at one point, and she was polite and pleasant, so obviously our waiter was just a bad apple.

WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBILITY:  Theoretically, you can get in the front door, but navigating through the seriously cramped space will prove frustrating, unless you dine outside.  And I'm not sure if they even have a bathroom to offer customers, nevermind an accessible one!  So, call ahead to find out.  

Regardless, given the stress of going to this place (waiting forever for a table, being scrunched into a corner, being bitched at by the waiter, getting mediocre quality food), I'll be skipping it in the future.  I don't care HOW much my friend likes this place, next time she invites me for breakfast, we're going somewhere else!!

That goes for the rest of my friends, too...if you insist on brunching with me in Noe Valley, let's go to Savor instead!!  The food is far superior to Chloe's, wait staff there is ALWAYS polite and no one ever gives me a hard time for making a menu substitution, regardless of my reasons!!  But I'm not going to Chloe's again....life's too short and my time's too valuable to waste it at mediocre places like this!!!!
author: Amy L.

description: Nothing too extraordinary, but it's a wonderful neighborhood brunch place, cozy and friendly.
author: Baviera K.

description:
While my old teacher came to visit he decided we should go to Chloe's. Maybe it was because I hadn't seen him in weeks and the sun was shinning, the mood was right. As soon as we got there a table was cleaned and we were fortunate enough to be seated outside on the wonderfully bright San Francisco day. 

Once we ordered, the food came out extremely and everything was right in the world.  The coffee was good, he was happy with the extra lemons that were brought with his iced tea (which he didn't even have to ask for!) and our meals were delicious.  

I would definitely go back and plan on it soon!  I recommend trying the whole wheat walnut toast, it is something I've been craving since my first visit! 

The only downfall is that they are cash only, be prepared! Besides that... Enjoy!
author: Melina M.

description:
BEST breakfast/ lunch! My husband and I are frequent patrons and can't get enough. Every morning we have free, chloes is always the number one choice. 

-Chloes Salad
-Avocado Eggs
-Tuna Salad 

These dishes are a must!!
author: Alyssa P.

description:
Maybe closer to the 2.5-3 star range, but the "I've experienced better" part of the 2-star rating choice is just too applicable here. Simply put, I don't see the point of paying $35 for a breakfast (for 2 people) that I could do just as good a job of making at my house. That sounds kind of snotty, but it's true.

As a general rule, your toast should not be the best part of your meal. Granted, the white rosemary is pretty fantastic but it is telling that the bread was the stand-out portion of the plate. I can't decide whether the bacon was flat-out bad or just not my cup of pork belly; either way, I lose. It's rare that you wish something was more greasy, but bacon (Chloe's serves the thin & crispy variety) should not be as dry as a saltine. In contrast to that was the gross scrambled egg water that ran from my eggs all over the potatoes, leaving them wet with cold egg juice. Amateur hour.

Also, I hate to be the guy who goes "I've had so-and-so at Other Place X, and it was so much better than it is here" because doing that is lame, but I've had the croissant french toast at Toast Eatery, and it's better there than it is here. Plus Toast is significantly closer to my house, so I guess I'll just have to say thanks for the one-morning stand, Chloe. It's not you, it's me (but really, it's you).
author: Trav W.

description: This place is alright. The service isn't amazing. They're aren't rude, but absolutely not friendly. The food is basic. Nothing to throw a parade over. No egg white substitions and they only take cash. I don't live nearby, so I know for a fact I'll never be back. If I lived around the corner, I'd only come if my breakfast partner insisted... And was paying.
author: Mary M.

description:
This place is bitchen thunder. 

The pecan pancakies that Little Chirstina ordered are rockin and the scrambles are scrumptious and quite large. 

Go here for decent priced, huge portions, of bomb breakfast offerings.

will go back and recommend.
author: Franky G.

description: Small portions, high prices, but quality/taste of food keeps it out of danger zone.
author: Leo R.

description:
Not a bad little brunch spot.  A bit small but there's outdoor seating so they can accommodate more than you would think when you walk past.  The first thing you notice when you walk in is how damn good it smells.  And the food doesn't disappoint.  The scrambled eggs, sandwiches and breads are all tasty.  The food comes out in a timely manner and the service is friendly, perhaps a bit slow, but friendly still.  

A couple of gripes, though.  Cash only and they advertise fresh oj...they pour you odwalla and that is not fresh in my book :(
author: Karen N.

description:
Wow. Wow. Wow.  Everything they serve here is to die for, from the walnut toast to the omelettes to the *best* home fries ever.  An absolute must for the breakfast fans.

I heard it can be a wait, but we only waited 15 minutes on a gorgeuos saturday morning.  I recommend entertaining yourself over at Lovejoy's Attic, or you could pull a free Bay Area Real Estate mag out of the sidewalk dispenser and have a good cry.
author: Wes M.

description: Chloe's has been a go-to place for me over the years, but recently I was struck again by how much I love it, no matter how many times I've been there.  The best scramble (soft, with the freshest eggs), the best bacon (thin and crispy, not too well done), the best coffee (and they are quick with the fill-ups), and even the best fruit (always a great variety and tastiness).  They are friendly and fast and the food is great.  Yes, it's small so the weekends have a wait, and yes, limited hours, and yes, bring cash... but I can always count on Chloe's to be the yummy treat I hoped brunch would be!
author: Samantha G.

description: Know if you're up for standard brunch fare in Noe, it won't get any better than Chloe's.  The croissant french toast is spectacular...so much that it's all I ever order (along with a side of coffee).  They get super busy and they have all the queue & table efficiency of the DMV.  Save yourself the trouble and show up before 10 am.
author: David S.

description: The menu is a little bit ahhhh boring I would venture to say but the food is tasty and the interior is super small and cute.  Look out at rush time there is quite a line.  Really good eggs, coffee is decent and they cook fast so your food comes out quick.  Service if you are inside is better than outside--they tend to forget about you a little-I waited a long time for jam once.  Overall a good neighborhood place, but I would not travel across town for it.
author: Andrea M.

description: One of the best spots in Noe Valley, even though sometimes we have to wait a little while for a table it is worth it. Try something from the special menu.
author: Alethia O.

description: I'm giving it a 4 star because I've only been here one time passing through on a road trip.  The first thing I noticed about Chloe's Cafe is that it is a pretty small establishment.  The inside dining area is no bigger than a standard dining room in an apartment.  I also noticed that they take cash only but luckily I have plenty of cash on me.  I came on a week day so it wasn't really busy and the staff was able to get my order out pretty quick.  I got the croissant french toast with strawberries, scrambled eggs and apple sausage.  It was SO GOOD!  The apple sausage was sweet and savory, goes perfectly with the scrambled eggs.  The croissant french toast was great.  It definitely had a more buttery and flaky than a regular french toast.  Overall, it was a great brunch experience for me.  I would definitely come back again if I'm ever back in San Francisco.
author: Sandi G.

description: Cute brunch place in Noe Valley. I had their special, spring omelette, which was light and delicious with asparagus and Jarlsberg cheese. Small place with a clipboard that you write your name on. Wait wasn't too bad at 11;30 AM on a Saturday, 15-20 min.
author: Aki N.

description: Really friendly staff. That made the experience a 5! The food was very delicious. French toast with strawberries fresh and delicious. Loved it and loved the quality!
author: Leya r.

description: My favorite breakfast place in San Francisco for 10 years now. Love everything, portions are great, price is cheap, but a drag that they don't accept credit cards, but that's how they can keep prices low, so I accept it and don't complain. :-) This place is actually worth every penny. They put freshly squeezed orange juice even in their mimosas!
author: George M.

description:
I'm calling bullsh*t on this place as the best breakfast in Noe Valley.

You cant make a fried egg and ONLY serve scrambled? Makes me think they are premade and in a vat in the back.

No fried egg = no stripes or good reviews.

But the pancakes were yum.
author: Kate K.

description:
Wow! This place is absolutely terrible. This is my very first review and I would usually  keep my opinions to myself but I seriously can't help it. I feel cheated. I don't understand how this place got 4 stars or reviews of "this is the best brunch place!" Who paid them? They are all liars! Please try some other brunch places...you will never come back here because it is disgusting. Pretty sure the business is paying Yelp (since they are a cash-only joint) to take down this review because there is no way in hell this place deserves 4 stars, 2.5 at most.

Food was gross- scrambled eggs and avocados were all mushy and brown , home fries were burnt, French toast tasted like it I was eating a fried piece of egg with syrup. Where is the bread? Couldn't even finish it. Yuck. BF told me they don't have a sink inside the bathroom so you're washing your hands next to where they prepare your food. Also, he saw some flies buzzing around some pancakes. Uhhhh... I am definitely NOT coming back here ever again.
author: Cynthia W.

description:
Chloe's has by far the best pancakes I have ever tasted, particularly the pecan pancakes.  I have to dock one star for the wait, which is long and if they just put a couple more tables outside it would be much better.  Or, if they offer free coffee while you wait, like they do over at Bugaloo's.  That'd be nice.  

In the meantime, I've tried a few strategies to make the wait shorter:
1.  Arrived earlier than the person I'm meeting to put my name on the list and sit down with a book.
2. Put my name on the list while I'm out for a jog and come back a half hour later.
3. Put my name on the list and stand outside while talking as loud as I can about Hungry Joe's down the street that (honestly) serves very good food has a much shorter wait. ;)
author: Cassidy P.

description: This is a classic example of why you should always take at least one star off of any review here on Yelp. I just ate here and had the combo breakfast which consists of two eggs, two blueberry pancake and home fries. I also ordered a side of bacon for $3.25. In order, the scrambled eggs were... scrambled, the pancakes had a nice taste, but the plethora of overly large blueberries broke down and became a ball of purple goo towards the end, the home fries were cliche-ly over herbed and the pièce de résistance, the bacon, was super thin, flat and bland like fried strips of cardboard. The personality of the staff matched the bacon, even to those who appeared to be regulars. The total cost with tip was $21. My overall experience was unremarkable. As the description of two stars says on yelp "Meh, I've experienced better." yes, there might be other menu options to better satisfy me, but this reviewer will not be back to find out. Bon apetit.
author: B W.

description:
The food here is consistently excellent, as is the service. The menu is nothing fancy-just your basic american breakfast dishes-but each is well-executed and fairly priced. I've had the pancakes and a few different scrambles, and I have yet to be disappointed. 
Bonus attractions: Home-baked pastries, decent coffee, mimosas!
Cons: Often a long wait on weekend mornings, cash only. 
This is my new neighborhood brunch spot in Noe Valley.
author: Ashley T.

description: I've been going here for years, best staff, best food in the city.  Roll up and sign the sheet, there's a wait but you'll get in eventually.  Maybe go for a walk in the neighborhood first.
author: Nigel P.

description:
Decent food.  I really don't know why my girlfriend keeps bringing me back to this place. The lines are always long, but the food is average. The service is poor. 

Again, there are better places to go for breakfast.
author: R B.

description:
Overrated, over priced, over yuppiefied, and the food is not all that and a bag of chips!

Not worth the wait!!!
author: ada l.

description: I love this place! The blueberry and walnut pancakes with banana is the bomb. I used to come here every weekend when I lived in Potrero. Highly recommended!
author: Nell B.

description:
Finally had brunch here after hearing so many good things about this place. Easily one of the best brunches I've had in the city!

First off, the portions and ingredients were great for the price. To maximize our first visit, my fellow food adventurer and I ordered and split two dishes--the avocado and jarlsberg scramble, and a stack of three pecan pancakes. We also ordered a side of bacon because what would brunch (or any meal) be without bacon. The scramble comes with an option for home fries--get them. The home fries are well-seasoned and have just the right amount of crispiness. It also comes with a side of toast and jam. We got the white rosemary toast, which pairs surprisingly well with their raspberry jam. The scramble itself was delicious and filling--mainly because they are generous with the avocado and jarlsberg cheese. I'm usually the first one to add ketchup, hot sauce, or salt to a dish, but besides a little pepper on the eggs, this dish had all the flavor it needed. The pancakes were fluffy, light and delicious. The pecans added an extra level of taste, but didn't overpower the pancakes overall. 

As far as portions go, we were full--but not stuffed--at the end of the meal. I'm usually not one to leave anything on the plate, so this was the perfect amount.

The area is lovely--it's pretty close to downtown Noe Valley, but far enough that you can park if you're driving. Staff was courteous, attentive, and quick. Be ready for a wait (still reasonable, though) if you have a large party, because the place is small and popular. 

All together a great eat and experience. Can't wait to go back and try the croissant French toast :)
author: Renaud V.

description: Had the pleasure of having breakfast here with my son and his wife, while visiting from Georgia.  The pecan pancakes were absolutely to die for!  Great coffee, excellent service and staff. Can't wait for a return trip!
author: Frank S.

description:
TIP- go with cash, they don't take cards. 
Waited for one hour in windy weather but it was totally worth it. Got their special of egg scramble with asparagus and jarlsberg cheese and walnut bread- so good. Potatoes or fruit come with it, but the best part is their preserves for the walnut bread which comes out WARM! And then we also got the 2egg scramble,with potatoes and your choice of banana walnut or pecan pancakes. Hello, my lovely banana walnut pancakes...I can still taste them. I'd go back for those pancakes and preserves alone. Well worth the wait!
author: S K.

description:
This place won me over with two things:  croissant french toast and delicious home fries.

It's a tiny cafe, the wait will probably be long, but the food is tasty.  I'm a fan.
author: Tamara N.

description:
Well let's just put it this way.  There's only a dozen or so eateries anywhere near the Bay I'd wait in line for on a cold, foggy day.  And it ain't Fog City Diner, Doll Face...

What's up is that there's a reason that I queue up like all the other locals and nabe hoppers at the rare Noe establishment that draws 'em in by car and J Train.  Yeah, I live up on Twin Peaks, but I claim Noe since there's no neighborhood up there,..just views.  I could claim Cole Valley or Castro but...I digress.  The question is why, and the answer is tasty as a mother.

First of all, always check out the specials on the board!  The scrambles and omelette's that pop up there are culinary as all get out.  Always creative and flavor-balanced.  

On top of that, the pancakes are great.  And you will not hear me say that often.  'Cause most places are a little flat and tired, or puffy and cakey.  But these have layers of textures and steamy flavorful goodness dances in your mouth with every bite.  

So let's get personal.  It's all about the croissant french toast for me.  If there were only one brunch food left in the world, I wouldn't cry if I was left with this one.  S-U-B-L-I-M-E.  

Per other Yelpers comments, the sausages rock, if you're like that sort of thing.  Yeah, I do, especially when they're this light, flavorful and fresh.  Yea sausage!  

The fresh fruit is simple and spot on.  All that and good coffee and real juice will get you four stars, at least.  Then there's the omnipresent X-factor.  The service here is as nice as humanly possible.  I mean it!  I know, my sorry nocturnal ass used to work the breakfast shift.  I know the drill of having 'em all lined up, waiting with baited breath and having to deliver the real deal, order after order.  Yeah, you become a breakfast machine, at which point it's pretty difficult to remember to be kind.  But you wouldn't believe it at Chloe's.  They may suffer the rare dropped fork or plate, but I have never once seen them slip on service.  That's 5-star as in quick to take your order, patient with your questions, and always back with more coffee, water or whatever you need.  Not all in your face faux-chatty, but smoothly and politely on-the-case.  I rest my case.
author: Ted R.

description:
1399 Church St
San Francisco, CA 94114, USA
(415) 648-4116
Chloe's Cafe is a qwik Muni Metro ride from the ferry Terminal. 
It is open 7 days a week from 0730-1530. They serve breakfast and lunch all day. CASH ONLY.
Very small, you have to wait for a table. You will love your food.
I had french toast and a good latte. My husband had eggs,bacon and toast. Bacon isn't the best, but everything else is and they have been in business 20 years. It was a treasure to find this little spot!
author: Cindi W.

description:
4.5 stars...

Chloe's is one of those amazing breakfast places that typically has a line of people waiting for a table in the morning (particularly if it's the weekend). Luckily you won't have to stand in a huge line like Mama's or Dottie's because they'll take your name and call you when a space is available. Chloe's is actually a pretty tiny place with just a handful of tables inside and out. Prices are fairly high, expect to pay in the neighborhood of $15 for breakfast, but it's totally worth it. They're cash only but there's an ATM at the corner store across the street if you forgot money. They have a few types of pancakes available (sadly no blueberry option) and guaranteed if it's not the best pancake you've ever had in your life then it will definitely be a contender for the title. On the menu is also fantastic french toast, lots of omelettes, and some creative scrambles like the one I got which included red potatoes, cheddar, and onions. Instead of hash browns they also give you the choice of fresh fruit which was a great touch. Even the toast was hardy and came with the side of delicious preserves that I found myself eating long after the toast was gone. Oddly Chloe's only serves scrambled eggs, something many people might find to be a turn off but I'm a scrambled egg fan and the ones they serve here were fantastic. If they could offer blueberry pancakes, eggs of all types, and take credit cards I'd definitely give them 5 stars.
author: Matt E.

description:
Good food, but I must deduct a star for "ehhh" service. Out of the hour we were there, the server only came by once. 

I had the salmon omelet. Not bad, but something was missing... perhaps some spice? Great whole wheat toast! Loved the jam that came with it.

Cute place, clean bathroom, outdoor seating, nice that there are sugar cubes too. 

Be sure to bring cash, they don't accept credit or debit cards.
author: Teresa Y.

description:
croissant french toast with strawberries. 

it's worth it! a big "yumbo"

just a little fyi - it's cash only!
author: Linda I.

description:
Good neighborhood cafe if you are in the area. We went on Saturday at 12noon and there was only 1 other table of diners, so not sure why all the reviewers mention a huge line. Hopefully the food will taste better and be fresher when there is a line.

The portions were decent, but nothing special. I did like the wheat walnut toast. Average. Lots of flies for some odd reason though.
author: Katie Y.

description:
****Updated Review

so I'm giving Chloe a go yet again. Okay my experience this time was much much better. I must say, I thought I would have to give up on them. The same waitress whom I said was mean was the same one today who made my breakfast extra special by wrapping my fruit to go and putting a brownie inside as a special treat. Thank you so much! You made my birthday that much better.
author: Sophie P.

description:
Excellent service but so-so breakfast, scrambled eggs with smoked salmon should have read scrambled eggs with smoked salmon BITS.
Toast served room temp, potatoes were gloppy with too much paprika.
author: Jack G.

description: As good as american diner food and bad coffee can get. But how good can it get really? Go here if you crave that stuff. Others, don't expect anything extraordinary based on the high reviews. The people are really nice though.
author: S S.

description:
Pretty nice brunch place, but I don't really see the hype. My friend and I ordered the croissant french toast and an omelette (potato, onions, cheddar cheese). Both were good, but not great. 

Service was pretty good though...I'd come here for the convenience since its so close to where I live...but food was just ok.
author: Carol L.

description:
Chloe's is hands-down the best breakfast/brunch joint in Noe Valley, and it could be reasonably argued that it's among the two or three best in the city.

Chloe's menu offers creative twists on most of the standards.  But unlike some restaurants that pursue creativity at all costs, often failing miserably (I'm talking to you Incanto!), Chloe's combines a healthy portion of good taste & common sense when they create an unusual combination.  

I've dined at Chloe's at least once a month for more than five years, and I can honestly say I've never tried a dish that I wouldn't order again (are you paying attention Incanto?).  Some of their regular offerings that I'd recommend include:

Croissant French Toast (w/ strawberries)
Scrambled Eggs w/ Tomato, Bacon & Cheese
Chloe's BLT Sandwich w/ Avocado
Chloe's Tuna Sandwich (which is an example of a truly ordinary sandwich that Chloe's elevates to a whole new level by cleverly changing a few ingredients).

I could go on, but earlier reviewers have written extensively on other menu items.

Chloe's is not entirely immune to criticism.  For example, when busy, the wait can be quite long.  And if you're seated inside on a crowded morning, the noise and clatter in this small space tend to set my nerves on edge.  But these criticisms apply equally to all the other good brunch destinations in the city, so I don't think it fair to deduct a star for this (show me a place with equal or better brunch and less noise, and I'll rethink my reasoning).  

Note finally that parking can be difficult during peak brunch hours.  For those who live in Noe Valley, this can be avoided by walking to Chloe's.  I still recommend Chloe's to folks who live outside of Noe Valley.  But if you drive, you should be aware of the limited parking, and be prepared to park a block (or a few) away.  The meal will be worth the effort, and you'll experience less stress and annoyance if you build a little extra time into your plans to find parking. (But to be clear, this is not an invitation to park in front of my garage).  

Enjoy!
author: S. K.

description:
I took a friend of mine visiting from England who happens to be a big fan of American breakfast.  Chloe's came highly recommended by my sister.  It happened to be Halloween when we stopped in for breakfast and the wait staff was in costume.  

I ordered the combo pumpkin cinnamon pancakes with eggs, home fries, and a side of sausage.  My friend ordered the buttermilk pancakes with scrambled eggs, bacon, and fruit salad.  It was DELICIOUS.  The pumpkin pancakes were just the right combination of pumpkin and cinnamon.  I finished the whole thing.  Plus the mimosa I ordered was yummy.  

Chole's is a great place for breakfast.
author: Gordon A.

description: Banana Walnut Pancakes? Yum! Cinnamon croissant French toast? Yes Please! Salads? Meh! Very popular place in the hood, get there early and put your name on the list as weekends are busy! You'll love it!
author: Shawn C.

description:
How dare people call Chloe's just okay?!? How dare they!  

You go to Chloe's to try the sample of the scramble of the day, have the walnut bread and eat a tuna sandwich if you are not in the mood for eggs. I have not had a scramble there i did not like.  And you gotta give it up for the wait staff that turns ppl in and out of that place like soldiers.  I have gotten the red potato, onion and bacon scramble , a fine tuna sandwich, spinach and cheese omelet to name a few. I never notice the coffee served with brunch b/c I normally IV coffee into my veins and am immune to taste at this point -- but I must say that Chloe's makes a nice cup of coffee.  A have a little soft spot in the upper right hand side of my belly for this place.
author: Kamael S.

description:
On the other side of the hill I found some of the best breakfast/brunch you can buy. 

Chloe's was so good to me one Saturday and even better on a easy Tuesday morning. Breakfast and Chloe's is like when you were a kid and your mom made you fluffy pancakes and or eggs and potatoes, if you had that kind of mom. 

The croissant french toast is a must try with the delicious fresh strawberries. They are so good you barely need syrup. The syrup would make it to sweet depending on your need for sugary goodness. 

The next thing you should try is the pancakes better yet go with someone and split an order of pancakes so you can have one of the egg plates. Smoke salmon and scramble eggs were meant to be together! Its like the two were separated at birth for some cruel ungodly reason.  I'm glad the two are together now and I think they might need a friend called capers but I don't want to spoil the reunion just yet. 

The location is small so warm sunny mornings are going to be busy but be patient because its a worth wild wait.
author: Karim R.

description: Chloe's is hands down my favorite place for breakfast in San Francisco.  They should be Zagat rated if they arent already.  They have these omelets and scrambles with avocado and jarlesberg that  are out of this world.  Not to mention they have some of the best pancakes ever, from buttermilk to oatmeal to interesting specialty pancakes like lemon zest corncakes, and buckwheat pecan.  Great coffee, great OJ, and amazing home potatoes.  Perfect place is you want to hang out with your dog, or bring your kids.  very small inside area, typically will wait for 20 mins or so (even on weekdays), and so I recommend bringing an extra layer and sitting outside.  Parking is very easily available.
author: Benjamin F.

description: Awesome breakfast food. Personally loving their weekday combos with pancakes and eggs. A bit of a wait on weekends but definitely worth it!
author: Anna W.

description:
Finally made it over to Chloe's in Noe Valley, an establishment I had been told was "the best breakfast" in Noe Valley.

Thankfully Andrei Z and I arrived early and with just a party of two, we were sat immediately.  This place is pretty small and so if you plan to go on a weekend, come early or be prepared to wait.

We sat down at a little table in the back and I was able to peruse the scene.  Tables of 2-4 people, mostly families but some couples.  Noe Valley definitely has that suburban feel to it and you'd almost think you were in another town if it weren't for the J-Church going by outside.  The decor is country home-ish, and makes you feel warm and cozy.  I smiled when I saw that every person had a different coffee cup, like we were at someone's house rather than a restaurant.  I've seen this in other restaurants (Eddie's Cafe on Divis) and I always imagine the owners going from garage sale to garage sale to get enough random coffee cups for their patrons.

The menu has a decent selection of basic breakfast items with some more specialty items (like croissant french toast!) as well as lunch items.  I ordered the special omelet of the day while Andrei Z ordered said croissant french toast.  One thing that bothered me slightly was that they wouldn't substitute egg whites for the egg dishes.  I can understand charging more (after all, you have to use more eggs to make up for taking the yolks out) but to just say we wont do it didn't make sense to me.  I was irked.  The server was very nice about it, but after she walked away I leaned over to Andrei and said, "one star off".

According Andrei, the coffee was "pretty good" which is saying a lot for a little diner/cafe.  I did notice they made lattes and such so maybe they do put a bit more effort into their coffee.  I ordered a diet coke which came in a can (another thing that bothers me but I understand that not everyone can afford/wants a soda fountain) and we waited for our breakfast.  I was noticing that this almost seems like a family establishment - run by all women.  I didn't see one man working there (unless they were hidden in the bowels of the tiny kitchen) and I was impressed.  When I went to use the restroom which was back behind the kitchen, I noticed a grandma aged woman cracking eggs next to a large bin of egg shells.  I thought that was very cool.

Our food came out fairly quick and it was all very good.  Andrei's croissant french toast really was delicious, served with strawberries and powdered sugar on top.  It didn't even really need the syrup or butter (although it did taste good with that).  My omlet was delicious as were the home fries that came with it.

We left satisfied, glad to have tried another breakfast/brunch spot in our fair city.  Although it was good, there was no desire to come back soon.  If I had half stars this place would've received 3.5 stars from me.  Still on the quest for the best breakfast in SF but for Noe Valley, this place is very good and I would recommend checking it out.
author: Melanie N.

description:
My wife and I walked from our home in the mission to find this place packed.

Not much to say though, because this place is SUPER small, quaint, but WAY TOO TINY.  I hate it when a place is so small that the front door keeps getting left open and your food gets cold because of it.

She ordered the Croissant French toast, which was, so so.  Zazie's has better french toast.  

And the fact that I can't get any other type of egg dish besides scrambled is SUPER DISAPPOINTING!  I got a special scramble with artichoke and tomato, and some other ingredients and it was all super runny.  I HATE that.  We were not happy, and we decided never to come here again.  It's a shame... the yelp ratings seemed positive!
author: Wel S.

description:
This is probably my favorite sit down breakfast spot in Noe Valley. They have really awesome weekend specials, the price is reasonable, and their outdoor patio is really lovely on a nice day. The wait can sometimes be a bother, but if you go before 10:30am then its generally not so bad. (In my opinion, the wait is totally worth it!) The staff is quite friendly and good about checking in on you as you're waiting, and they're on top of their service as well. 

I'd recommend their blueberry pancakes, which sometimes they don't make when blueberries are out of season, but there have been times where you can specially request them off the menu. Their scrambles are really great too, I've tried just about every one at this point. FYI its a cash only place so be sure to bring some!
author: Katie S.

description: This place was good. Me and my bf went on a Sunday late morning and were seated pretty quickly. Food was good. Very small inside but there is outside seating which would have been nice cause it was beautiful out. Overall would recommend.
author: Melissa S.

description:
So many reviews I'll be brief.  Food is good to very good depending upon what you order.  Coffee is just passable.  For a coffee town they need to step up the java quality.   Small cups so you have to chase the staff for refills.

The wait is brutal on weekends.  There are a few alternatives nearby- Pomelo, Toast (2 locations).

They despise kids.  No boosters or high chairs.  I get it.  It's a small joint and  kids are messy.  So I avoided the place for 7 years.  Tried it again this week with my now 9 and 6 year olds who are restaurant pros.  Couldn't get the waitress to come by our table.  Thought I'd have to set the napkins on fire.  She took the order of another table that came in just after us before I even got my tiny coffee cup filled.

Come for food if you have nothing else to do that morning and want a nice neighboorhood vide.  Go elsewhere if you just need a good breakfast without 'tude.
author: John D.

description:
CASH ONLY - does NOT accept credit or debit cards. 
Save for a single sign on the left side of the door, there is no further mention of this very important fact.   Until, of course, your server brings you your bill and says, "Oh, sorry.  We don't accept credit cards."  Conveniently ? there is an ATM in the corner store across the street, charging a $2.50 fee.  Hmm.  Are they in cahoots?!
There won't be a "next time" for me. Too bad - for me, at least - because the pumpkin ginger-spiced almond pancake combo was delish!
author: Viola M.

description:
The food is just what you'd want for Sunday brunch- good selection of pancakes/egg dishes and decent lunch options, too. 
The place is always packed (there are usually 5-10 people waiting for a table during peak hrs on the weekends) but it's a sunny neighborhood so the outside seating is a plus.
Good service, good portions, but pricey.
author: Amy M.

description:
The boy and I rarely get ourselves in gear before noon on the weekends; still, breakfast is a crucial part of any Saturday or Sunday, regardless of what time we decide to get our lazy butts out of bed. That being said, any restaurant that serves breakfast all day is a plus! After yelping all day breakfast, we decided to try Chloe's.
We shared a small plate of the cinnamon croissant french toast with strawberries, which is more amazing than it even sounds. Seriously, how did I not think of this before? 
Everything else on the menu is very typical breakfast food, and it is pricey. I got the avocado and jarlsberg scramble and was very pleased by the massive amount of avocado that was mixed in with my eggs (which were cooked perfectly, yum!). The boy got a scramble as well...something bacon-y, which meant he was happy.
Our waitress was fantastic, very nice and attentive. The cafe is cute if not small (hence the wait list) but we only waited ten minutes or so before we were seated.

Over all, solid choice for an anytime breakfast!
author: Ginamarie G.

description: Eh. I got the croissant french toast with fresh strawberries on top. Nice thing is they added a lot of strawberries! But the french toast was a bit soggy, and just not exciting. I also got a coffee, which tasted burnt. I don't think I'll return.
author: Monica A.

description: Fantastic place for brunch. The wait is never too long, and the banana walnut pancakes are sent from heaven.
author: Alykhan K.

description: This is a standard go-to breakfast place for me.  If you wait to long on the weekend to get your butt in gear, the line can be long.  The place is quite small with a few outdoor tables.  All of the menu items have been quite good, but I am particularly fond of the cranberry almond pancakes, but they are only offered as a special.
author: Brad B.

description:
good but not really a good value. I liked what i got but it was just lox with eggs and an english muffin -- for like $10, which seems high when you consider that Savor has almost the same dish, only they add onion and goat cheese in the scramble and to get feta at Chloe's it was and extra $1.25-- had i wanted onion too that would have been another $1.  To be fair I wanted to order the cinnamon french toast made with croissants, they ran out of croissants and offered the french toast on just regular sliced sourdough-- for the same price.

So i guess what I'm getting at is Chloe's is very cute but its just not worth the price, there was nothing wrong with the food there and the staff was very nice but really... go to Savor. Better food, more variety and eggs benedict, a very essential breakfast item that isn't on Chloe's menu. 

oh an my boyfriend got the pecan pancakes. those were very tasty and if you do go to Chloe's i would eat those again in a second! Also I don't mean to sound too negative, they did a good job with the fluffy eggs as well!
author: Kristina K.

description:
The eggs are average, forgettable. I heard the french toast is good, but the pancakes and eggs were just OK. 

The whole wheat walnut toast was again, just mediocre.
author: Lisa H.

description: Servers are very nice, and I'm sure the kitchen staff tries their best. The entire operation is really hamstrung by the small amount of space they have, which also probably explains the low food safety score. Food itself is below average and the long line to get in on weekends is a mystery. This part of Church St., really needs to figure out a way to get rid of one of the nail salons, plant boutiques, clothing boutique, or any of the other relatively non-value adding businesses and get a decent restaurant in there. Commercial property owners should really jack up rents.
author: Ichor B.

description:
Maybe it was getting a parking spot in front, maybe it was not having to wait for a table.  Or maybe it was the food... Tasty.  Brie and tomato on toasted croissant.  Add a scrambled egg. Yum.  
also tasty:  croissant french toast with strawberries.
caveat:  cash only.  Only scrambled eggs - no over easy, no poached, no nuthin but scrambled.  
nice people.  Good food.
author: amy l.

description: Cute and cozy cafe. The servers were so welcoming. It was our first time so she made sure that our experience was a good one and boy was it! The food was delicious and definitely generous portions. I'd come here again when I come visit the bay area!
author: S. L.

description:
oh, i hate having to share this place with all you people cause the line here gets so freakin long!!

BUT, yes, it is an amazing brunch place! fresh and flavorful! i always get their special scramble, since they dont offer the same ingredients on the regular menu (hence "special", duh note to self) ..

love that it's reasonably priced ($10 for the special egg dish, includes 2 slices of toast, and fruit or home fries), portions are generous, and they have the BEST coffee ever!

hate that it's cash only and that there isnt much seating indoors (talk about needing a little elbow room). they offer outside seating, but unless: its super gorgeous outside, youre bringing a pet, or youre willing to eat cold food, inside is the only choice. never tried taking it togo - anyone else?
author: Rica R.

description:
4/5 stars on the Wing Scale...  

- Quality of product: 2 of 3 stars
- Quality of service: 1 of 1 star
- General feelings of happiness: 1 of 1 star  

Chloe's was an accident.

Hubby J and I originally intended to go to Lovejoy's Tea Room down the street to kick off our weekend. But silly us, we forgot to call in to reserve a table; the wait was going to be over an hour! So, I said "humph!" to Lovejoy's and followed hubby down the street.  

Chloe's had a decent line of its own but luckily, we were able to be seated within 5 minutes. We sat outside and hipster-watched. 

The staff was crazy busy but never forgot about us diners outside. I ordered the ham croissant and J had the smoked salmon scramble. 

The food tasted just a bit better than home-cooked... and I mean this in the nicest way possible (because my home-cooking is DELICIOUS)! Everything was exactly what I wanted for brunch. The croissant did come with grilled bell peppers and was a pleasant surprise for my taste buds. 

Top it all off with some strong black tea and orange slices... ahh, SF weekend bliss. :)
author: Wing Y.

description: Went here with my sister and it was Absolutely delish! Ordered the avocado/cheese omalet w/homefries and rosemary toast. My sister order the redpotato/cheese/onion omalet w/fruit! It was so good! Their homemade jam was on point! No complaints about anything! Will def be here again SOON! Prices were kinda expensive which knocked off a star but worth the goodness, its a tiny TINY spot, very home'y but the wait can take awhile not to mention parking is a beeezie for sheezie.
author: Sarah N.

description: Not sure what's keeping people from giving this place five stars. Most seem to write rave reviews, but settle for only four stars. Why? I've been here three times, and have been so happy! Prompt service, personalized attention, fantastic food! Everything comes out quickly and very fresh. You can instantly tell they use great ingredients and don't let the food sit around. The fruit are always deliciously fresh! Luckily, I live two blocks away, so I'll be back! PS: Great-size portions... including mimosas.
author: Marina S.

description: Nice, quiet and cosy place. Easy to find parking. The food is good.
author: Prem G.

description:
Live close and eat here regularly. Recommend both breakfast pancakes (any flavor), scrambles (no omelets) and the salad plates. Ingredients fresh and made to order. Seating in or out, but expect a wait of 20-45 minutes on the weekend. Bring friends or a good book! 

Watch the daily board for great choices, simple breakfast/ lunch menu with nearly everything well prepared. No fresh meats such as hamburger, only cured meats (ham, bacon, smoked salmon). 

Service cordial, though everyone misses TJ (went to Thailand). This is a smaller place, not the best for lingering on the weekends or for groups 6 or larger. Easily accessible from J Church Muni (Clipper stop).
author: ML B.

description: There scrambled eggs with Jarlsburg cheese will leave you scrambling for more! SO GOOD!!!!! The place is small but for some reason I feel like I've never had to wait long. Seriously this is my favorite breakfast place in the city. If you're looking for a decadent breakfast - THIS IS YOUR SPOT!!!
author: Sandy P.

description:
The food is amazing. I love coming here by myself on a lazy Sunday morning.  :)

Must try croissant and pancakes!!!
author: Moko R.

description:
De.  Lish.  Everything was so tasty.  The man got a build-your-own scramble with bacon, ham and onions.  Very good.  It came with potatoes and they were some of the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had!  The pancakes were amazing as well, topped with bananas and strawberries.  I got half a sandwich with a salad and their homemade vinaigrette which was great.  After eating my salad and munching on Ricky's plate, I barely touched my sandwich, but the bites I did have were good!  Top that off with Martinelli's sparkling apple juice...one of my favorite little pleasures.  Yum!  

The restaurant was quaint, the servers were friendly, and the prices were ok.  Overall, this will definitely be a place we visit again!
author: Pauletta K.

description:
Got there right when it opened, and my sister and I were the first to be seated.  We were greeted by a man who helped us right away to coffee and made a special batch of decaf for my sister.

This place is small, so if you are going on a weekend, I would most definitely be prepared for a wait.  So the trick is to go early- no problem!

I ordered the pancake combo special- cinnamon gingerbread.  Such great pancakes- super thick and the taste was incomparable.  My sister ordered the egg scramble which was also quite tasty and the whole wheat walnut bread!

The food was great- came out really fast and super fresh. The only negative is that if you want more egg scrambles or omelette's to choose from, then this is may not be the place.  However, if you are open minded to trying something new than this is the place to come for breakfast!
author: Cara D.

description:
Not impressed by this place, actually pretty disappointed. We trekked here all the way from the Marina on a Saturday morning hoping to see what the big deal was, but no such luck. 

My salmon omelet w/ tomatoes were super runny, and I didn't like how there's no egg white substitutes. Maybe this would be okay in Texas, but in SF?? Get with it. Also, I almost gagged when I went to the bathroom, which is tinier than one on a plane and ghetto-er than one in some gas station. I felt like I barged into someone's run-down shack in a 3rd world country or something. Plus it was really awkward having to wash my hands in the tiny kitchen sink where some old lady was hand-picking lettuce. She glared at me as if I were invading her territory or something.

Perhaps people here just like it b/c it comes across as a cute brunchy place that people in Noe Valley can walk to on weekends, but the food just doesn't do it for me. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing, but don't think I'll be coming out of my way for this place again.
author: Natalie W.

description: The Cinnamon Croissant French Toast with Strawberries was DELISH!  This dish is definitely worth the calories.  This cafe is small, so be prepared to wait over 30 mins for a table on the weekend.
author: Lynn S.

description: Absolutely delicious. I split the cranberry and walnut pancakes, and the croissant french toast. Those are real all-stars.
author: David S.

description:
My hubbie and I dined here the morning after Thanksgiving.  We signed up on the list and waited outside; unfortunately it was a bit chilly while we had to wait, but hey, it's San Francisco.
Chloe's Cafe is a neat and small cafe.  There is a good selection on its menu.  I ordered the bacon and tomato omelet and added Jarlsberg cheese to it.  I chose to have the home fries and whole wheat, walnut bread.  My husband ordered an omelet that had onion, red potatoes, and something else in it.  He added mushrooms to his.  He chose the walnut bread and the fruit salad instead.
Delicious!  The food came out steaming hot.  My husband commented how he liked the fact that the food wasn't greasy.  The bread seems like it's homemade and  was nice and thick.  The eggs were light and fluffy.  The homefries were crispy and hearty!
I found Chloe's Cafe to be worth the wait.
author: Kekumukula N.

description: I enjoyed the food, and service. Only reason not a 5 is the weird bathroom setup next to the kitchen. I would prefer they say they don't have a bathroom for guest's than have to see the preps cutting meat in the bathroom sink where I am supposed to wash my hands. Just odd.
author: Charlie H.

description:
Chloe's is a great place to go for brunch a nice, sunny weekend morning. Not to say that it's not great at other times, but it's been sunny and the weekend for the three times I've been.

I highly recommend getting the croissant french toast and adding the strawberries on top. Also, getting a side of chicken apple sausage and home fries really complete the meal. And yes, I sometimes eat too much. But the food here really hits the spot.

The only true downside of this place is that it can get really packed, so you might have to wait up to an hour if you don't get there early enough to put your name down.
author: John C.

description:
Great place in a less-traveled, quiet (except for the J) area of Noe Valley for a weekend brunch.  If you need help choosing something, get the croissant French toast.

Just make sure to bring cash...no plastic here.
author: AJ K.

description:
I fail to see the acclaimed charm of Chloe's.

The food is okay, but by no means "out of this world".  And the menu was far from exciting. What's up with not allowing egg white substitutions? in San Francisco? 

On top of that, the service is slow and unfriendly. It felt like a diner with restaurant prices.  Sorry, Chloe.
author: Zuzzi E.

description:
I'm usually not an omelette kind of person, but lately I've been really enjoying eggs in general. So when I saw the daily special of the garden greens omelette (or something of the like) I ordered it. I also got a tasty cup of coffee, even though I'm usually a tea kind of person. The omelette was delicious. It had some kind of cheese I've never heard of (jarlsberg? the lady said it was like swiss cheese) and it was really mild and not obnoxious at all. I got the whole wheat w/walnut toast and home fries. The toast was good even the next day. Cheers to that. Home fries were just ok. 

I tried a bite of N's chicken apple wood sausage. Yum! The service was really good, our water glasses and coffee cups always filled. We waited only about 15 mins to get seated on a Saturday afternoon. Not bad. I wish I could afford to live in Noe Valley...
author: Aiko L.

description:
Be prepared to wait! 

When my family wants breakfast, we always come here, and we know what we're getting into.  We don't mind waiting 45 minutes for delicious food!  My favorite is the cinnamon croissant french toast w/ strawberries.  The specials are always a great combination of veggies and cheese! In the fall, I had pumpkin/ginger pancakes which were amazing! Can't wait for them to be back on the menu.   

The staff is super friendly. (Too bad the one waiter with glasses retired, he was my family's favorite!)  This is one place that I can rely on for a filling and satisfying breakfast/brunch.
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
Our favorite, go-to brunch place. The service? Always friendly and quick. The food? Always de-lish (not just delicious, but better). The wait: long, but there are a few other places to check out while you wait. Like Lovejoy's attic. They are also friendly to people with sweet dogs. They have a water bowl out for dogs, and are patient with the sniffs and licks of dogs. 

For lunch one of us usually gets the trout sandwich. For breakfast, we almost always get the scramble, a croissant, and the Chloe's salad. Other things, like the croissant french toast, are very tasty, but we eat off of other's plates instead of order it. Why? Because those two items are just that good. You have been told.
author: Benjamin T.

description: Nice little breakfast joint in Noe.  They use really good ingredients and one of the best breakfast places around.   The only downside is that it is very small, and also there can be long waits on the weekends.  But there are lines for a reason!
author: Jeff W.

description: Yelped the place. To be honest, I've tried to eat here before but the line would be outrageous on a weekend. Yesterday, I believe on Thursday afternoon around 12 my boyfriend and I decided to eat lunch here or shall I say late breakfast. Anyways it was starting to rain not wait outside when we got there. A table had already been cleared and being setup. We sat at a 2-top right behind where all the magic was happening. My boyfriend ordered the Ham and Avocado scramble with Toast and Home fried potatoes. I was dying to try the french toast everyone raved about and took pictures of. My french toast came out looking exactly how I expected it to look even better. Heaps of strawberries on top and a taste of pure goodness with every bite. Though a little dry on my sweetness for the lack of syrup, partially because I hate syrup, everything else was good. My boyfriend finished everything but the potatoes only from being to full and drank all his apple juice as well. The service was fast and helpful. They made a good impression on us over food and service. Keep the good job up!
author: Rochelle S.

description:
Pro tip:  get there early and don't specify if you want to sit inside or out.  Especially if you're hungry.  Otherwise, prepare to wait.

Lucky for us, this place is an easy walk from my bf's place, and we got there about 5 minutes before the morning rush, got a nice table outside and were able to enjoy the sunny, warm morning.  Also enjoyed:  various designer dogs sniffing around my feet, firefighters cleaning their rig, and squealing babies.  Actually, scratch that last one.

Service was fast, food was delicious, and I got to experience Noe Valley at an ungodly hour (9am on a Saturday, don't judge me).
author: Erika C.

description:
Chloe's is an awesomely quaint place to have breakfast/brunch. The BFF & I came here early on a random weekday morning & there was no wait at all. I ordered the bacon & tomato scramble & asked for avocado to be added; my scramble was lousy with fresh, crisp bacon & almost half an avocado. It's like, "Hello, would you like some eggs with your bacon & avocado today?" The BFF & I shared cinnamon french toast with strawberries, which was out of this world. The maple syrup was light & tasted "real."

Major plus: Chloe's is open EVERY single day of the week (other brunch places are closed Mondays or Tuesday) so I can get my breakfast on all the time. Prices are really cheap, about $8 for a scramble and $7 for pancakes/french toast.

Bring cash, they don't accept credit cards.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
So I wasn't floored by this place. With an average rating of 4 stars by over 300 users on yelp, I expected a little more. 

It's a small corner restaurant with a homey feel and outside seating. About 15-20 tables inside and best for small parties of 2-3. At noon on a Monday, there was still a 15-20 minute wait to get seated. The staff were incredibly nice though. I'm a big fan of breakfast and brunch but the food wasn't anything extraordinary. Tried the avocado and jarlsberg cheese scramble, croissant french toast with strawberries and chicken and apple sausage. I definitely liked the french toast, but then again I've never had french toast I didn't like. The strawberries were delicious! Everything else was mediocre. I also had a mimosa that could have used more champagne...

All I can say is that I tried it. But I don't think I'll be dying to come back.
author: Tina Y.

description:
Chloe's was really just plain lovely. My friends and I ordered the croissant french toast, the salmon bagel, the banana-almond pancakes, and some sort of egg scramble with home fries. My french toast was light, moist, and surprisingly not too sweet, and I tried a bite of the home fries, too, which were nice big cuts of chunky potatoes fried to a perfect crisp on the outside. 

The service was prompt and friendly, and we didn't have to wait too long. We asked to be seated outside, mainly because the weather was so nice out, but the inside looked clean and inviting as well, if not a little cramped. This is a great little spot for meeting a friend or two for breakfast or lunch, but I definitely wouldn't want to bring anything bigger than a party of four because seating is pretty limited.
author: Margaret B.

description:
The atmosphere at Chloe's reminds me a bit of a West Virginia coffee shop -- or my Midwestern grandma's kitchen -- but it's the "cuteness" (and delicious food) of this small, corner Noe Valley cafe that keeps the crowds coming back for more.

It's your standard brunch/lunch/sandwiches/salads/eggs-any-way-you-want sort of menu. For weekend brunch, expect to wait. A long time. It's a small place. Is it worth the wait? Depends who you ask. I LIKE the food, and have never left hungry, but I also hate waiting 30+ minutes on a street corner for brunch unless it's Brenda's.

So I avoid it on weekends, and prefer to visit Chloe's for brunch/lunch on those rare weekdays I'm working from home. Especially if it's a sunny, warm day; the outdoor tables are great. Just bring some cash... this place doesn't take cards!
author: Daniel P.

description: Feels like a Bed & Breakfast without the bed. You know everything is made from scratch and served to you in a nice small intimate sitting. I got to enjoy real maple syurp on my delicious banana walnut pankcakes with a side of scramble eggs and a small bowl of fruit. You can enjoy sitting inside or take advantage of the tables outside. Its a must try and when you do it just means you can enjoy it after you sleep in your own comfortable bed.
author: Justin C.

description:
I don't usually order an app at breakfast, but when I saw a server walk by with a steaming blueberry muffin, I ordered two for the table.  Delicious.  Warm, crumbly, moist (sorry, I detest that word, too) and served with butter and a side of fruity compote.  
My avocado, Jarlsberg, and egg scramble hit the spot, though there was kind of way too much food.
We waited in the rain, but luckily got seated before anyone got too "hangry".  I will be back.
author: Lacy T.

description:
When I first moved to Noe Valley, I ate here 3 times in 8 days.  I started out with one of their scrambles, which was really tasty (and you get a lot with it--yummy varieties of toast and a fruit cup).  But then I tried the banana walnut pancakes, and I've been unwilling to try anything else ever since!  I usually get the 2 stack plate with eggs and fruit cup.   This brunch qualifies as a "last meal before I die" contender.

Only a couple of downsides--cash only and limited seating, so if you get there after 9 am, be prepared to wait.

Upsides--really friendly staff who are efficient and not too chatty, and, of course, banana walnut pancakes!
author: Aim B.

description: How people got to rave about this place, I have no clue. The service was sub par and menu was super limited. What kind of breakfast place that only make scrambled eggs? Is it laziness or just lack of skills? I won't call myself a cook but I know how to make 4 different kind of eggs. Come on! I ordered a side of chicken apple sausage and they were cold. It was a disappointment cause I wanted to like this place. I passed it a couple times and always wanted to try. I'd go for a couple blocks up to a place which actually have eggs benedict!
author: Perry S.

description:
I've been to many brunch-spots in the city... and this was one of my least favorites. The tables/chairs are too close to one another. I felt like I was sitting in on someone's date while I was there. The flies outnumber the people.... It's so gross. I had to keep shooing off flies off of my breakfast. The cherry on top of everything was, when the waitress (who neglected us the entire time), rested the coffee pot on top my best friend's omlette, while poring us out coffee... lol we still laugh at that... What's wrong with people? Lol... I honestly don't even remember the food. I was too thrown off by everything else going on...

If you're thinking about going to Chloe's... don't! Go to Toast which is up 2-3 blocks on Church St. Its soooo good (one of my favorite places to eat).... If you don't believe me... try both!  Either way; I really do hope everyone else's experience is better than mine; if someone who works there is reading, please give us more room, get rid of whatever is bringing in flies, and learn to serve. =) Thanks. Ciao!
author: Mandy M.

description:
AWESOME.

BOMB banana nut pancakes. We've been talking about them all day.  Actually everything we got here was great. We also got the croissant french toast which was good... but could not surpass the pancakes.
author: Natasha P.

description: Really delicious croissant french toast, or scrambled eggs that are buttery and soft, and banana nut pancakes... mmm! It's delicious, it's casual (like most of the bay area, which I love), you wait a long time, (like most places in SF), service is quick and efficient, fine. And, prices are reasonable. It's a mainstay in Noe Valley for any local not wanting to cook. Great for people-watching, too! Esp. as lots of tables are also where people wait (which can make it less relaxing, if you're an empathic-type like me). ;)
author: Heather S.

description:
I love this place!!!! This place is always packed and there's a waiting list outside, but its worth the wait. I first came here for my birthday breakfast a few years back, and has been a regular ever since! Once youve been seated and have ordered, the wait is not long at all. The menu contains a good amount of breakfast and lunch entrees, they have daily specials as well. Huge portions and the food isn't greasy either! 

The staff is quick to satisfy your needs, and theyre always around making sure that everything is great. 

The place is clean, inside out. They have seating arrangements outside and inside. The seating arrangement inside is pretty small, but what do you expect for a small little private restaurant??  Parking is always easy, there arent any meters as this restaurant is in a residential area, which by the way adds to the home-feeling :) 

They only take cash, which can be a problem especially if you dont always carry cash. However, they are across a corner store that has an ATM machine but you just have to pay the fee!
author: Melanie S.

description:
The perfect place to grab brunch in Noe Valley.

The place is quite small so you're lucky if you don't have to wait in line for a table on weekends. 

The homemade rosemary toast and potato hash is STELLAR here. 

Can't wait to come back again.
author: Frankie W.

description:
MMMMM! A small cute and cozy little place! With delicious, rich plates!

The CROISSANT FRENCH TOAST. Winner winner chicken dinner. Never heard of Croissant French toast because well..that's kinda crazy. And kind of the richest thing I've ever heard of. My grandma ordered this and yes...it was quite delicious. Very rich but really good. So buttery and fluffy!

I ordered the banana/walnut pancakes...YUM. The pancakes were ginormous and super fluffy and when the maple syrup was absorbed into the pancake itself...it was awesome. The banana was mushed up into the pancake and you got the nice buttery taste of the walnuts. It was so delicious.

My mom order the brie-tomato croissant grilled cheese sandwich! Was good...but I woulda got the French toast/pancakes instead.

You gotta try if you're in the neighborhood!
author: Eryn K.

description:
Lovely little breakfast and lunch place.

Very old San Francisco, very neighborhood-y.

Standard American fare.  Which is what earned it four stars instead of five.  Very limited vegetarian options, and vegan options are non-existant.
Some traditions are not worth keeping, meat being among them.

Waitstaff is courteous, and the food is good.

Not too many Noe Valley types hanging around here (read: rich families, emasculinated husbands, feral children).   This is a plus in my book.  More natives than transplants.  Then again, I go on weekdays.

A great place to side up to pancakes and coffee and pretend it's pre-dot-com SF.
author: Monica S.

description:
One of my favorite brunch spots in SF.  I'm so fortunate that I live in walking distance to this gem.  

It doesn't feel like I've had a productive weekend, unless I've eaten at Chloe's.  My go-to is usually the special scramble - which changes every day.  Keep in mind - they don't do egg whites or tofu scrambles - just be ok with the fact you are going to have to eat egg yolks.  Ok - I hope you're over it - because it's delicious, says the avid-egg white consumer. 

Some tips - be prepared to wait.  Be prepared to wait even longer if you have more than 2 people in your party. Bring cash, they don't take credit cards.  Use the bathroom before you leave your house - theirs is quite small.
author: Rachel G.

description: I've waited years to come back to San Fran and visit this spot again. Well today the wait was over! Great quality food, good portions and not too pricey. The banana walnut pancakes are a must! Perfectly fluffy with perfect ratio banana to walnut. The service was friendly and they kept my coffee mug consistently full. Definitely hitting it up one more time before I leave.
author: Teresa A.

description: Disappointing ... considering all of the great reviews, I thought it would be much better. Food was pretty bland. The banana walnut pancakes I had were dry, thick, and heavy. I think IHOP pancakes are better. At least they're fluffier. The scramble the wife had with peppers, mushrooms, pesto were just that. No salt, nothing else. They were totally tasteless. This place wasn't worth the 10 minute drive for me.
author: Alton Y.

description:
This past Monday - 02.18.2013 - I was set on trying out this place for breakfast.  strapped kids in the car and found parking on the same block as the restaurant.  I walked in with my four-year daughter at 7:55, as the door was wide open and the chairs were out on the sidewalk.  To my complete disappointment, I was rudely told the place open at 8;00 and as I walked out the door was slammed behind us.  Not sure how good the food is and I doubt I will find out, but the rudeness says it all to me.

I expected a cup of coffee would be served until the clock struck 8.........not a kid friendly place!!!
author: Oscar Z.

description:
Chloe's was the talk of SF, or at least my friend and his roommates, when I was investigating good breakfast spots.  I had an okay breakfast but nothing special.

It was my second breakfast in SF and thus my second chance to try out some chicken apple sausage and eggs, the unofficial breakfast theme of my trip.  I ordered the avocado and Jarlsberg cheese scramble with chicken apple sausage.  The eggs, avocado and cheese sort of just blended together into a single, uniform-taste pile of yellow.  The chicken apple sausage didn't have much flavor and pretty much just added texture contrast to the scramble.  The potatoes were unremarkable but the apple-pecan wheat toast was great, as was the coffee.  If only the star of the meal had been worth my while.

The space was small, and unless its a nice day and outside seating is available, accommodating more than a couple people in a group may be difficult.  They also fail to offer coffee while you wait to be seated and, during Sunday brunch at least, there will be a noticeable wait.
author: Christopher R.

description:
One of my favorite breakfast places in Noe Valley. Ambiance is very neighborhood cafe like with lots of regulars. The food is always great. French toast, avocado  and cheese scramble, rosemary bread.. you can't go wrong!

Make sure you bring cash or swing by the ATM across the street. Cash only.
author: shalimar g.

description:
Came for Sunday Brunch on 4th of July and was expecting to wait for a table, but to my surprise, no wait at all! The weather was beautiful so we sat outside. The service was nice, they were very accommodating. Weird thing is they don't have highchairs or boosters for children. Oh and make sure you bring cash because they don't take credit cards, there's an ATM in the liquor store across the street though. 
The menu was very simple, clean breakfast foods. I was surprised to see no eggs benedict on the menu or omelets, but they have some great egg scrambles! The jarlsberg cheese on top of my green onions, peppers and tomatoes eggs scramble was a good choice! The blueberry pancakes were full of blueberries and we all got fruit bowls filled with fresh sweet fruits! It was ok but there are so many more breakfast places to try out in this city.
author: Quynh N.

description: There are like 500+ reviews that say what I want to: this place is super good. Best on a sunny day when you want to sit outside. I am slowly working my way through the entire menu because everything is good!
author: Kate M.

description:
I visited Chloe's Cafe after hearing about this spot through word of mouth and visiting Yelp.

Pretty outstanding breakfast. I opted for the Bacon, Tomato, Jarlsburg cheese omelette and added mushrooms. The potatoes were great and I loved the Rosemary white toast. 

All in all, I'm glad my girlfriend and I got OUT of the Marina for breakfast and made the trek to Noe Valley to visit this spot. Thank you Chloe's for making my Sunday (and Monday-leftover breakfast) fantastic!!!
author: Sarah A.

description: This is such a cute little brunch place in Noe! Came here with a friend for brunch, and I got the pecan pancakes with a side of scrambled eggs and fruit. Everything was so tasty. Plus, you get free refills on iced coffee (yay!) The restaurant is super tiny, but I think it's nice because it's quiet and in a nice location. One downside is that it is cash only, but there are a few atm's right down the street. Our waitress was friendly and super attentive and the food was great, so I definitely plan on coming back!
author: Danielle M.

description: Okay, every weekend this place is packed! I have no clue why. My mom and I gave this place a chance THREE times, and it was awful every time. I ordered the french toast twice . I don't know how you can mess up french toast but they did. I don't remember what the service was like, but that might be the only thing going for them. That and it is a cute location. The food is just awful.
author: Giovanna C.

description: Love this place! Everyone is so nice and the food is even better! My favorite breakfast place in the city:)
author: Katie M.

description: i have been coming here for years....mostly take out but they are so consistently great, it's so hard to do. Love the salads, and yum the Jarlsberg and Avocado sandwich...superb. bLT yummy!
author: Rachel B.

description: French toast and chicken apple sausage were very good. Pancakes were just pancakes. Very small, had to wait, but worth it. Scrambled eggs only, but lots of choices.
author: Drew F.

description:
One of the best breakfast spots in SF, and definitely the premier breakfast/brunch place in Noe Valley.

Great food, fresh ingredients, friendly wait staff, and jolly owner. The only minus is the long wait to get seated, but once your food is served you'll realize the wait was well worth it.

Red potato egg scramble, with fresh fruit cup! MMMM good.
author: Darius T.

description:
We came right before closing time on a Tuesday, so it was not too busy like everyone has complained about, which is definitely a good thing. :-)

When we walked inside to sit down, because it was a bit windy, we sat down near the kitchen and it kinda smelled like bum, but I think it was someone who was sitting around us or something.

When we sat outside, I ordered the mocha and it was very good for restaurant mocha.  I ordered the croissant french toast...it came with strawberries, blueberries and bananas. OH MY GOD!! TO DIE FOR.  It was seriously the best breakfast ever.  The service was also very good.

The boyfriend got an omelet, but I tried his potatoes, which were delicious, and the white rosemary toast was delicious.

Very small restaurant, so I would reccomend going there if it's later or if it's a weekday, because there are only a few tables, and I've heard this place gets INSANELY busy. 

Yumyumyum though. 5 stars fo sho.
author: Briezee P.

description:
Even though I'm not a breakfast person during the week, I'm a huge fan of breakfasts on the weekends.  I'm always on the lookout for new  breakfast/brunch spots.  When I saw Chloe's Cafe had 4 stars with 300+ reviews on yelp, I expected to be blown away.  I wish that were the case.  :(

Due to some extreme partying the night before, we ended up eating a VERY late brunch at 3pm on a Sunday.  Chloe's closes at 3:30pm.  The restaurant was empty, aside from a couple seated in one of the two tables outside.   We asked the waitress (or owner?) if it was too late for us to eat and even though she said okay, she didn't seem too excited to have our business.   We walked more than a few blocks just to try this place out for my bf's birthday, so we weren't going to leave just based on her behavior (and duh, we were starving).   My bf asked if we could have a seat at the table outside and the lady said, "I gueeeessss, if you want to, but it's really cold."  She looked at us as if we were from another planet.  It wasn't even cold!  I was mystified by her behavior.   While my bf grabbed the table, I went to the liquor store next door to get cash.  Chloe's is cash only.
