I trek all the way from Nob Hill to have breakfast here about once a month. The cinnamon croissant french toast is definitely worth the trek and the wait. We all wait for  dinner table and a drink at bar...why not breakfast too?Isn't it the most important meal of the day?

Tips:
 - Go early to avoid the wait
 - Try the french toast, you won't be disappointed
 - Parking tends to not be so fun unless you go early
author: Aubrey W.

description:
I love this place!  The food is excellent.  Sure, their menu is limited and may be a bit overpriced...but everything they serve is delicious.  

It's definitely a small place, and you definitely dont' want to come here if you're starving and have to eat right there and then.  I think the entire place only seats like....20 people?  The wait is usually around 30 minutes everytime I've gone, but i think it's worth it.  You just have to know what to expect.  Coffee keeps coming, and the french toast is exquisite!  Definitely a cute place, with cozy feel to it.
author: Tadd L.

description:
I love breakfast more than anything -- well, maybe not ANYTHING.  However, a breakfast of potatoes, cheddar cheese, and onion scramble, whole wheat walnut toast, fruit, and hot coffee is what I consider breakfast perfection.  I get that the wait sucks -- but there's rarely a wait for us early risers.  

The skinny of it is - if you can drag your arse out of bed before 8:30 am on a Saturday and make it to Chloe's, you are pretty much guaranteed a small slice of heaven.
author: Courtaney W.

description:
Heard a lot of great things about Chloe's and even saw a review on televison's "Eye on the Bay" that made the place look really great.  So, on a gorgeous sunny autumn day my partner and I drove from the Sunset to check out Chloe's.  

My big disappointment was the fact that there were no omelettes on the menu and that happens to be my favorite breakfast food.  What's hard about making an omelette?  The Santa Fe Scrambe that my partner and I got was good, but JUST good.  Not great.  Our toasted bagels were warm but not toasted.  Isn't toasted supposed to mean that it gets a little brown?  Maybe I'm weird but that's what I expect from a toasted bagel and ours was completely white.  Oh, and we had to practically beg for iced tea refills.

I can't say that this place is bad because it isn't.  It's just fine.  Just maybe not worth going out of your way for.  Nothing about it is over the top fantastic.  It's just fine.  So, if you live near Chloe's, go for it.
author: Daniel S.

description:
Met a friend in the city for a nice breakfast. It was very cozy and quaint and the food was great. I am rating it non-kid friendly, but only because they have no high chairs (we had brought our booster chair along after calling ahead) and the space is really tight so it can be hard to maneuver. 

I had a bacon, tomato, green onion cream cheese scramble with home fries and sourdough - delicious. My husband and friend had the banana walnut pancakes and my son loved them, too!

The service is very friendly and nice and they don't rush you even with a crowd waiting outside in the rain. We will go back!
author: jenn w.

description:
I have high standards for breakfast, so it's tough to give Chloe's an excellent review...it wasn't horrible-don't get me wrong.  I'd want to go back there again. The place was crowded-which is definitely a testament  of it's popularity and deliciousness!  

The food isn't anything out of the ordinary...the scrambles was great, the choices were ok.  If i'd go back, i'd get the banana nut pancakes though...that was good-from the small piece I tried from my friend's plate. 

It was ok...i'd go back..but it wasn't freakinamahzinglikecrazy!
author: Jac T.

description:
I have been going to Chole's for years -- love the atmosphere, food and staff. 

Know that it is "Cash Only" -- no Credit Cards accepted. 

Yes the eating area is small. Yes you may have to wait on a busy day for 20-30 minutes. Yes the bathroom is small. Ummm -- this is San Francisco (a big city) so expect all the above. 

As for the food -- well -- I have yet to have a bad meal. Ham Scramble with Jarlsberg, home fries and walnut toast is my standard. 


::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
Digression/Rant:
:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
I know one reviewer (Natalie W) wanted "egg substitutes" and that not having them was like being in Texas. Ok -- interesting opinion. 

(No"egg substitute" == bad == like living in Texas? Hmm -- way to represent your home state. Good thing you left)

If the lack of an "egg substitute" does not meet the Princess requirement then I have a suggestion -- stay in the Marina. 
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
Rant Over
:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

Choles is a top-notch place -- a local eatery with old style charm and a consistent level of food quality and service. 

I'll be back this weekend -- with or without "egg substitutes".
author: Ethan A.

description: I LOVE Chloe's- and I can't say enough about it.  I've been a million times now-theyre breakfast is always wonderful, tastes clean and healthy.  I love their service, their mimosas and their home style potatoes. I've brought friends here as well-they always love it.
author: Tiffani C.

description: I am a total fan of breakfast, its my favorite meal of the day. lol. I had the daily special which was egg scramble with pesto, mozarella, tomatoes, mushrooms and it was so good!  I also tried the french toast which is also really good!  Definitely going to frequent this breakfast place more often.
author: L V.

description: Went here for Sunday brunch. Did not have to wait for a long time unlike other places (we got there at 11 am) The weather was nice so sat outside, really wanted to love the place since it is very close to our house. We ordered the banana pancakes and a breakfast special. The food was simple and arrived quickly. I would probably go here when I am feeling lazy and dont feel like cooking.
author: Urvi V.

description: I had breakfast here yesterday.  The place is a little small, with a small menu. But, the quality of food is what matters. Had the potato, onion, cheese scramble with home fries.....mmmmm perfect! I would definitely recommend stopping by sometime.
author: Seth D.

description:
Yes, I am picky about my food, so 5 stars from me (food) means a lot! 

My friend and I had the best sandwiches here (Thursday at 1pm) after going to the spa! We shared the egg/dill sammie and the avacado/jarlesberg one...both sammies came with blue chips. 

Ingredients included lots of fresh veggies, and everything was very fresh, flavorful, and perfect for this lacto-ovo veggie eater!! AND prices were very reasonable (7 bucks for a nice sized sammie)!!

Be sure to bring cash (they dont take credit cards) and you may have to wait during peak times (there are only about 10 tables).
author: S G.

description:
I agree to the comments that the lines are long to get a table and inside it isn't that spacious (plus parking difficult in a residential district of Church St.) but the food itself (especially the breakfast) is worth it.

If you don't have the patience to wait it out, I'm sure there are other good places in Noe, but for me, pecan pancakes are worth my wait.   Add the French toast and the scrambled eggs and you have something unique that few restaurants can duplicate.

Choice is yours.  The place up the block or your watch a newspaper and a great meal.
author: Richie W.

description:
Just ate here for the first time.  I must say that the quality and quantity lived up to the Yelp reviews.  The Pecan Pancakes alone were 10/10.  The Chicken Apple Sausage was also delicious.

I would recommend that you go during off hours in order to miss the rush.
author: Jesson d.

description:
Chloe's is a treat in every way. It's a great neighborhood spot in Noe with maybe 10 tables inside and 3 tables outside. It can get busy but turnover's pretty decent but you can expect to wait 40 minutes on a sunny Sunday morning.
They server breakfast and lunch but I've never actually ordered any of their lunch items, though I've been with people who've ordered a salmon sandwich and an egg salad sandwich and they loved it. But I come for the breakfast. Every egg dish is divine; the eggs are soft and fluffy and their potatoes are unique. They have croissant french toast which is amazing! The only thing that sucks is their bacon. Don't bother. Their chicken apple sausage, however, is fantastic as well as their coffee. Enjoy!
small and intimate, the food is on the cozier side of breakfast.
author: Mario T.

description: Great food and excellent service. Great brunch spot, but be aware, it's popular and you may have to wait a while. That said, it's well worth it.
author: Steve R.

description: Pretty damn great. The scrambles are generously loaded with whatever choices you decided to put inside. Extra $1 for croissant is worth it. No line whatsoever when my friends and I went, but then again it was a Monday afternoon. hehhe Comfy and cozy.. like a little corner nook. If I lived closer, I'd probably frequent it way more often.. wanna read the morning paper here everyday.
author: Yui K.

description:
My favorite brunch place!! I usually get their special d'jour (scrambled eggs w/day's special add-ins, bowl of fruit and a croissant).

The wait can be a pain (45 mins) on weekends. I try hit the place a bit later (just before closing around 230pm).
author: viv k.

description:
This is my favorite breakfast place ever.  

 I love the food, I love the people and I love the place.  I take all visitors to SF to this place and they're glad I did.  

It's my second home.
author: Tori F.

description:
As a nurse and very positive person, I am famous for my patience. 

BUT THIS ONE REALLY PUSHED ME OVER THE WALL!!!

We went there yesterday for breakfast per my good buddy's recommendation. AND WE WAITED FOR MORE THAN AN HOUR JUST TO GET A TABLE!!! I was tellin' my friend " Look this is just ZAgat rate. How mush more if this has Michellin star. Do we have to wait for a day??".

Anyhow, I was happy that we were finally seated. The waitress asked for our drinks and it took another 15 minutes to arrive. Then we ordered food, and it took half an hour for my scrambled eggs and fruits!!

And the food is not EVEN GREAT TO START WITH!!! WTF, you can get the same crap from Denny's or I-hop!!!

Even the service is sloppy! I asked for cream cheese with my bagel and she gave me butter and when I asked for my cream cheese, it took another 10 minutes.

I'm sorry, you have to drug me before you drag me here again!!! 

If this is a hospital, people are already dead before they are seen by an MD or a nurse!!!

I'm generous in giving this place a one star!!! HONESTLY, I WILL GIVE THIS A HALF-STAR ONLY BECAUSE OF A BEAUTIFUL NAME...

Gosh, had I missed my farmer's market because of this place, I definitely go back and be bitchin in this crappy place and blame them for making my life miserable!!! LOL!!!
author: ASIANDIVAH A.

description: Came here starving with some family in the area. There was short wait which was driving me mad. We finally got to sit down. We ordered and shortly later we were served... I was served hands down the best breakfast I have EVER had... Could it be cause I was starving ... maybe but, I don't care. DELISH! I can't wait to head back to the city to have brunch again...
author: Amanda E.

description:
We like Chole's a lot. Its become one of our staples for a lazy day breakfast or lunch spot. 

Its a really cute little space, but sometimes a little too small, it tends to feel a little cramped. The toast is awesome. They offer walnut wheat and rosemary white which is not your average Wonderbread kind of toast you would get at  a normal cafe-diner kind of place. 

Sometimes the wait can be long, and there really isnt anywhere to wait but outside, which can suck in bad weather. The service is usually quick and friendly, we have never had any problems. 

I would say my only other complaint is that its cash only, which can sometimes be inconvenient. But overall a really nice little spot.
author: Sarah and Amanda G.

description: As many times as I have had breakfast there, it was delicious. You will most likely have to wait in line a little, but it is totally worth it. The service is nice.
author: Linda H.

description: Absolutely the best omelet I've ever had  - sun dried tomatoes and all sorts of deliciousness. they had amazing sweet options too, including croissant french toast.  We had to wait a while, but it was worth it.  Go hungry because the portions are HUGE and they come with tast, potatoes, and fruit.  you waddle out of the place.  the tables outside would be perfect on a sunny day!  one weird thing - there's only one toilet and it's IN the kitchen.
author: leah w.

description: Waiting for what seems like an eternity is something that I expected when my friend and I came to this restaurant. However, waiting in the cold rain not expected. This place is super small; this is not an exaggeration. It felt more crowded than cozy and with all my clothes and hair being soaked, I was pretty pissed. I ordered the croissant french toast while my friend had the BLT. The service was decent and it felt like the food took forever to come out. However, when my french toast came out, I was a smiley fool. I ordered three pieces and I'm glad I did. I finished it all. LIKE A BOSS. My friend finished his dish as well and I think the food made up for the long wait. I would come back again, maybe when the weather isn't so wet.
author: Lauren L.

description: Yummy and cozy. I'm pretty particular about brunch and love a good sweet brunch. Chloe's delivers but is not quite perfection. Not sure what's it's missing. The pancakes were a little thick and the eggs just weren't 'special'. The coffee was fine. But nonetheless I'll definitely be back. This is a really solid adorable little place that certainly is popular!
author: Kristin S.

description: Mmmmm. banana walnut pancakes with syrup (huge!). Let's just say that an order of 3 pancakes is definitely for the brave. Or at least braver than I am. The croissant french toast was delicious as well. I think an ideal plate would be one banana pancake, a scramble and a small cup of fruit. and coffee. Can't forget that.
author: Faye P.

description:
We went to this quaint little cafe after reading rave reviews in Citysearch, and are very glad that we tried it out.
The trout sandwich was great, as were the 'potato, cheese and onion scramble' (the accompanying whole wheat walnut bread and home fries are fantastic), chicken and vegetable soup, and mimosas. Tab was very reasonable, considering we could hardly move after the generous portions.
author: Godot -.

description:
Best breakfast I've had so far in SF (there may be better places, but when I find something good, it is really hard for me to branch out.) I always get the red potato and onion scrambled eggs with avocado added and the whole wheat walnut toast. If you get fruit instead of potatoes it is a reasonable amount of food (too much otherwise).

The wait is very long but if you get there early or bring a big coat on the really cold days and choose to sit outside it's not so bad. If you do go at peak times (11 am until close), you shouldn't be too hungry because you might have to eat your hand to sustain life. 

The service is always great here for me. I like to get in and get the heck out and I think the staff is always attentive and working to get people in and out (thank god for that!!) It really pisses me off when people sit there and chat and chat and chat at a place like this with long wait... so rude... but I digress.

But honestly, I'm in it for the food. If the food is worth it, I'll endure long waits.
author: Mandy K.

description:
A simple and lovely neighborhood spot. Chloe's does one thing exceptionally well: scrambled eggs with toast. The special scramble of the day is always a safe bet, and the whole wheat walnut with the house jam is fantastic.

Cash only.
author: Matt B.

description:
i am giving this spot 4 stars because i was famished. . . and the wait was toooooo long.
other than that, the food is deeelish.
Huge portions.
eggs cooked perfectly.
chicken apple sausage. . .fabulous.
bacon. . . perfectly crispy.
boyfriend's peca pancakes. . .OMG!! (getting those next time)
author: mary c.

description: The place is small and charming. I came in a group of five on a Saturday morning and we were seated within 10 minutes. The food is more interesting than the usual brunch place, if slightly pricey. Note that it's cash only.
author: Leo D.

description: Yelp suggests that two stars means "Meh, I've experienced better."  "Meh" is a really good descriptor for all of my 4 experiences at Chloe's (I wanted to make sure I had enough data points before writing a review).  At least, the food has been meh. The atmosphere is cozy and sweet, which is probably why I'll continue going to eat the meh food.  Their scrambles I could make just as good or better at home. Their pancakes tasted like they were from a box. Coffee's fine.  Their bacon is flimsy and tastes like salty rubber. Their toast and potatoes are pretty good.  All averaging out to one long unimpressed sigh.
author: Christine C.

description: Service was friendly very Small restaurant, I ordered the scramble special that was not good, I left my coffee to be refilled for at least 20 min and finally had to ask for more coffee, for the price I think SF offers better places to go...oh yes and cash only sucks!!!!
author: Dee D.

description: Amazing croissant French toast with strawberries.  The omlettes are really neat because the ratio of egg to "filling" is more 50/50 than the usual 80/20.  Too bad they don't squeeze their own OJ though.  Arrived at 11:00 with 3 people and waited about an hour.  Worth it, though!
author: Corey C.

description: Food is very tasty. Portions are average. Not a place for the big appeitite.  Very friendly staff.
author: Dave And Teenz Q.

description: Good service and friendly atmosphere. Food was also quite good.  We ha an egg scramble with jarlsberg and avocado and an egg salad sandwich. If anything the egg salad sandwich was overstuffed making it hard to eat!
author: Ryan M.

description: Waited for more than 45 minutes to get a table inside... it was freezing this Sunday and we didn't want to sit and shiver and not enjoy the food.. it was well worth the wait tho! We had the mushroom, pesto scramble and the banana walnut pancakes... and it was hands down one of the best brunches I have ever had. Nice homey atmosphere in the cafe but beware they only take cash.
author: Pooja S.

description:
I have never reviewed any established on-line before, but my experience at Chloe's was so disappointing that I felt like I should speak up.

I was there recently for Sunday brunch, and was surprised to hear that the orange juice was not fresh squeezed.  I ordered their  "special" scrambled eggs and fresh blueberry pancakes.  The eggs were average at their best, but the true let down were the pancakes.  Though I have no doubt the blueberries were fresh (as they claimed), the pancake mix tasted like it came from a package-the kind you simply mix with water.  

I also ordered a latte which was truly nothing special.  

I was surprised to see bottled syrup purchased from a wholesale organization.  A place like this should carry real maple syrup.

To sum up, I felt like I received chain quality food, a big surprise for a small neighborhood establishment.  

I had eaten here in the past before and my experience was much better.  It almost felt like the ownership had changed, but I am not sure of that.
author: miriam k.

description: I'm not sure where all of these 5 star ratings are coming from, but the food here does not warrant a 5 star rating.  It's OK food, OK service, and sub-par atmosphere.  A person with whom I was dining had plastic wrap in his salad.  I do have to give them props because they took it off the bill (as any restaurant should), but that's pretty unacceptable to begin with.  My food was fine, but seriously uninspired.  And the fact that they have a cash-only policy is another minus in my book (who carries cash nowadays?).
author: Dave L.

description:
Chloe's Open-faced Egg Salad and Jarlsberg Sandwich: there's no better way to start a Sunday than with an enormous pile of egg salad and lettuce and tomato and carrots and red cabbage and cucumber and onions and cheese and and blue corn chips and warm, buttered rosemary toast.  Yummmm!  

Everything at Chloe's is very fresh and carefully prepared, and the waitstaff are as nice as could be.  Is there anything more you could ask from a neighborhood cafe?
author: Caroline O.

description: Great food!  Servers are very good. But the one reviewer who said there are waffles is wrong.  Chloe's has never served waffles!  Great pancakes though!
author: Blancett R.

description:
i took the advice of the reviewers here and got the strawberry  croissant french toast and i was NOT disappointed... it was great!  we also got the avocado and jarlsberg cheese scramble......perfect combination!
the waitstaff was friendly and accommodating.  i would highly recommend this place.
author: beth m.

description:
All in all, I like the place. The missing star is because nothing really made it to the "wow" category. The seating inside is cozy. The food is good. The wait is not bad. Noe valley is obviously nice. Service is pretty good. Nothing really disappointed me. My wife and I walked out happy :)

Chloe's is now definitely on my list of favorite breakfast places (Zazie and Mama's being the other two)
author: Ashwin K.

description: Pretty good brunch place in Noe with attractive outside seating. The croissant french toast seems to be their specialty. It is pretty good, but not quite as mind blowing as Olea's challah custard french toast.
author: X O.

description: I adore Chloe's for a cozy and scrumptious weekday brunch. As others have pointed out, it gets a bit mobbed on the weekend. From the blueberry pancakes to the egg salad sandwiches - absolutely everything I've had to eat here has been thoroughly enjoyable. They make correct cappuccino and the service is very pleasant. Be sure to bring cash dollars as they don't accept credit cards.
author: Rebecca O.

description: My favorite place for breakfast or lunch. The egg dishes are delicious and the salads are yummy. They have outdoor seating, which is great for bringing the pooch! Service is quick and competent. Plan on going on off hours or waiting for a table in this tiny spot!
author: Melisa K.

description:
nice cafe in a nice neighborhood!! They have a nice outside area and street parking is no problem!
come there early, as a lot of people like to have brunch there at weekends!

They offer fruit instead of home fries, which is great and healthy! I had delicious scrambled eggs with ham. Tea and coffee is refill! Waitresses are very nice and helpful!

4 stars!
author: Christina P.

description: Chloe's has attentive, friendly service courtesy of the gentleman that may be an owner.  What a refreshing change!  Awesome scrambles (any of them with Jarlsberg rule) plus real bread and jam make this a satisfying deal.  It was packed by 8:20 am on Sunday.
author: Esther R.

description: very attentive service! the special was AMAZING. i got the omelette with cream cheese, so GOOD
author: Christine K.

description:
I haven't been to this place in ages. Why? Because I can only go on weekends (it's only open for breakfast and lunch, and I work a 9-5 across town) and by the time I roll my butt out of bed on a Saturday and get to Chloe's the wait is already 2 hours long. Don't get me wrong - I get why there's such a wait, this place does amazing breakfast and pretty good lunch food too - but when you're hungry/hungover on a Saturday no one wants to wait that long. There's only maybe 7 tables inside this tiny cafe and 3 tables outside and most likely if they ever expanded, the quality of the food would go way down. Amazing breads - croissants, rosemary toast, etc. fresh fruit, good home fries - and I'm picky about my home fries. Every part of the bacon, lettuce, tomato, avocado sandwich (on rosemary toast, of course!) is perfect.

Ah Chloe's, how I miss thee. I'll have to stumble back over there one day when I manage to get up early on a saturday.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Sure there's a long wait.
Try going on a weekday.
Get your egg on here.
author: Alana D.

description: Casual, neighborhood eatery great for breakfast and lunch. Handful of outside seating perfect for warm weather feedings. Most opt for breakfast (served all day), but sandwiches are fresh and healthy alt. About $7-10/per person. If you can endure long lines, it's worth the wait. If you want to avoid the lines, arrive around 2pm.
author: Kate L.

description: I have been going to Chloes for many years and it is one of the best neighborhood cafes in the City to get a really nice brunch, lunch or breakfast. As a former SF resident it was our go to place on the weekends. Now that I live out of state I always find time to squeeze in a visit to Chloes when I am in town. The place is packed on the weekends so you might have to wait, for a table, but the staff will get you a coffee and you can hang out on the sidewalk with the other folks whose mouths are watering for Chloes' delicious Banana Walnut Pancakes, to die for Croissant FrenchToast, or an unbelievable salad with homemade dressing!  The food and the service are worth the wait. Being that it is in now uber trendy Noe Valley you might be subjected to mingling with uptight yuppies like the reviewer below who couldn't cope with only having one menu for her party of two. Whatever! I am assuming the reviewer is a female since she made a catty remark about the size of the waitress. How is that relevant to the review? And who doesn't complain when they find a pubic hair in their food?! Anyway, sounds like BS to me. Especially the negative comments about the staff who are actually professional, fast and friendly. In my experience if one treats wait staff like crap one does not usually get a warm fuzzy in return. With that said, I have never had a negative experience at Chloes and, in fact, if there was ever anything the least bit not to my liking the staff took care of it immediately and courteously. This is a tiny, super busy neighborhood establishment where one goes for delicious, fresh food and fast service. If one wants to be treated like a spoiled princess then one should stick to the Marina.
author: Janet G.

description:
being that i had mud-butt the last few days from eating some korean left-overs that went bad (i think) and have been eating nothing but jook or soup, i was salivating at the chance of slamming down some tasty scrambles at Chloe's.

we all looked over the menu and since i have always passed on their occasional special, see Nico's rev for details-  http://www.yelp.com/user_details_review_search?q=chloe%27s+cafe&userid=S5WQcThM04eH7Eu0YJ1a1Q

...i went with it and was happy-happy!  the rest of my party went with other scrambles and they were equally tasty-lishious ; P  as usual the cooks came out and hand-delivered the dishes which is a rarity in SF brunch spots.  was happy to see that they finally installed the three outdoor tables on the more sunny side which helps with their limited seating inside.  

i swear that every time that i have been in this part of noe there are always estate sales...and sure you can find many gems at these fru-fru garage sales, please explain why all the hawt ladies are always found at these things??  

iam not complaining by any means and yes, they usually find their way for eats down the corner at chloe's..don't forget a healthy spray of axe!!!!!  bomchickawahwah!!   http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i350Kelq5nQ
author: omar b.

description: Cute, tiny neighborhood place, always packed on weekends so plan on a wait. French toast is heavenly, eggs and sandwiches are good too.
author: E T.

description:
a little slice of marina in noe valley. actually, this is where the marina, um, i mean noe folks go to feed their babies. if you don't believe me, come and have brunch here. this tiny cafe can really pack it in, but the food is very good and the service is top notch. translation - you're going to wait at least 30 minutes for a table. during this time, you can check out all the little aliens and make fun of them. gawd, they're so helpless.

warning: if your partner is thinking about having babies and you're not quite ready, DO NOT come here.
author: frisco j.

description: I had a fabulous experience at Chloe's. I went here for lunch on a Friday and was somewhat surprised to see a crowd waiting on the sidewalk, but it only took 5-10 minutes to get a table. Service was good but the food was even better. I went for the 1/2 sandwich and salad combo. I opted for the albacore tuna sandwich even though I really don't like tuna. For some reason, though, something was drawing me to it. I'm glad that something did because it was delicious!!!! I also very much appreciated the blue tortilla chips and the side salad was HUGE! You definitely get your bang for the buck here. I'd love to go back to try the breakfast food but seeing the other reviews, I'll have to be strategic about the time I go to beat the crowds. Solid performance, Chloe's.
author: Susan L.

description: I LOVE Chloe's scrambles!  I took a friend who's in love with scrambles and was impressed by it!  I used to think Universal has the best scramble - not! They usually have pretty creative specials.  Been there 3x already and always left satisfied.  Their home fries ruuuuled, forget about diet and health. :) Though, you must be warned about the long wait!
author: Cathy Y.

description: Best breakfast Ive had at a restauraunt...Nothing spectacular on menu but their ingredients are super fresh, everything is cooked just perfect, eggs arent dry....its superb and superbly priced to boot, can see on weekends why it takes forever and a day to get a seat!
author: maria c.

description: I am really not a fan of Chloe's. The quality of food is very average to blah. On the weekends between 11am-2pm the lines are huge and the average wait is around 45 minutes. I really don't like any of the limited choices on their menu and nothing excites me about their food and every time I've been there, I've ordered the same salmon lox platter.  Inside is too noisy and the tables outside sitting on a slightly slanted downhill sidewalk are not exactly comfortable with all the traffic noise passing by. Not to mention the fire dept being very close by.
author: Marc N.

description:
This review is not intended to be witty or Yelp-esque, but it is intended to describe my not so pleasant experience at Chloes.

I have eaten at Chloes several times, suffering through the inordinately long waits for some decent brunch.

Recently, however, this mediocre brunch place pushed me over the edge.  I arrived at Chloes with two friends on a rather cold and rainy day.  The hostess/waitress was extremely rude.  First, she greeted us with a surly attitude.  Then, she refused to squeeze us into a smaller table.  Then, she told us to wait for our table outside in the rain, becase apparently we were bothering the other customers by standing inside and remaining dry.  We ended up leaving and going elsewhere.  I encourage you to do the same.

Don't let these so-so restauranteers in San Francisco change the neighborliness and acomodating spirit of the San Francisco.
author: Wanda Z.

description:
brilliant brunch spot if you're not in a hurry. this neighborhood is nice. i'm not used to standing outside some place in this city and not being heckled for change.

in any place that offers breakfast, no matter what else they offer, i am required to order breakfast. it was a pact i signed with lucifer many years ago and cannot rescind. so i ordered the pancakes. i wish they came with eggs because eggs are the best. but it did come with a fruit bowl. the only problem is the fruit was mostly melon, which is not the best. and it made my strawberries taste like cantaloupe. but, as that is the only complaint i had, chloe's scores a sweet four out of five.

congratulations chloe's! a representative will be by shortly to deliver your certificate of four-starredness. please have an acceptance speech prepared.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: Chloe's, would you marry me? I don't care if the wait is long (average, 1 hour), I don't care if you only take cash (and I love credit cards) and that you are super small, I just want to have you forever, ever, ever!
author: Anabelle B.

description: Finally decided to give this place a try since the ratings on yelp were better than toast; although, i think Toast is better. The inside of this place is kinda small, but there is also outdoor seating.  i ordered a smoked salmon scrambler  with fresh fruits and a croissant.  The scrambler was decent; it was like something i could've made at home if i wasn't so lazy.  The fruits were fresh and the croissant tasted like the ones you get from costco.  The tastiest thing on my plate was the jam that came with the croissant.  It wasn't those small packs of smuckers; i think it was that organic stuff.  The food here isn't that bad but i would give Toast a better rating
author: Cedric F.

description: Simply the best breakfast in the neighborhood. Get whatever is on the specials board. Go there early, or be prepared to wait. A very. Very. Long time. Put your name on the list and then take a stroll down to Martha's and get a cup of coffee to go and by the time you get back to Chloe's your table might be ready.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Really good croissant french toast with fresh strawberries. I was not a fan of the long wait... The food was decent. The service was sort of slow. I was not expecting amazing and I did not get amazing. It has a sort of "charming" quality that makes me uneasy, maybe it is the tight spaces and crowds or maybe it is the cuteness?
author: Shannon Z.

description: Chloe's has become a regular Sunday brunch spot for us. I usually go with a scramble of some sort, then share a stack of pancakes with the table. Recently their pumpkin ginger pancakes (seasonal) became my favorite thing on the menu. I really really wish they would accommodate egg white/egg beater requests, but the answer is always a firm no. Oh well, I'll still go back very soon!
author: Kelly N.

description: The last time I went to Chloe's, we were asked to leave because they had people waiting for tables.  In and of itself, this wouldn't have been a problem.  If we had been clueless people who were lingering over coffee, I could totally see their point.  However, after they neglected to bring my father's breakfast not once, but twice (so not with the original meal for everyone else and then not again when he asked about it, but finally after the 2nd time he asked) it felt perfectly reasonable to stay at our table until he finished his breakfast.  It was rude that they asked in our situation and it was even more rude that they were not apologetic about the situation at all.
author: Jenn M.

description: A Noe Valley gem and a fabulous brunch spot, though probably tough to get in at peak hours. Very charming interior and excellent food all around.
author: Ed M.

description: Love it, love it.  But don't come hungry; there will be a line.  They do let you grab coffee while you wait, which is nice.  And, they solve the "eggs or pancakes" problem by offering *both* in one dish on the menu.  Fab.
author: Elizabeth P.

description: Go here for the croissant french toast and make sure you order it with strawberries and bananas! It's sooo GOOD! I think it might even be better than Mama's and there isn't a 45 minute wait on weekday either.
author: Sharon H.

description: I stopped in during a recent trip to San Francisco, and wish I had a place like Chloe's closer to home! We had to wait a while to be seated, but it was well worth it. The ambiance is cute, tucked into a corner space on a quiet street- it has the feeling of an old cafe/diner. The food was great: I had the banana walnut pancakes - and they were very accommodating when I asked if I could just have the bananas on TOP of (not cooked into) the pancakes. DELISH!! My table also shared a serving of the croissant french toast - we just couldn't help ourselves.. and it was GOOD! covered in fresh strawberries, with just enough cinnamon flavor - YUM! Maybe its a good thing I don't live in San Francisco, cause I'd be eating at Chloe's EVERY WEEK!
author: Somer P.

description: I've been trying to eat brunch here for awhile, but usually the idea of draggin my booty out of bed early for breakfast isn't so appealing. The line is always long at Chloe's, so you have to be ready for a committment. That being said, it's a cute joint with a nice staff and yummy breakfast. Were there many menu items you can't find at other places? No. The best home fries in San Francisco? No. But the buttermilk pancakes and scrambled eggs I had were pretty darn satisfying. My bf ate scrambled eggs with potatoes, red onions, mushrooms, and cheddar, and if your tummy can handle it, that was good also. Big plus: the side of fruit I got was strawberries and bananas and a little melon (as opposed to the typical fruit salad consisting of 90% melon). Big con: the coffee was so-so. I just can't rave about a breakfast place that doesn't serve really good coffee. I've got scruples!
author: Lisa F.

description: Right around the corner so I had to try it.  Crossant french toast with fresh strawberries and bananas = yum.  Banana walnut pancakes even better, though.  Scrambled eggs w/ham, tomatoes, and cheddar was utter goodness too.
author: Melinda C.

description: Great place to have your pancake breakfast. Go early to avoid waiting on the street.
author: cynthia l.

description: Great scramble.  They didn't overlook the potatoes (like most places).  they were delicious.  quick service great to the point waiter.  can't wait to come back to try the croissant french toast!
author: John B.

description: The food and service at Chloe's are great.  Unfortunately, alot of people are aware of this.  Bring a newspaper, because it will be a while.  The wait isn't quite on the scale of Mama's or Ella's, but you definitely need to be prepared to earn your brunch.
author: Andrew E.

description: Excellent food. My friend and I shared the banana walnut pancakes and the scramble with red potatoes, cheddar and onions. Got the whole wheat walnut toast. Everything was awesome. My friend's mimosa was made with fresh OJ. The wait was about an hour so be prepared for that... When you get there, just write your name down on the waiting list and wait til they call your name...
author: Wen T.

description: Yummy yummy yummy brunch spot. The best mimosa ive ever had. Sat outside, had eggs and homefries and was as content as could be. Definitly will be back to try the french toast!
author: Britney K.

description:
We were on our way to breakfast down the street at Toast when I saw the big line outside this place and thought "With that many fans, it must be good."  We returned the next day, waited an hour, and determined that while good it was, great it was not, and certainly not worth a long wait.  I ordered the dill egg salad sandwich.  It was very blah, which surprised me given all the high marks it gets here.  I had to add a lot of salt.  I don't even much like mayo, but I found myself wanting to add more or get some vinaigrette or do something to add a little flavor.  Boyfriend got one of the egg bakes.  It tasted good, but nothing a person couldn't do at home.  We did like the potatoes and the rosemary toast.  
Service was good, once we were seated.  However, I couldn't help but feel like I had to rush, as I knew there were a dozen or more hungry yuppy vultures lurking around outside, eyeing our table.  Bottom line: this town has so many delicious brunch options that it's silly to wait around for good-but-not-great food when you can just as soon get great food elsewhere.
author: Smashley E.

description:
My first time here was over 10 years ago, then recently I moved closer to the area.  

My husband's favorite pancakes are here, that's why I agree to go.

They will only serve eggs scrambled, which is a limit.  The bacon is a little sad.  

Cute setting, close to Martha's coffee down the streets.  It's not a place I think worth standing in line, but I guess the sun and hanging out time is the experience too.
author: R N.

description: So there is always a wait, big deal. This place makes up for it with the food. The scrambled eggs were all very yummy. The rosemary bread was great as well. If the line wasnt so long I would go there more often
author: Carli M.

description: I really don't understand why everyone is so gaga about this place.  Their food is only okay, and the service is weird (they make you wait outside for 10 minutes while several tables inside are available).  Not worth the time... Fattoush down the road is better, cheaper, and has no waiting.  Oh, btw, check Chloe's Health Department Score Card... not very good!  That alone will ensure that I NEVER go back.
author: Customer X.

description: Siting outside with a nice latte while waiting for delicious food to arrive is the best way to start a morning. Then the cinnamon french toast croissants covered in strawberries come out and it gets better.   Yes, it's busy, because it is good. You may have to wait -- but probably not that long.   And it is so worth it.  Their scrambles & potatoes are also amazing.   Such a yummy place with a  great atmosphere.
author: Heidi P.

description:
After traveling abroad in Asia for over a month, I wanted to go to Chloe's Cafe because it's one of my all-time favorite places in the city for brunch.  Chloe's is a jewel of a place which consistently delivers fresh food that is hard to find anywhere else.

If you go, order their cinnamon croissant french toast with strawberries.  I don't care if you are stuffed to the brim with their fresh orange juice, their avocado and Jarlsburg egg scramble, their whole wheat walnut toast with jam, and their colorful fruit cup.  Order the cinnamon croissant french toast with strawberries to go.  Otherwise, you'll end up smacking yourself on the forehead regretting that you left Chloe's without ordering their signature dish.

What makes Chloe's Cafe great?  It's quaint, cozy, and downright homey.  Their menu makes it difficult to select just one item.  It amazes me that they can produce such delicious food out of their tiny kitchen.

If you want to avoid the wait, just go during the weekdays for lunch or get there super-early.

Despite my love for Chloe's, I had to take off one star for the somewhat slow service (even though not all the tables were full), the price (expect to spend about $15 per person for brunch including a drink, tax and tip), and the flies we had to shoo away towards the end of our meal.

The flies were not new as I remember coming here before with a friend  and declaring that Chloe's was my idea of heaven.  His retort: "Does your idea of heaven include flies?"

Nevertheless, go to Chloe's if you want good food in a charming atmosphere and don't forget to order their cinnamon croissant french toast with strawberries - it'll make you forget the wait and put a smile on your face!
author: Amy H.

description: I'll admit to loving sitting outside here on a sunny day, burying myself in creative eggs, and pretending I'm not listening to the juicy yuppie gossip going on at the table next door.
author: Megan W.

description:
I hate setting my alarm clock on Saturday night, especially after a good house-warming party and a belly-full-o-beer. The mere thought of hearing  that obnoxious beeping on a Sunday morning is excruciating (or is that just my hangover headache?!?!)...unless I have a date with a good friend at Chloe's. 
Chloe's only downfall is the wait...but it's always worth it and there is usually a handful of people to watch and remark on. This actually adds to the dining experience and gives me a chance to hang out in the fresh air (talking my hangover into taking a break so I can truly enjoy some great food) - thus does not detract from the 5 star rating. 
From the mimosas to the sandwiches, Chloe's does it all with attentive care and quick service (once you are seated). 
My favorite is the red potato, onion, and cheddar scramble. Lots of cheese, lots of flavor...a side o bacon usually is in order, but this morning I decided to skip the home fries (also delicious) and bacon and went for the side of fruit. 
Coffee's good, staff is always there just when you need a warm-up, and the prices are very reasonable. The serving size is generally more than I can finish...which makes me feel a little better about drinking all the beer the night before.
Adding "live within walking distance to Chloe's" to the wish-list should I ever pick up a genie-enclosed lamp from a neighborhood garage sale.
author: Jessa B.

description:
quite of a wait! a good 50 min! we got there at 11:45AM on a Sunday..I guess that said it all.. gotta get there earlier..

I had the banana walnut pancakes, scrambled eggs and mixed fruit.. after the long wait outside..you're just hoping for quick service..but, not.. had to wait another 30 min for the food..so, you could imagine how hungry we are by now! the pancakes were great..eggs were good..and fruit was sweet and fresh.. 

would come back next time, but much earlier.. parking can be hard to find..
author: Linda Y.

description: The banana-walnut pancakes are great!  I was introduced to the restaurant because a friend from Los Angeles, has to come through every time he's in the greater Bay Area.  The restaurant is smallish, and because of this usually has a longish wait, but I'd say if you have the time it's worth it.  The servers were great, and the variety of the menu was quite good.  Overall it's a great brunch spot!
author: Mark K.

description: My boyfriend and I came here with a friend... he saw Chloe's on View from the Bay and thought we should have brunch here. It looked really busy while we were waiting for our table, but surprisingly we were seated within 10 minutes.  You do need to put your name on a list. I had scrambled eggs with potatoes and onions. Surprisingly they only have  scrambled eggs with fixins, no sunny side up or over easy. That surprised me, but I suppose it makes for a easier menu. My boyfriend had pancakes. Our friend had the cinnamon french toast, that was really good. In my opinion everything tasted good, due to the fresh fruit. Now what wouldn't go well with fresh fruit? I had a glass of mimosa and I thought that just topped our brunch off. You can bring your dogs here to have brunch with you here if you do plan on eating outside. The neighborhood is great for people watching and parking wasn't too bad.I would definitely come here again for brunch again or maybe lunch and try a sandwich or salad with some girlfriends.
author: carebear l.

description: I met a friend at Chloe's for lunch this week.  Based on the reviews here, I had expected to order the croissant french toast, or something similar, but was swayed by the fresh Idaho trout sandwich with horseradish.  (Horseradish gets me every time!)  It was delicious, as was a cup of green and yellow split pea soup.  The service was friendly and efficient.  I will definitely go back.
author: Linda R.

description: We decided to go for lunch and we opted to sit outside, I ordered the egg scramble which was eggs-cellent. The service was great all the food was great. We had such a good time we went back the next day. We did not have to  wait either day and both days parking was a snap! But I heard it is a different story on the weekends! Good Food, Good People, what more could you ask for?
author: William M.

description:
This is always packed on weekend mornings, so my wife and I skip the line wondering aloud "how good can breakfast really be?"

I found out this morning...This is the best breakfast on the entire planet.   I had the home fries and a croissant with brie and tomato.  Sounds boring, right?  It was fantastic.  

Plan to enjoy the wait.  It is worth it.
author: Andy B.

description: It's around the corner; it's been there forever; I want to love it, but I just can't. Sorry, Chloe's, there's too much better brunch with less of a wait.
author: Abie H.

description:
I really don't understand what all the fuss is about. Food is  good, but doesn't warrant the huge wait. Banana / walnut pancakes were the highlight for me.

Was not impressed with the service. Went on a weekday and was kinda rudely told to write my name down and wait outside, even though the place was half-empty. Once we were seated, the service wasn't very attentive either...  seems like they're a little too high on themselves. 

Would not recommend going on a weekend. I much prefer Fattoush down the block or Savor.
author: Nithin R.

description: Chloe's was a nice surprise. A couple of weeks ago, I debated going here or to Toast; at that time, Toast won out, and I was supremely disappointed with the food I ate there. So THIS time, as I made my way back to this neighborhood, I headed straight to Chloe's and found the experience to be 10 times better. My husband and I split a combo plate of eggs and two pancakes (thanks to the waitress, we received a special order of banana pecan instead of banana walnut pancakes). We also ordered a side of grilled ham. Everything was fresh, served quickly (and piping hot!) and the service was friendly to boot. I also love the homey atmosphere in here, and with a window seat we enjoyed some nice street views. I will definitely be back!
author: Beth T.

description: Great banana and walnut pancakes. Very cute neighborhood hang out, especially good for those of us who are woken up by the dog early in the morning and need a place to go. They all love the four pawed child, and he has made many friends there.
author: Eric P.

description: Searched for a good breakfast spot on a sunny day and found that Chloe's was just what we needed.  The whole menu looked great... cinnamon croissant french toast, croissantwiches, banana walnut or pecan pancakes, an omelet special with basil & artichoke hearts, etc.  I settled on the grilled ham, roasted pepper & Jarlsberg croissantwich... it was stellar but I wish had been served with something else besides unappealing blue tortilla chips.  The banana walnut pancakes were absolutely fabulous, as expected, and the fruit salad was refreshing.  Quite the popular brunch spot, especially the outside seating, so get there early.
author: Tara G.

description: I'd like to give Chloe's four stars, because they were friendly and professional and quick (even though there was a bit of a wait), and the eggs were pretty good -- but a good portion of the homefries were badly burnt to the point of being unappetizing, black, and highly carcinogenic. That said, I covered them with ketchup and ate 'em anyway (do as I say, not as I do). When you charge $8 and up for a simple breakfast, there shouldn't be any weak spots in the meal.
author: Tal R.

description: I only subtracted a star for the wait outside. It's worth it, except when it's cold and really windy. Fabulous for brunch. I'm so picky about how my eggs are cooked (only soft scramble or over easy), and I'm always satisfied. Croissant sandwiches, fruit salads, and the roasted red potatoes are great too. I haven't been here in ages, and the next time I'm out and about for brunch on the weekends, I'm definitely down to go back.
author: Betsy W.

description: Chloe's is probably the best local breakfast, and the absolute worst local wait.  I just don't have the patience, particularly in the morning.  However, if you do get in, the food is great, even for lunch (they have a great tuna sandwich).
author: Jenn K.

description: love love love their breakfasts.  I just hate waiting so long for it... in the cold is worst.  They got me hooked on their Jarlsburg cheese.  I get it in their scrambled eggs all the time.  I also order the apple chicken sausage on the side and it's never failed me.  If you're not a big health freak, go for the home fries... so delish.  If you order the fruit, you might just get jealous of your partner across the table gobbling down their potatoes.
author: Christine O.

description: I want to give 5 stars to a place this yummy. Everything is good to eat. But the wait and the cramped seating sucked a star off the review.
author: Richard S.

description: I don't know...I expected more from you, Chloe's Cafe-with-the-40-minute- wait. My scramble was bland, despite loads of tasty ingredients that should have spiced it up right. My bagel was over-toasted, too. Then my friend said she was stepping over cantaloupe slices to reach the bathroom which, I admit, freaked me out.
author: Lisa L.

description:
I finally had brunch at Chloe's! Horribly long wait at peak meal times and I still haven't decided if it's worth it. But, here's what I tried:

Banana walnut pancakes - A+! Super loaded with banana and nuts!
Scrambled eggs - Best part of the meal! I didn't know scrambled eggs could be so delicious!
Fruit cup - Really fresh!
Bacon and tomato scramble (with cheddar cheese) - So good, I'm getting this next time... or something like it.
Chicken apple sausage - Yum. Can't go wrong with a side of this.
Home fries - Crunchy and perfectly cooked.

Hmmm... if only the wait weren't so long, I'd go to Chloe's every weekend!
author: Cecilia W.

description: It was ok. The croissant French toast was good, although a half order (two pieces) is 5 bucks or so, and the full order (3 pieces?) is almost 10. Not sure about the math, but that in combination with the fact that you can not have over easy eggs sold me on an average review.
author: Art W.

description: Went here for lunch on a random off day with my husband.  Excellent soups and sandwiches and comfort foods.  Cute but tiny little neighborhood place which explains the very long wait for brunch on the weekends.
author: Cyn B.

description: Completely overrated. I think people see a long line and think they MUST stand in it and that it MUST be good. This place is OK at best. Super long wait for just brunch. They asked it we wanted to sit outside. Uh! NO! It was windy and cold. They then seated 3 of us at a table that really was for 2! Took forever to take our order. I ordered a bagel and some bacon BOTH of which were burnt. The coffee was not good at all. Ok! bagel and bacon and coffee should not be bad. My friend and husband thought their plates were just ok. They brought my husband the wrong order of eggs. I like Toast and Savor on 24th (just up the street) much better. Better selection and coffee!! Not going back! EXPENSIVE TOO!
author: julie q.

description: The best french toast I've ever had!  Made with a croissant and cinnamon, MMMMMM!  The scrambles aren't bad, either.  Coffee is good.  Wait can be long (up to an hour,) but it's worth it!
author: jackie a.

description: Ok, now I understand what all the hype is about.  Monday morning post-weekend brunch, the place is super busy but our wait is not too long.  Delicious scrambles, friendly, attentive service, fun daily specials, very fair prices.
author: e w.

description:
I ALWAYS crave Chloe's on the weekends!

What I love:

1. Banana & Walnut pancakes...heavenly!
2. Their coffee...I swear it is much better than coffee places in Noe!
3. Their egg scrambles
4. Pleasant, attentive, gracious wait staff

Two things that I think are negatives:
1. Be prepared to wait...there is always a line, even on weekdays!
2. They are cash-only
author: E M.

description: About as perfect an experience one can have while in SF for a breakfast! Great service, 10 tables make for an intimate experience, food was done in 10 minutes and absolutely to die for!!
author: Jason A.

description: My go-to weekend brunch cafe.  Excellent food, always a wait list, but usually not more than 20mins.
author: Jonathan D.

description: Mmmmm banana walnut waffles...and I don't even like walnuts.  Seriously tasty.  I'll even forgive the overcooked side of bacon.  This place is very good and reasonably priced.  Yelp steers me right once again.
author: Al K.

description: Although the food is good and high quality, it's kind of pricey for what you get, there's not a lot of choice, classic breakfast items/combos are noticeably absent, it's incredibly small, gets cold every time the door opens, has fruit flies and doesn't have seating for the inevitable wait. There's better breakfast options in Noe Valley.
author: Kristina A.

description: I dream about their pancakes!! Chloe's was the best breakfast we had while visiting some friends in SF! There was a bit of a wait but not bad. The service was very attentive and the food was yummy!! My DH and I both had the Two Pancakes, Two Scrambled Eggs and Fresh Fruit. We also got the Home Fried Potatoes. Everything was delicious!
author: Kari S.

description: Yummy scrambled egg specials and french toast.  Food is always fresh.  Too bad there is always such a long wait to get in.
author: Michelle M.

description: Chloe's is a wonderful spot for brunch. It's very cozy with a few outside tables--which often translates into a 15 to 45-minute wait. But the banana-walnut pancakes are worth it.
author: Joe H.

description: The food is amazing.  The wait is ridiculous unless you get there right when they open.  They don't take credit cards.  Bottom line:  unless you have a ton of cash in your wallet and hours to spare, just go somewhere else.  However if you just happen to be up super early, give it a try because the food is actually really good.  Just not worth it to me though.
author: Jen S.

description: Yes, my previous 5 star rating was the product of grade inflation.  Chloe's is good and you should go there.  3 stars should be enough for that.
author: Des Esseintes I.

description:
Been here many a time. I've endured the long lines at peak hours. I've enjoyed a quiet brunch here during off peak times. Had breakfast here during the weekday. One can sit inside, one can sit outside. WARNING: Outside doesn't mean patio, they have tables on the sidewalk so that people in line can gloat and those occupying tables can people watch the line of "salavatees." Danger of eating outdoors? El Piccione. The pigeon's roost above the tables, so patrons are subject to indiscriminate pigeon "payload." A real treat to be assured. Means you're "special."  The food is fairly good for breakfast fare. Coffee is better at Martha's. Strategy? To eat at Chloe's on weekends, get your name in early and come back after strolling down 24th. Weekdays aren't a problem....er save for the pigeon thang. This is Noe Valley, which means everybody gets the same great idea at the same time. Too often that great idea is "Hey let's eat at Chloe's." That's when I stay away!

3 duckets for being quaint. Minus duckets for the backup and Piccione poopy.
author: Johnny C.

description: They already have a ton of reviews..but I just wanted to let you all know that this is my FAVORITE spot for breakfast! You will wait..no matter when you go..but it is worth it.
author: kelly p.

description: For brunch, I love the option of both something savory and something sweet. Chloe's has that nice blend. Their scrambled eggs have a ton of yummy options, from Jarlsberg cheese to avocados to bacon and tomatoes. And I threw in a banana walnut pancake to top off my sweet tooth.
author: Peter S.

description: You have to wait 20-30 minutes for a table and I'm still giving it 5 stars.  That's right bitches, this place is good.  I have occasionally been able to tear myself away from the red potato and cheddar scramble to get the special, but it is hard.  This place is cheap and homestyle.  I think the waitstaff is very attentive and does their best to speed things along, but the bottom line is the restaurant itself is tiny and so they're always at maximum capacity plus a line of people out the door.  Bring a newspaper and don't let the wait bring you down because the food is worth it.  FYIs: cash only and closes at 3pm
author: angela k.

description:
ah, chloe, you temptress.  you make me want to live in noe valley for the rest of my life. 

i understand that the chloe's reviews are a little all over the place.  i get it!  to truly understand chloe's, i have to look at it from two points of view:  the eryn that desperately want to be chloe's girlfriend, hang out with her on weekends and braid her hair, and the eryn that thinks waiting 1 1/2 hours for scrambled eggs is bullsh*t.

eryn, chloe's girlfriend:  oh, chloe's.... how do i love thee?
eryn, the pragmatist:      apparently enough to stand on the sidewalk for an hour in the freezing cold.

girlfriend:      chloe's, you are so cute and snuggly.
pragmatist:  and the size of my closet. seriously, are there more than 6 tables in this place?

gf:      i love their scrambled eggs.  they are seriously the best scrambled eggs i have ever had in my life.  every single time.  and on the weekends you can get a giant tasty muffin, too.
pm:   point taken, but they're just scrambled eggs.

gf:     oooh, and the banana walnut pancakes are a-MAZING.
pm:  yeah, the pancakes are pretty good.

gf:   and the cinnamon french toast?  the one that's made out of a croissant and then covered in deliciousness?  mmmmmm......
pm:  man, i love that french toast.  fine.  we'll wait an hour.  but this is the last time.  

gf:  you said that last time.
author: Eryn K.

description: Go to Toast or something.  Let me enjoy this without having to wait in line.  I want it all.  Period.  They cannot serve you while providing adequate service to me so you probably need to find a new place in baby valley to eat.
author: Will M.

description: Great breakfast place, banana walnut pancakes are great...Note: Be prepared to wait on weekends. Cozy seating is not for the socially phobic.
author: Russ C.

description: I hate to tell you this, because there is a good chance that you will be one of the people ahead of me on "the list", sitting on a warm piece of sidewalk, sipping  a cup of coffee from Martha and Bros.,  waiting for one of the small number of coveted tables to become available...but THIS PLACE ROCKS!   And although I have sampled and enjoyed most items on the menu at Chloe's, the egg scrambles are one of my reasons for living.  There are days when I simply  wouldn't have gotten out of bed, if it weren't for lure of the avocado and jarlsberg scramble, in my immediate future.  So go, support them, order whatever appeals to you, but if you could wait until after 1PM, that would be great, because by then I should just be ready to give you my table.
author: Amy A.

description: There's something so relaxing about sitting in the sun eating breakfast at Chloe's. Particularly if you're fortunate enough to skip the weekend crowds and hang out during the week. The menu is fairly minimal and hasn't changed in quite awhile, but they do have daily specials and everything is consistently good. The blueberry pancakes I had last week were scrumptious!
author: Chris R.

description: ummm, delicious. The hardest thing is deciding between pancakes or scrambled eggs.
author: Laela S.

description: Yum! I've been really disappointed by most breakfast joints in SF, but Chloe's Cafe was awesome! I had the cheddar and bacon scramble and it was amazing. Long lines, but that's to be expected for good breakfast grub. This place is worth the wait.
author: Bridget S.

description: Went on a Monday at 11am - zero wait. Huzzah for the unemployed! Between my friend and I, we had three dishes (yes, we were hungey) - all of which I would highly recommend: the croissant french toast with strawberries, the grilled brie and tomato sandwich, and the avocado and Jarlsberg cheese scramble. My whole wheat walnut toast was a little burnt, but otherwise everything was delicious. Service was quick and attentive.
author: T L.

description: I finally was able to suck it up and wait the long wait.  It was definitely worth it that time but I'm not sure I can handle that again.  The breakfast was perfect in my mind:  the scramble, fruit, wheat bread, and crossaint french toast I had was delicious...it covered all my favorite elements of breakfast.
author: Debbie Y.

description: Holy Jarlsberg Avocado scramble. I am an impatient kinda girl so I frequent Chloe's on the weekday or late on the weekends when the wait is not as long. My favorite breakfast spot in the city!
author: stephanie b.

description: Had a great brunch here today.  There were a lot of people waiting given it was noon on a Sunny San Francisco Sunday...but we got i after about 20 mins.  The Scrambled Eggs with Chedder, Onions, and Red Potatoes was really good, and they let us have coffee mugs out on the sidewalk while we were waiting - which made the wait much easier to bear.  All in all, it was a great brunch.  Glad to have a new brunch place in Noe/Mission.
author: Vivek A.

description: You look at the line outside and think: Really?  Yes, really.  Best brunch in the city, I say.  It's so hard to decide between the yummy scrambled egg dishes and the banana walnut pancakes. Little-known fact: you can sneak inside and get a cup of coffee to sip during your long wait.
author: Laurel N.

description: Cozy corner cafe with cozy food.  I ordered the pecan pancakes because my friend told me they were to kill for.   Yep, they were pretty damn good.   Gotta try the french toast next because I heard they were to decapitate for.
author: Larry A.

description: Cafe Chole has a lot of charm.  I hadn't eaten there in a few years until last friday - it was about 1/2 full and the service was fast and friendly.  I ordered the eggs with jarlsberg and mushrooms - was pretty good overall - my only complaint was that the home fries were burnt from being on the grill so long - this was dissapointing because I remember these were one of the highlights.  Could have just been because they were slow.  For some reason, the meal as not quite as good as I remembered it from a few years ago - I almost got the feeling it was under new ownership.  Overall though - it brought me back to a simplier time where you could people watch out the windows of a small, charming cafe.  I give it 4 stars for charm, but the food was just good, not great, so overall 3 stars.
author: Bradford A.

description: Some of the best pancakes I've ever had! I hate mushy pancakes, and these were actually crispy, which was perfect with the soft banana and crunchy nuts. I got the combo with scrambled eggs, which were soft and flavorful. I'll definitely go back!
author: Joy C.

description: You will sign up on the list.  Then you will wait.  And wait.  And wait.  I think it's worth it; many others disagree.  Some advice:  don't go with more than 2.  Just don't.  And make sure one of you has eggs and the other has pancakes.  You want both.  Trust me.  Because if you don't get both, you'll want to come back next weekend to try whatever you missed.  And then you'll just have to wait in line all over again.
author: Sheila W.

description: How can you, Chloe, day in, day out, year after year, so fully understand the tender scrambled egg, so clearly misunderstood by those other breakfast places? How can your bacon be so thin? Your carrot cake so juicy? Your mimosa so boozy? Cheers to Chloe's for never changing.
author: J. R.

description: I think this place is great! It's cute, it's a cozy atmosphere, great breakfast/brunch & reasonable prices. There is usually a wait...but it's not too bad, at least I dont think so...you're probably going to get a wait on a weekend for brunch @ a great place in SF....its what you have to expect. Otherwise you can go to Dennys ;) but I loved this place & can't wait to go again!
author: Kimberly R.

description: I love Chloe's and gained lots and lots of weight here during pregnancy.  The BLT's are to die for....now that I'm not pregnant however, I have had to cut it down to 1x per week.  The breakfasts and omelet specials are also pretty amazing.  The down side is the wait.....but it's also Noe Valley.
author: Nicole T.

description: Had the cinnamon french toast with strawberries and a side of scrambled eggs and bacon.  I will have that the next time and the next but maybe consider something else on the forth visit.  Nice small place that didn't feel cramped.  Chloe's and Toast are on my list for regular breaky stops.
author: Justin K.

description:
Great, small breakfast place in Noe Valley.  For 2 years I lived too close to Chloe's.  Often times I would roll out of bed, down the street and if the line was really long (like it usually is) I would put my name on the waiting list and head back up to my apt for a bit.

The only item that I've ordered, and the only item that I will order until I die, is the red potato, onion and cheese scrambled egg plate.  It's the best.  

Yes, as noted earlier, the line is long.  Yes, they only take cash.  And yes, their food is that good.
author: Ben O.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for a long while.  I should've gone sooner!  

I went on a weekday at lunchtime, a short wait for an outside table in the sun.  Service was friendly and very prompt.

The food was outstanding!  The scramble was delicious, loved the Rosemary bread, and the fruit was even perfect!  Great meal.
author: K V.

description: Chloe's is it. I've eaten a lot of brunch, stood in a lot of lines. Hungover and irritable. Yes, you have to wait here. Yes, if you look down at the white table while eating outside in the sun you may go blind. But. Rosemary sourdough toast. Best potatoes in the city. Nobody rolling their eyes because you only ever order sides. It's reliably good times.
author: Melissa G.

description:
Went for breakfast on a Sunday. Waited 35min.

Had scrambled eggs w/ bacon, tomato and jarlsberg; homefries; english muffin. Food was edible but not memorable. 

Coffee is good. Service was good.
author: christian x.

description: My experience here at Chloe's has always been wonderful. This is my boyfriend and I's breakfast spot whenever we come to visit San Francisco. Their coffee is the best. I love their specials. Their french toast is amazing. Their banana walnut or  banana pecan pancakes are amazing. The wait staff knows us so that feels nice. You can sit outside or inside. The place is small and the lines can get long, but it's definitely worth the wait.
author: Ivette F.

description:
very cute, very quaint, neighborhood feel. 

i had their special scramble - artichokes, onions, and your choice of cheese (feta tops my list).  it was delicious.  not your "i can make this at home" kind of good, but good.  their breakfast menu does not include benedicts, crepes, or omelettes, but their scrambles are scrumptious.

and $5.5 corkage = endless mimosas
author: Dee C.

description: This place is one of my favorite breakfast/brunch places to go in the bay area. I would put this place in my top 5 places to go for breakfast/brunch. I would recommend going here on a weekday because of the long wait, but is def worth the wait. Everything is good here it all depends on what you feel like. I always get the croissant french toast with strawberries with any of my main dishes. The fruits are very very fresh and good. The white rosemary toast is my favorite toast. Like I said everything here is good and fresh it all depends on what you feel like. I also like the venue and vibe you get here. Friendley good service and good old san francisco feel.
author: Jay S.

description:
There's obviously been an ownership change and the ambiance and food reflect it quite clearly to me.  This place has seen better days.

Today when I went for breakfast it smelled pretty foul with soiled upholstery, old food dirt under the dishwasher and in the grout lines, greasy menus, filthy windows, and substandard food.  The fixtures are all grimy, old and tired.  

You can't fool me into thinking this is still the same old Chloe's.
author: Franco L.

description: Chloe's is my favorite breakfast/ brunch spot in Noe Valley. Love the banana-walnut pancakes and scrambled eggs with feta. Add a latte and a spot on the sidewalk in the sun and I am set for the day!
author: Ayse K.

description: Mainly, this place is great because they cater to the wakefully challenged and stay open until 3:30 in the afternoon. Even better, JB and I dashed in all contrite and bleary-eyed -- this wakefully challenged stuff is tough business -- and they still served us. Yup, my karma points with the food service industry are in need of some atonement. Luckily, I will never have anything bad to say about Chloe's. The service is quick, the prices are reasonable, and the food tastes more fresh than any of the smug smiles on the legions of stroller/dog-walkers trawling around the Valley of Noe. I ate avocado and Jarlsberg cheese eggs, JB had ham and eggs, and I barely crammed in the excellent rosemary toast. Please don't take this as a recommendation to show up to all establishments seconds before closing, all right? That's bad news bears.
author: Kimberly V.

description: I rarely order pancakes when out for breakfast.  Most places serve tastless, doughy "buttermilk" discs.  Not so at Chloe's - the banana walnut pancakes are a welcome change and make a great weekend breakfast indulgence.  I would also recommend the daily special scramble.
author: darla s.

description: Loved the avocado and Jarlsburg scrambled eggs. So Yummy!
author: Margaret B.

description: Small space - fits a max of about 25 people! Great service. Excellent coffee. The eggs you get here will be either scrambles or omletes- the eggs can be a bit watery. Darn good home fries sprinkled with paprika goodness. Be ready to wait at least 30 mins on a Sunday.
author: Judy L.

description: I have to chime in with Laurel on this (and we've eaten more than a few brunches together at Chloe's) - possibly the best brunch in the city.  My favorite (and the words "food orgasm" come to mind) is the french toast with strawberries - and I don't even particularly like french toast. But they make it with croissants, and it's unspeakable good.  The eggs are wonderful too, especially the cheddar cheese and potatoe scramble. Unfortunately, there is usually a small village waiting to get inside from 8 am to 2pm on weekends.  But believe it or not, Chloe's is worth it.
author: Debbie A.

description: Too crowded on the weekend, but homey, and very  very good indeed. Probably the best in the Noe Valley area.
author: Risa F.

description: Chloe's is fine for a weekday brunch or lunch, especially on a gorgeous sunny day.  The wait isn't as excruciating as it is on a weekend, though you will probably have to put your name on the list at peak lunch hours.  I really like their greasy potatoes, but maaaan, what is up with the ketchup doled out in tiny serving dishes?!?  I ask for extra ketchup and it comes in yet another tiny serving dish.  And I ask again and...  I'm a card-carrying pinko liberal, but this ketchup rationing brings out the angry Red State mentality in me:  I'll have to say it is quite unamerican to deny upstanding, ketchup-loving members of society a full bottle of Heinz (ok, Heinz is blue-stateish) ketchup on the table.  Come to think of it, loooooong waits and getting your ketchup rationed makes me wonder if Chloe's is really Commie's (of the original Red State of USSR).
author: maiko h.

description: Great *little* breakfast place in Noe. I usually go on the weekdays as it's a good place for a breakfast meeting b/c it is usually not that crowded. I hear the wait on weekend mornings can be crowded. I usually have an egg dish the ham scamble is great and I LOVE the walnut wheat toast and the coffee is good. Sometimes I feel a little rushed, but for the most part it's good service. It's cash or check only, so if you are like me and only sometimes have cash, you'll have to plan ahead.
author: elizabeth s.

description: I went on a Sunday morning - had the Jarlsberg and Avocado omelette and a cup of coffee.  I guess I was expecting something amazing given the wait, but it was just good.  It's a solid 3 stars for quality ingredients, but it didn't blow me away .  . .
author: Amy C.

description:
It's been quite awhile since I've been here, it was around late '06, but I've always promised myself that I will come back...oh yes, I will come back. I can remember it was the perfect cure-all for what would possibly be the worst hangover of my life; sunnyside eggs, potatoes, toast, sausage, and coffee. Yes, your basic fare but brought up to level that is considered borderline upscale home cooking. I remember the potatoes were so good; petite red potatoes perfectly seasoned with less salt and more herbs.
My friend had the pancakes, and they were huge from what I remember. Filling...mmm, I'm craving some right now.
Wait wasn't too bad for a Saturday morning; we waited about 20-25 minutes, but my friend and I talked about the drunken debauchery the night prior. Biggest problem? I hated sitting so close to other people that it was impossible to not listen in on their conversations. What sucked was that we were stuck sitting next to 4 over privileged brats who just continued to complain about their food, and whether or not they should buy the Jimmy Choo or Manolo Blahnik.
author: Mary Ann S.

description:
went here for lunch - would not deal w/ the brunch lines.

food: better than expected. had a really good chicken apple sausage sandwich
service: fine, not awesome
decor: honestly, some of the ugliest tableclothes I've ever seen at a restaurant.

this place reminds me of EAT in the inner richmond.  unpretentious neighborhood joint.  good place to swing by for a quick bite, but it would be great if they stepped it up just a bit more, spruced the place up and tweaked the menu
author: James R.

description: The pancakes (banana walnut and pecan) are delicious! Thats about it...
author: Shawn G.

description: chloe's is never a let down.  a good solid option for breakfast or brunch, and the croissant french toast is delicious.  as well as the pancakes and the scrambles.  the staff has always been friendly and quick.  you can sit outside in the sun with your dog as well.
author: Kato S.

description: Nice cozy place to eat food was very delicious. The banana nut pancakes were the best would love to come back price was reasonable service was great only thing was that it was such a small place. But overall I recommend  this place. (way better than Denny's or I hop and about the same price.)
author: John B.

description: Love this place in Noe Valley. It's a clutch breakfast or lunch meeting place during the week. Weekends? I avoid it because the wait is so long. They use quality ingredients. The no-nonsense servers are friendly and accurate in taking your orders. The coffee's tasty. The bread is outstanding. The fruit is impeccably clean. Can't lose. I give it 4 stars because sometimes the wait kills me. And... the place could use a lil' makeover. Furniture's getting a bit grungy. Touch pricey, but depends what you order. Try the croissant french toast! And anything involving the rosemary bread.
author: Lorae K.

description: Yum!  I've waited an hour for their delicious egg salad sandwich and I'd happily do it again.  All of their ingredients taste fresh and wonderful.
