The cafe is adorable and quaint but I seriously can't figure out how they can offer so many options from a kitchen that looks SO small.  The place is itty bitty - where do they keep all the food?  It's like magic.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Chloe's Cafe is my absolute favorite breakfast restaurant that I have found in San Francisco to date. I first ate there about 2 months again and have probably been there 15 times since. The scrambles are all amazing - my favorite is the avocado and Jarlsberg. Make sure to try out the special pancakes too - last week they featured a pear & almond pancake that was absolutely amazing. Make sure to try the Swedish pancakes if those are on the menu. There menu is much more extensive but these are my favorites. 

The servers are always courteous, friendly and quick.  The spot is really amazing. The only issue is that they only accept cash - but it is well worth walking across the street to the ATM. It is so good  - I would pay them in whatever form they accepted!

Make sure to give Chloe's a try. I am headed there now for Sunday Brunch!
author: John W.

description: Friendly service and totally delicious. Only downsides = a little cramped and no high chairs, but great otherwise!
author: Ian M.

description: Easily the best brunch food in the city. I recommend going at lunchtime on a weekday. Not too bad of a wait at that time, but the delicious breakfast morsels make it worth the wait anyway. Mmm, cheddar and red potato scramble. Mmm, raspberry jam. Mmm, rosemary toast. Okay, if I'm drowning in my own saliva, Homer would have a freakin' fit here.
author: Michie L.

description: I love this place... but it is sooo TINY.  The egg scramle is delish.  Be prepared to wait a very long time, but well worth it since you can hangout on the sidewalk with coffee and paper in hand.
author: Annabel G.

description: A small, cozy place! Great food and love their omelets and pancakes! They serve you a pretty good serving and you leave feeling satisfied! Can't wait to go back and eat it up!
author: Mel P.

description:
great for basic brunch - fresh and clean.

there's a wait on the weekends.
author: Erika Y.

description: I don't get the hype about this place.  I have nothing against it, but the food simply is not good enough to justify the long lines on the weekends.   I can easily name five other places that have better brunch than this place, including Fattoush a few doors down.  Don't waste your time waiting in line here.
author: Sharyn F.

description: I like Chloe's Cafe - friendly staff and tasty breakfast. I enjoyed the avocado & Jarlsberg scramble with rosemary bread. Also had a mimosa and the coffee wasn't bad. It was refreshing to see unique breakfast items on the menu. Although there's a relatively long wait on weekends, I will definitely go back.
author: Iku R.

description: Actually very good breakfast food. But for some reason there is always a ridiculous wait. (Fine by me. It keeps the lines shorter at Toast...) If I could get a table right away, I'd probably give it five stars. But you will only get a table right away if you go very early in the morning. It really good, but just really isn't worth an hour-long wait, IMHO. Minus one star for either being too popular or having too few tables.
author: Jason Y.

description: I've been here for dinner and lunch and have NO complaints.  It is spectacular and the staff is so friendly.  It's small and charming.  Everything is fresh and perfect.  The wait can be long but its totally worth it.
author: Angela S.

description:
super cutesy cafe that is very "noe." sort of like noe meets paris, in fact. very church street. okay, you get the point. 

yes, there is often a wait. i went at 12:30 on a very sunny sunday recently and was pleasantly surprised to only wait 20 minutes. the food was delicious and fresh, loved the special. it was a scramble with sweet corn and verde salsa-type stuff, and tomatoes, and cheddar. cheddar makes everything better. mm. the toast and jam seemed homemade and the service was quick and attentive. 

i went with a friend but this seems like a great place to take your parents if they're visiting.
author: Marla W.

description:
Recently went here for brunch on a Sunday. Yes, there was a long line and a bit of a wait, but it didn't seem as bad as I thought it might be.
Lucky for us, it was sunny in SF this day, so we happily sat outside...yay!
We were quickly served by a really nice and friendly server. Food and bevs came quickly. I had the French Toast, and it was really really great. Mimosas were good too. Everyone else in my group also really enjoyed their meal. When we decided to linger a bit to chat (my friends were from out of town and only passing through) after we were finished eating, it was refreshing to not get any dirty looks or hints that we should 'move on' from our table, even though it would have been understandable if they had since there were still folks waiting in line to be seated.
Overall, it was a great experience. Decent prices. Oh, and a REALLY small bathroom that you have to walk through the kitchen to reach. There's nothing like washing your hands next to the guy who's making someone's scrambled eggs.....ha!
author: Rebecca W.

description: This restaurant was great.  The salad was awesome and huge.  I had to wait approximately an hour to get a table, but there are a ton of cute shops around and you can just put you name on the list, leave and come back later.
author: Joanna S.

description: I heart Chloe's.  Hands down my favorite brunch place in the city.  The scrambles are top knotch and the rasberry jam is soooo good.  Also, the lunches are pretty good too.  They aren't open for dinner, so go early!
author: Chris W J.

description:
i love this place. 
they have the best homefries in the city. hands down. 
good fr breakfast, brunch or lunch. one of my favorites.
fresh ingredients, lots of jarlsberg, french toast made of croissants and rosemary toast... just to give you an idea of the fabulous menu. if you have the luxury of going to breakfast or lunch on a weekday do it because on the weekends you'll have to wait. worth it though.
author: Sole A.

description: Don't believe the hype! Chloes is a mediocre at best.  The food tastes okay.  It's just your average breakfast place with nothing exciting, plus the line is ridiculous. Definitely not worth the food. I have been there twice, and have not been disappointed but I have definitely not been impressed. If you want to treat your palate to an amazing brunch, walk down a few blocks to Pomelo on church.
author: Javier B.

description: Although I do like the food at Chloe's a lot, I don't go there very often because there's always a wait. It is wee-tiny and a bit crowded. Eggs are excellent though; I thoroughly approve of eggs scrambled with cream cheese and vegetables. The pancakes are pretty good, too.
author: Heather R.

description:
This place is the best brunch place in Noe Valley.  The menu is limited, but most of the food is pretty damn good.  I haven't tried anything bad yet.  The only bad thing is the wait is so long.  

BTW, the croissant french toast is too die for.
author: Elisa W.

description: Sometimes you want the fancy smancy brunch - arty food, trendy scene - think Universal Cafe or Foreign Cinema. But if what you want is brunch, pure and simple - Chloe's in the best of the best in SF.  The owner is quite nice, despite the incessant lines on weekends. I also have noticed that Chloe's has almost supernaturally huge strawberries no matter what season. My recommendation is to put your name down at Chloe's, then walk down to Martha's for a cup of coffee, by the time you get back, your table at Chloe's will be ready!
author: chloe w.

description: Great brunch spot!  The food is amazing--I usually get some egg dish with a croissant (yum).  I love how fresh everything is.  Something here for everyone.  The wait can be a pain though, plan to come early (9ish) or late (after noon) if you are not super patient.
author: Amy G.

description:
cute little place in noe valley to get all of your traditional american breakfast fare.  from the simple eggs and home fries to the plate of french toast piled high with strawberries, one isn't likely to be disappointed with the options.  they serve lunch here as well, but i've only been there for breakfast, so i can't comment on the former.

my only complaint is that the place is rather small.  of course, this makes the wait for a table on a weekend morning a bit annoying and, if it's cold out, you'd better hope you don't get one of the tables by the door.  all of the ins and outs makes for a somewhat chilly experience.
author: guy m.

description: The food is worth 5 stars but the price brings the review down to 4 stars. The food IS delish, but overpriced for what ou get. If I am gonna pay 15 bucks for an omlet it better not just be good, but big enough for me to take home half! Having said that, pretty much everything on the menu here is really really good. Plus, it's a charming place, especially on a warm day when you can sit outside! One thing to be warned about, they won't seat you until your whole party is there so make sure you all arrive on time! I have been bitten in the behind and lost several a table because of this rule!
author: Tara T.

description: A quaint Noe Valley place with a great breakfast. The whole wheat walnut toast is a must!
author: Micki S.

description: Generally speaking, small place=high quality, and Chloe's only reinforces this theory.  Weekends are almost off limits, unless you don't mind camping out, but any rare weekday I have free will usually start with grubb that has me licking the plate for more
author: Eagan I.

description: Best brunch dish is the scramble with cheese potatoes and onions. Sometimes their scrambles just lack flavor. Also wish they would use egg whites.
author: Latte Queen W.

description: Excellent diner food! Quality ingredients. My first choice for breakfast/brunch in Noe. Thankfully I live a couple of blocks away, so I can go during the week. Unfortunately, you will face long waits on weekends.
author: Lee S.

description: Bacon, tomato, avocado scramble + Croissant = pure breakfast heaven.  This is the most american feeling breakfast place I've been to in the city and I love love love it.  There is usually a wait of around 30 minutes on the weekends, but they keep a clipboard outside to sign up.  The place is very small, so on hot days it is rather hot inside.  Especially the seat right next to the chalkboard, it is right next to kitchen and it gets even warmer.  Maybe I was imagining things, but I avoid that table now anyway.
author: Russell R.

description: Chloe's has been doing the same thing very well for a long time.   Yes, their breakfasts are great, the best scrambled eggs in SF.  I mean, I didn't know you could make scrambled eggs this good.   For years I just ordered the ham, Jarlsberg, and roasted red pepper on a croissant, and then one day I finally had the scrambled eggs and felt stupid for waiting so long to do so.  Yummy pancakes and specials too.  But it's not worth the wait on the weekends, because you're just going to end up hungry and frustrated.  I drive by and see the dozens of people waiting for a table on Sunday brunch and yell out my car window, "It's not THAT good!."    And don't lollygag at the tables reading your newspaper while groups are standing around waiting to eat!  Yes Chloe's is a great option for breakfast during thew week, but not really worth the wait on the weekends.
author: Big Toe ..

description: its really tough to beat chloe's for breakfast, especially their croissant french toast.  get it with bananas instead of strawberries and its even better.  SO worth the wait - their eggs are delicious as well.  sometimes we'll go into work late on a weekday just so we can eat here and avoid the weekend crowds - its teeny inside, but they move people though quickly - don't forget its cash only!
author: Erin C.

description:
I've been coming here for....get this....11 years. God. How did this happen to me? I used to live somewhere far far away (Fisherman's Wharf) and drove all the way across town to eat here. The wait wasn't as bad back then as it is today. Sigh.

Anyhow....I love it here. The wait is hopelessly annoying but the food is fantastically freshie! The menu has not changed in all this time. Well, except the prices have gone up. The tablecloths have changed too. Oh wait! They got new chairs too.

I love the food. Love it. Mmm....Hello food! "Breakfast served all day" are four of the best words in the world.

So, bring a book and eat like a pig. Oh, one more thing, eat fast and get out of there so I can have a seat. Thanks.
author: Tracy Y.

description: This place already has a ton of good reviews but i just wanted to chime in as well. Great food. Nice sunny spot. I actually like that they only take cash.  Iam not a big fan of the ATM/credit card society.  The scramble special was great and the tuna salad was awesome.
author: Dave B.

description: The wait can be long, yes, but that's just the way it is, I guess. So far, this is the best breakfast I've had in SF--and one of the best breakfasts I've had pretty much anywhere. Very close to perfect.
author: Michael S.

description: One of my all-time favorite places to eat in SF! Good food, great coffee, wonderful atmosphere and friendly wait staff.  When I lived in the neighborhood I ate there so often that now when I get to visit it's like coming home.
author: Fred C.

description: Best little brunch place in Noe...oh man, can they scramble. Get's super busy at peak brunch times, so skip work and go during the day...it's worth it. If you are too embarassed to ask, the bathroom is at the back, through the kitchen.
author: Casey R.

description: Please don't go to Chloe's on the weekends. I don't need more people waiting ahead of me. This has to be one of my most favorite places to go for breakfast. Why do I love Chloe's? The coffee is strong and my cup is refilled often. Great overall service. Two words --- Real Orange Juice. OK, I know that's three, but it's worth three words. I love, love, love the Banana Walnut Pancakes! The Croissant French Toast with strawberries (in season of course) is to die for! If you ask real nice, they will put bananas on it instead. Just don't tell anyone that I told you. They have daily scrambles with your choice of cheese. My very favorite is the Cheddar, Red Onion and Potato scramble from the regular menu. The potatoes...let me just take a moment. Sigh...
author: KM R.

description:
My impression of this place may be totally different, since it was the first restaurant I ate at after moving to San Francisco last week, and there was no line; it was a weekday morning, so the restaurant was totally empty.  I guess that makes my review a bit more impartial, since the place wasn't really hyped up to me by anyone and there was no queue of folks milling about to indicate that this is some sort of institution...though now I guess I can see why it is.

I'm a pretty basic guy when it comes to breakfast, I just got the scrambled eggs and toast.  Even though that sort of breakfast may seem like a commodity to most people, Chloe's managed to impress me with its quality.  Maybe just a couple minutes after ordering (seriously, the service is so fast), I was presented with perfectly done scrambled eggs (not too runny, not too dry), a delicious slab of wheat toast, some delicious jam, and high quality butter to top it all off.  I chose the fruit salad as my side, and was glad I did.  The fruit was fresh and delicious.

As far as ambiance goes, I agree with most, it feels quaint inside.  There were a couple small tables out on the sidewalk, but those were full when I arrived.  After sitting down and scoping it out, I felt as if I'd discovered some under-appreciated gem of a place in my new neighborhood.  Of course, now I see that tons of people go here all the time and I don't get to enjoy that sense of pride that comes along with being "in" on something.  Nevertheless, that false sense of discovery would never have come into being if the restaurant didn't have an unassuming and charming air about it.
author: Jim G.

description: Chloe's has become a tradition. The best pancakes you will ever taste, scrambeled eggs with ham & harlsberg cheese, chicken-apple sausage, home fries, rosemary white toast, and coffee. The above items are so incredible we order the same thing every time. The only major bummer is the wait. If you do not come at 8AM on a Saturday or Sunday morning expect to wait. But believe me it is worth every minute!
author: Adam S.

description: Best Breakfast Ever. period.  Delicious warm trout on rosemary bread & jarlsberg / ham on croissant sandwich for lunch.  This is our favorite brunch spot in San Francisco.  Truly unique, sweet & the staff remembers  you!  We've been coming here for 10 years & always bring our out-of-town gets.  Don't believe the naysayers...
author: Jenny R.

description: I live in the neighborhood and have always enjoyed my breakfast.  Good coffee and love the Cinnamon french toast with strawberries!
author: Tammy W.

description: Sadly, I had a very bad experience at Chloe's.  I know that showing up to Sunday brunch with 6 people and a dog does not make it easy to facilitate, but the folks at Chloe's made it (literally) impossible.  After a long wait, extremely poor table management and very rude treatment from the staff, we ended up going somewhere else altogether to eat. I will never come back here again.
author: marisa r.

description: It's nice to find someplace that is somewhat creative when it comes to breakfast. Nearly everywhere, whether a greasy spoon or a fancy hotel, it's eggs fried, poached (benedict), omeleted or scrambled, accompanied by some fried meat, and some starch toasted (white, wheat, bagel,or biscuit if you're lucky) Chloe's has very creative specials (yes, Steve F, mostly scrambled. It's hard to be creative with 2 eggs over easy.) I agree with Laurel and Debbie. Worth the wait. I work evenings so I made it a project to find the best breakfast dining experience. I still have a few places to check out, but Chloe's is champion so far (for 4 years now). And the chedder and red potato scramble is my favorite. And the fruit is ALWAYS perfectly ripe. Also brisk, friendly, good service and very nice, clean environment. No credit cards....they only take cash.
author: Rellsky S.

description: Three stars for the food, which is good, pretty standard California breakfast fare, one extra star because the place is so cute, really pleasant to sit in on a sunny sunday morning/afternoon and because the wait staff is really friendly despite the insanity. The walnut toast is warm and crunchy, my eggs with avocado and cheese were delicious and perfectly cooked and my dining companion liked his smoked trout sandwich. We waited about 20 mins on a Sunday early afternoon but it's not an unpleasant corner to sit at and watch the Noe stroller/small dog scene on a nice day. Most important thing to remember, bring cash! As far as I know they don't take cards.
author: Liboo K.

description:
I guess I'm just pickier than everyone else.

When I moved to the hood, I saw this place and knew it would be my Sunday morning kitchen....except I don't have to wait an hour in my kitchen and even I could make better omelettes (which is pretty sad). How do you make a bad omelette I'd like to know?

Hit Toast or Fattoush or just stay home.... it's pretty overrated.
author: Alex H.

description: A nice, quaint, clean little gem hidden in the residential part of Church street. I love going here with friends whenever I need a pancake fix. The service is good and friendly with people who check up on you and refill your water. I love the many ways they make scrambled eggs. On a good day, I would sit outside and enjoy. Expect a wait though on weekends, but when you taste the food, you won't mind it.
author: Bobzilla D.

description: Truly great brunch food. The brie on croissant sandwhich is sinfully delicious. On sunny weekends, the lucky can grab an outside table (after the hour wait). They recently extended their hours, which was needed. For those with flexible hours, definitely hit this place during the week!
author: Emmy B.

description:
A friend recently introduced me to this place and I was impressed. I went on a Monday so we (luckily) did not have to wait for a table. It was a beautiful sunny day, so the outside tables were perfect.   I also thought the waitstaff was great, no problems here.

I got the special (egg scramble with onions, feta, mushrooms, and spinach) and loved it.  The chicken apple sausage was yummy as well.  I was not all that impressed with the cappucino, but oh well.  The portions were generous so I left a happy Iady.  I will be heading back soon and after all the reviews for the french toast and pancakes, I will be ordering that next time.
author: Lara F.

description: I loved salmon scramble egg.  My friend's pancake also looked so delicious.  I can't wait to go back there.
author: Akiko O.

description: So went here on a Sunday morning early because I heard the wait was horrid...proved to be true, so don't go there starving thinking you're going to get seated on a weekend in less than an hour. But, alas, the wait was well worth it.  The service was pretty fast and the food was incredible!  No joke, likely the best pancakes I've had in a long time.  So, if you're down for a wait and not too hungry in the moment, a great place for sunday brunch. plus, parking is pretty easy around there.
author: Tamara B.

description:
The food is great. The service is even better.

The atmosphere suffers from the incessant squeaking of the toaster and the smell of burnt toast.

Silence the toaster and improve the ventilation and it gets another star.

Stopped by today and was greeted with......no squeaking toaster. Am told it is in the shop getting fixed and they have a loaner.

No burnt toast smoke to breath either.

A few more visits like this and I'd give em another star.

Service still quite good.
author: richard j.

description: The thing that sticks with me the most about eating breakfast here is that the second the steam dissipated from my coffee they were there to bring back the heat. I like my coffee pipin' hot and black, therefore the frequent refill won't mess up some delicate balance of sugar and cream. It's supposed to be breakfast not science. The service was fantastic and the breakfast was great. This cafe has a very traditional feel to it both with the decor and the menu. The menu may be my only complaint, it needs to be updated just so it can stand out more from the other breakfast eateries. Maybe a signature dish perhaps? We both had scrambles and left happy. The scrambles come with your choice of toasts, home fries, and or fruit cup. I hate to spoil surprises but the toast came with a cup of black raspberry jelly that would tempt me to return. That's right a trip just for jelly and toast, and I'm not even British.
author: Bucky K.

description:
This place is FLITHY DIRTY................. we checked it out on
7/29/2008... n it was so disgustingly dirty.. we had the sad privilege
of sitting right near the kitchen where you could see
EVERYTHING........ omg..... we happened to glance over to where the
garbage can was n it appears to not have been cleaned in eons.. slime on the wall next to it where all the times someone missed the can n hit the wall 
not to mention the food itself was crap, unless you like stale bagels which is what I go.. clearly it was a day or two old, but I am not even going to get into the food aspectt because this place is too damn dirty to even consider it a proper food joint... it's disgusting. even the outside needs to be hosed down... (although, Noe Valley in general could use some cleaning up n hosing down) with all the dogs they have over there.. 
in a way, this place kinda fits in... hey Chloe's n Noe Valley  clean up your  act, The Tenderloin is starting to look cleaner than your streets n some of your restaurants.............
author: Girl N.

description: we've driven by a gazillion times and seen the line.  I'm too old to wait in line for breakfast. However, we drove by yesterday (sat at 2p) and with no line, we decided it was time.  I understand now why the place draws a crowd. quality food, generous portions.  i had the salmon scramble with whole wheat walnut bread (so good) and home fries that were nicely seasoned (i'm not typically a big home fries fan).  my bf had the small croissant french toast (also delicious) and we also tried a single fresh corn pancake which was one of the specials.  also delish . very good coffee too, and good service.
author: Steve S.

description: i was craving brunch in the city the other day, so a gf and i decided to check this place out. its an extremely cozy restaurant with limited seating...we opted for indoor so it was a good 15 min wait. the food was rather simplistic but flavorful with large hearty portions. its definitely a cute place to grab a bite if you're hungry and in the area.
author: Myra C.

description: brunch is awesome and so is the area it's located in Noe.  Sit outside on a nice day to enjoy the great food and watch the moms race their strollers.  Wait can be long toward brunch time, but not any longer than Zazie's.  Must try.
author: Kaleena S.

description: Chloe's is a magic asset for our neighborhood.  How great to have such a reliably hospitable, wonderful breakfast place just waiting there, around the corner!  We're so lucky in Noe Valley!
author: John K.

description: Had a wonderful scramble with avocados mixed in. Sat outside and enjoyed the morning.  Service was a tiny bit slow, but the meals were fabulous, especially the tomato brie crescent.
author: Jonathan W.

description: they're now open fri-sun until 8pm! yes this is good news so now i don't have to rush out of bed on Sunday mornings! =P
author: Lola L.

description: Chloe's is all about ambiance and neighborhood charm. Located in what I want to say "disgustingly cute" (without offending anyone, since I absolutely adore the area) Noe Valley, this small and homey breakfast spot was my destination of choice on a cold and foggy Sunday. While the cafe has outdoor seating options, given the dubious weather, we opted to sit inside and were immediately attended to by a friendly waitress (9 am mind you, with no wait). I ordered the soy latte, served piping hot in a tall glass with extra foam and topped with ground cinnamon. While it was hard to decide between the mouthwateringly delicious sounding menu options, I ended up going for the cinnamon croissant french toast served with a plethora of strawberries. The french toast was thinly sliced croissant dough, dipped lightly in batter and grilled. The end product was fluffy and mildly sweet, not as fried and rich as the french toast served at Dottie's but equally as good. In fact, I might even prefer this french toast as it did not leave me feeling overly stuffed and bloated, like my meal at the aforementioned breakfast joint.  The reason I am docking a star here, is due to the fact that we were asked to leave before we were done talking. I suppose they are busy, and when finished, want to turn the table over to a new customer, however I felt this was a bit rude, and detracted from my overall experience at this quaint cafe.
author: Kate A.

description: chloe's is cute- but not that cute.  the food is fine.  nothing special, and the menu isn't very extensive.  and i agree, the people watching is fantastic, but the wait... the wait just isn't worth it.
author: Samantha W.

description: My friend Rich took me here after not being in this part of town where I grew up for quite sometime. First off, the service in the beginning was great. Although it wasn't too packed when we went there, I expected the server's jedi powers to be at full force but unfortunately for him, I had to wave him down twice for a refill on my coffee cup which isn't a good sign especially when there's only like 12 people in the place. Let's go straight to my fave plate which was the Pecan Pancakes....! Damn, Mrs' Butterworth's better hold her bonnet from flying off because these things were soooooo good...!!!! And there's chicken apple sausage & egg scramble was insane beyond words. Go to this place if you haven't. You just might need a freeway ad to get the servers attention that say's, Stop, I want a refill dude...All in all, a wonderful place for breakfast foodies imports who like a good morning breakfast..!!!
author: Sven S.

description:
this is my favorite breakfast place of all times!!
i dont even like breakfast or breakfast foods and have never really been impressed with any breakfast places. its always greasy and buttery and i hate eggs! but chloes has changed my mind for good. i have never had a bad meal and i eat there all the time. the potato and cheddar scramble is delish! the garden salad with the vinaigrette is amazing! and the buttermilk pancakes are to die for.
it def gets packed there and now that they got a write up in sf weekly there is for sure more people that know about it. but it is so worth the wait. the service is great and the food come out fast. and chole is charming. this place is the best!
author: B B.

description:
we went on a weekday and we were glad we did, for there was no waiting list, no lines. the place is really a small-scale brkfst/lunch joint with approx 10 tables. toilet is so limited in space, that they have the hand wash station outside. albeit the undersized capacity of this place, food portions are quite ample. their red potatoes scrambled eggs were not greasy, buttermilk pancakes were delicious and it has a hint of lemon zest to it, homefries were also palatable and they have  good breads to offer, such as whole wheat walnut and white rosemary breads. moreover, their small bowl of fruit was well presented in a clear dessert cup, that you could nicely see the appealing combinations of s'berry, bananas, honeydews and cantaloupes. ketchup were served in little sauce dishes, that's why no ketchup bottles were present on the tables and of course, there was not enough space to put condiments on their  tiny tables as well. 
it's not my place to frequent for brunch, because of the long wait and limited space.
author: Nelle A.

description: sorry, but why does everyone love this place so much? i see it as a cute place, with a mile-long wait out the door, with mediocre breakfast. you'd be much better off cooking in and lounging on the couch, or just going for a walk with bagel and coffee in hand. or, well, anything but waiting in that line...
author: beth l.

description: i love chloe's.. it is true you wait on the weekends (for awhile),  but there is a reason-  yummy fresh food and great service too. once you sit down you'll eat in no time.
author: miss m.

description:
The best thing I can say is that the food was OK. Not great but edible.

There were 5 people in our group. After waiting a long time for a table, we sat down, waited for our server to come to our table and ordered. 4 of us got our order at the same time, but the 5th person's order of pancakes and eggs (nothing fancy!) got lost somewhere along the way. He asked our server and about 10 minutes later the pancakes came. 5 minutes after that he was able to get the server's attention again (no small feat) and asked about the eggs which were finally served 5-10 minutes later. By this time the rest of us were finished with our meal. About 5 minutes after the eggs came out our server approached the table for the first time without being asked. "Excuse me," he said. And we all felt a little better for a second because we thought he was going to apologize for the bad service and order mix-up. Instead he said, "Could you guy please leave? There are people waiting for tables and you've been here for a while."
I won't be returning to Chloe's.
author: dissipatedfog ..

description: I don't understand the hype for this place. Maybe some people don't mind a dirty water pitcher or filthy creamer or the odor. Definitely not worth waiting for.
author: ann l.

description: only problem with chloe's is that it's too small; often you'll have to wait even if you get there early (or late). other than that, this place is one tasty morsel. really good breakfast specials...though i often defer to the red potato, cheddar, and onion scramble...add avacado. tasty. oj is super fresh too. if your wait has spanned into lunchtime, they have some nice sandwiches, including a great sausage sandwich. my fave tho: the BLTA served on their rosemary toast. yummers!
author: dusty d.

description: Best breakfast I've had in S.F., and I am a HUGE fan of breakfast.  Absolutely worth the wait, which was ridiculous (45 minutes or so).  Key selling point #1 - real maple syrup.  If you are a fan of real maple syrup, this statement needs no explanation.  For this reason alone I would forgo nearly every other breakfast place in the city.  Selling point #2 - the cinnamon french toast.  So delicious I kind of felt like Sally in the diner in When Harry Met Sally.  Selling point #3 - mimosas.  It's hardly brunch without them, Chloe's has them, and they're damn good.  Selling point #4 - the food altogether.  Everything we ate was amazing.  Great eggs, fabulous breakfast potatoes, real hearty whole wheat bread.  From start to finish and everywhere in between Chloe's is THE place to have breakfast in the city.  But you're not going to be the only one with the idea, and the place is tiny, so, come prepared for a wait.  This place reminded me of the old Heinz ketchup commercial.  "Good things come to those who wait."
author: Sivan B.

description: the cinnamon croissant french toast is so damn good. i will be back to see you again, my love! i'll bring my boyfriend, cause he loves french toast. i'm willing to risk that he'll leave me for your goodness but who wouldn't want to leave a woman of awesomeness for something much more valuable?....something that could bring joy for a lifetime
author: Regina C.

description: Eh, not worth the wait. Not bad food, just not good enough to justify the weekend lines. If you don't have to wait for a table, it is worth a try.
author: jon p.

description: went here for brunch last sunday... it was a nice field trip for us into suburbia. of course, we forgot, and kept talking about our usual stuff, and a couple waiting near us had to wheel their toddler baby away in case we killed his/her innocence...  we had about a 40 minute wait, and it was sooo windy.  marcus had to go across the street to the convenience store for a snack it took so long... we got there around 130ish maybe. they do have outdoor tables but the people sitting there had their stuff blowing around and after a while no one would sit there. too cold. anyway, once we got in, it was mmmm. 3 of us had the cinnamon croissant french toast with strawberries and apple sausage. YUM it was the best breakfast ive bad in i cant even remember. the only reason it doesnt get 4 stars was the wait. the other 2 had scrambles - red potato and hmm i forget. i was so into my french toast. but they liked theirs too. the lemonade was just eh.  they do sell sparkling apple juice which jesse loved. this place is cash only but we knew that ahead of time so we were ok. other yummy looking items were on the menu as well, for those of you that don't like french toast. :)  Oh, and i do not think it was overpriced at all... it was usual brunch price. i think we paid about $16 each which is normal.  i guess it depends on your point of view.
author: Merredith L.

description: nothing exciting here. typical breakfast food. scrambled eggs were fine. pancakes with strawberries were fine. bacon was nice clean and crisp. too many other places to try first before going back for me. nothing that would bring me immediately back here.
author: james h.

description: i think the food at chloe's is pretty lousy.  it is also texture challenged.  things seem generally squishy, bland or pale.  there are also intensely, disneyland long lines.
author: Kenya l.

description: Good food, but the inside is pretty tiny and there's a good wait involved. I agree with the other Yelper who said it can feel cramped.
author: suz q.

description: The bagels we had on sunday just didnt cut it for me.. i was in some serious need of protein and salt when I happened to come across this place on an early sunday morning after my 8am call time for a film shoot. Their scrambled eggs saved me from passing out on set. It had fresh corn, avocados, jarlsberg cheese, tomatoes and mushrooms..... YUM. i got attacked by a bunch of starving grip guys when they saw me eating it and THEY loved it too :-D the cafe is a bit small, so if i lived in the area I would most likely just go for take out. At 10am  there were about 15 people standing outside waiting to be seated. oh the reason why i cant give it 5 stars is because their bathroom is super small. the space between the door and the toilet bowl does not give us ladies room to squat. it was as small as an airplane WC, but without the sink (you have to use the kitchen sink) and no mirror either. but judging on food alone... it was FAST (waited only 3 minutes for take-out) and very good.
author: Marina K.

description: so much goodness packed into such a tiny space!  today was my first visit to chloe's so i'm almost glad that liberty cafe in bernal was closed for remodeling or else who knows when i would have made it over to chloe's.  not a huge breakfast menu BUT lots of very yummy sounding options.  i had a tough time deciding, but went with the pancake/egg combo.  oh man, i was not disappointed, not one bit.  first the pancakes.  i got the banana walnut (i'm usually anti-walnut but was feeling adventurous today)... they were super moist, not too walnutty (i just made that up) and extremely delicious.  second, the eggs.  PERFECT and believe me, perfect scrambled eggs are really hard to do.  i know, there's already a zillion rave reviews, but here's one more.  definitely worth the wait.
author: Yvette H.

description: the chloe's salad is the best in the city w/o a doubt! breakfast has always been great! maybe even a little too much food! i can never finish the heaping mound on my plate. the only complaint is there is ALWAYS a wait b/c it's popular and its quite small. the other little pet peeve of mine is that my toast is never actually toast. its called toast but its just warmed bread. i relish in the CRUNCH of toast and need the crunch!!!!! other than that, this place rocks and i frequent it on a weekly basis.
author: nicole d.

description: the wait for brunch is worth it, but try and go on a weekday if you can. the homemade jam/jelly whatever is excellent.  sit outside so you can view the dog show that parades by on a sunday.
author: Robert S.

description: This is really one of only a few destination breakfast places left in the City. Under normal circumstances I am not even up for breakfast most weekend mornings and I am even less inclined to make an event out of it by driving to the outskirts of Noe Valley. Chloe's though has become an exception to this rule. The food is phenomenal, especially the croissant french toast and their blueberry muffins! Best part is its cheap! Service is just okay, mostly because they usually have at the most two servers working at a time with one busser. Problems also include parking, lack of seating and the fact that they don't take credit cards?! They do try to turn tables quickly but be prepared to wait forty minutes at busy weekend times for a table. Don't bother bringing more than three friends with you because this place just can't handle parties bigger than that. Be sure to take advantage of the limited outdoor seating on those rare nice San Francisco mornings we all love so much!
author: Ryan M.

description: there was 4 of us and we all liked what we got, absolutely nothing wrong, just nothing extraordinary ( i save 5 stars for places i would eat at every day of the week). It was good, service was good, sitting outside in the sunshine was nice, cash only i think will go back
author: ORLA L.

description: Best pancakes around !  Also, they have fresh scrambles and great home fries (or fresh fruit).   I hadn't been here in awhile due to it's popularity, very small size, and long wait on the weekends, but now that it's summer, if you can go on the weekdays, it's not bad at all.  Their sandwiches and salads are good too!
author: J T.

description: Great home style food. The place is very small. There is usually a wait on the weekends. Best to come early. Not cheap but high quality food.  Have only had weekend breakfast here. Pleasant service.
author: Bob J.

description: Solid brunch -- small menu, but the specials tend to be creative and good.
author: Tom S.

description: Chloes is my all time favorite breakfast place!!!! It has everything you would want on a breakfast menu....From the Jarlsberg avocado scramble to the croissant french toast...It is a must....My only advice to you is to go on a random day of the week because it gets crazy on the weekends......The service is great and it is consistently amazing...Oh, one more thing all their bread is from Il Fornaio which is just a little added bonus...LOVE IT!!!!
author: Nadia L.

description: my sandwich had the texture of a sloppy turd.... no structure! why yall like dis place? whyyyyyyy???whyyyy? ew..gross... why??
author: Courtney B.

description: i went here for the first time the other day. my amigo read about it online somewhere and he said that many people were saying it was the best breakfast in san francisco--i cant complain with that! anyways, it was really good. food was great, they kept my coffee full, and the place is so cute. very quaint.
author: Vanessa M.

description: i must say i Loved the breakfast.. i have only been there twice now and both times i came around 2:20 and there was no wait.. we sat out side, which was perfect with this heat wave were having... i have the ham, avocado and cheese scrambled eggs!!! so freaking good!!! the boo had the onion, red potatoe and cheese scrambler and he loved it!!! i took off one star only because they never refill your water.. but the waitstaff is very nice and friendly..
author: Shauna P.

description: I know the problem is the long wait, but they have a nice breakfast combo and I like it. Egg dishes are particularly good. They look simple, but it is very difficult to reach that level of accomplishment. This is one of the best restaurant for them. The staff is always very nice, too.
author: Charlie S.

description: avo/swiss scrambler is amazeballs.
author: Olivia G.

description: Two years of living nearby and I had been to Chloe's exactly zero times, until this week when I went twice for lunch.  Twice!!  The food was ok.  I liked the Chloe's salad, but the sandwich and soup I had the second time were nothing remarkable.  The crazy thing about this place is the long wait!  Even on a weekday, we waited about 30 minutes the first time, 15 the second to be seated, and the food is just not good enough that I would consider waiting an hour or more on a weekend.
author: Jessica T.

description: The breakfast food is fantastic, especially the pancakes, which are as pancakes should be: lightly browned on the outside, fluffy on the inside. Besides the food, the setting makes for a very nice breakfast or brunch experience overall, and that's what gets Chloe's an extra half-star from me. And the wait isn't bad if you just want a table for two.
author: A. T.

description: Love the scrambles, (especially avocado-jarlsberg).  The banana-walnut pancakes are good (but usually too heavy for me). Coffee is good.  Obviously the wait is long, so plan to do something else for about 30 minutes.
author: Brendan R.

description: I really don't understand what all the fuss is about. I used to go by every weekend and see people crowded outside waiting for a table at Chloe's, and I thought it must be the best brunch place since the invention of brunch. When I finally went there myself, on a weekday morning (working from home = no wait for brunch!), I found it just OK. The food was fine, no complaints, but it was about what you'd get at an above-average diner. Definitely not worth the wait on a weekend.
author: Hilary R.

description: Everybody knows Chloe's is awesome.  Nice clean food at reasonable prices.  They would get 5 stars if : a. they took credit cards (girl never has cash) b. they had more places to sit.
author: Lux P.

description: I confess, I fail to see this place's charm. It's pleasant enough, the staff is reasonably friendly and the food is edible, but it didn't bowl me over. The wait was way too long, the space was noisy and cramped, and the broom closet bathroom - with sink right next to the food prep area no less - looks like a code violation waiting to happen.
author: Rick A.

description: I love Chloes.  Although to avoid lines I go there early (8am) when I can always get seated and the coffee is fresh.  I like the simplicity of the menu (always scrambled, no special orders) because the food comes out quickly and piping hot.  Bread is from Il Fornaio so you can't go wrong.  And I have always found the service to be friendly, attentive and professional.  Kid and dog friendly just like the neighborhood.  This place has long standing loyalty among its regulars like me!
author: L A.

description:
Why go to Chloe's when there is a huge line? Is it that special?  No place with long brunch lines in SF is special enough to justify the long lines.  It's just some strange SF habit we have.  I don't go unless I motivated early (pre-10:00) or happen to be around on a weekday.
That said, the reason why Chloe's is better than your average long-line spot is because they cook their eggs properly. For some people, like me, this is a huge plus. Others care way less about how their eggs are cooked, and this will make Chloe's seem less special to you.  Chloe's serves perfectly scrambled eggs.  Glossy and moist, not dry, overcooked or (yikes) browned.  
I highly recommend getting cream cheese in your eggs. It's heaven. I highly recommend the wheat toast.  It goes well with their jam. Their fruit cup is fresh fruit.  The banana walnut pancakes are spectacular, and this is coming from an egg girl.  It's basically mounds of melted banana and walnut chunks bound together with the pancake batter, so you don't walk away feeling like you ate a box of Bisquick.  (They are huge, though, so I'd suggest a short stack.)  Coffee is eh, just get it because it goes well with your breakfast.
author: C G.

description: This place is delicious. They have really yummy omlettes (my favorite is the potato/cheddar). And what more could you want with breakfast than a croissant (that doesn't cost you an extra $2).  There's usually a wait, but it's well worth it.
author: Karen B.

description:
Ok this has got to be the worst breakfast spot in the city. I don't understand why people wait so long to eat such less than mediocre breakfast. So first of all I ask to not have cheese on my scramble and they say NO! They don't allow for ANY substitutions. Well thats not a substitution - thats taking something out - ummm why because I have high cholesterol. So what does one do who has these kind of health problems...ummm my solution is to go to another breakfast spot. I tried the scrambler anyhow and all I kept asking my husband was.."Is this egg beaters - are they serious?" I gave up in the end, we tried it, decided to never come back but let me stop by the restroom on my way out. OMG - you have to walk through the kitchen to this little bathroom which is basically ONLY a toilet and very very dirty. After seeing that I kept thinking is that bathroom even legal???? What about if someone handicapped needs to use the restroom - my answer again - leave and find another breakfast spot. The wait is totally not worth it and the food is disgusting and the service needs some serious work!!!! Just think of this and then decide to go: NO SUBSTITUTIONS, NO TAKING ANYTHING OUT NO MATTER WHAT YOU KNOW YOU CAN'T OR SHOULDN'T HAVE, NO EGG WHITES, NO EGG DISHES OTHER THAN SCRAMBLERS, CASH ONLY...

How many restrictions can you possibly put on a customer - I mean,  remember I am paying you!
author: SF Gal ..

description: I USED to think Chloe's was 5 Stars.  I went religiously with my honey and ordered the same thing every time-the potato cheddar onion scramble.  It WAS amazing.  They have a new chef who doesn't cook the same.  The onions were not caramalized as before, the potaoes weren't as cooked.  Basically, it changed the whole flavor of the dish.  Do caramalized onions make a difference?  Really, they do.  I hope the chef reads this, because I don't ever want to go back again after tasting his version.  just cook them longer please!
author: End W.

description: On weekends people crowd around this place like the papparazi around Britney's house.  The food is superb and you'll never go wrong ordering anything with jarlsberg cheese on it.  My only complaints are that there will be a long wait for a table and their mugs are thick, Denny's style mugs- a place called Chloe's should have coffee mugs of a more demure nature.
author: pauline e.

description: At least once a month, my kids will be town and there is only one place they want to eat Breakfast at, and while yes there is usually a wait, they don't mind waiting for Chloes. I've got to admit it, I always feel so spoiled because our local breakfast place is this gem. This is by far and away the most consistent restaurant I'v ever eaten at.. So yes I know it's crazy, but it is worth the wait. Enjoy!!
author: Ira S.

description: ok, it's a good brunch.  that's no lie.  but the level of rudeness of the staff--and the interminable wait--made it completely not worth it.  if you're into bitchy hipsters, chole's is for you.  otherwise, you're just as well making your own french toast at home.  honestly.  i don't get the hype. bad service, bad experience.
author: K H.

description: the food was ok...even though they didn't bring out  what i ordered, and did nothing to compensate. the service was bad despite there being 4 servers for the 15 table restaurant. you'd think having that many servers on at once, i could get my coffee refilled without having to ask. probably won't return. i'll stick to boogaloos.
author: jackee p.

description: my favorite brunch place in sf. only downer is the wait.  they're really busy and not that adequately staffed, but for me its all about the food. yum!
author: M K.

description: great breakfast joint, love the fact that they use smoked paprika with their potatos.
author: Tim G.

description: substance over style. food is always excellent and the people are nice. best pancakes ever
author: Noe K.
